original: phan tshun 'dres shing dra ba 'am skar khung dra ba can dang 'dra bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'dres shing dra ba 'am skar khung dra ba can dang 'dra bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: They are connected to each other and are like a lattice or a window screen.

original: chu ba chen po bcu drug ni //
analyzed: chu ba chen po bcu drug ni //
translated: There are sixteen major channels.

original: de las rkang pa dang lag pa gnyis gnyis te brgyad dang // rgyab dang mgrin par bzhi ste brgyad dang bcu drug go //
analyzed: de las rkang pa dang lag pa gnyis gnyis te brgyad dang // rgyab dang mgrin par bzhi ste brgyad dang bcu drug go //
translated: There are eight major channels in the two legs and two arms, and eight in the back and neck, making sixteen.

original: de yang chu ba chen po che zhing zlum pa la chu ba chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chu ba chen po che zhing zlum pa la chu ba chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, a major channel is called a major channel because it is large and round.

original: pir 'dra drug dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pir 'dra drug dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are six like a brush.

original: rkang pa gnyis dang lag pa gnyis dang rked pa dang pho mtshan te drug la pir 'dra ba'i rtsa rgyus yod pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa gnyis dang lag pa gnyis dang rked pa dang pho mtshan te drug la pir 'dra ba'i rtsa rgyus yod pa'o //
translated: There are six places where there are channels like a brush: the two legs, the two arms, the waist, and the penis.

original: srubs 'dra bdun //
analyzed: srubs 'dra bdun //
translated: There are seven like a seam.

original: pho mtshan lce dang mgo la brten //
analyzed: pho mtshan lce dang mgo la brten //
translated: The penis and the tongue are supported by the head.

original: de dag gtsags bus gdab mi rung //🔽zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de dag gtsags bus gdab mi rung // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: They should not be pricked with a needle.

original: 'di la srubs 'dra ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas ni bdun yod de /
analyzed: 'di la srubs 'dra ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas ni bdun yod de /
translated: There are seven places where there are channels like a seam.

original: de las lnga ni mgo la brten la /
analyzed: de las lnga ni mgo la brten la /
translated: Five of them are supported by the head.

original: lce dang pho mtshan la re re brten pa ste /
analyzed: lce dang pho mtshan la re re brten pa ste /
translated: One is supported by the tongue and one by the penis.

original: de ltar bdun po thams cad gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung bas der mtshon gyi las mi bya'o //🔽sha yi thag pa rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: de ltar bdun po thams cad gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung bas der mtshon gyi las mi bya'o // sha yi thag pa rnam pa bzhi //
translated: Since all seven of these are unsuitable to be pricked with a needle, one should not engage in the activity of weapons there.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are four types of flesh connections.

original: lus 'di lta bu'i sha rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: lus 'di lta bu'i sha rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: In this body there are four types of flesh.

original: rgyab kyi sgal tshigs kyi ngos gnyis na sha'i sbrel mtshams su gyur ba yod de /
analyzed: rgyab kyi sgal tshigs kyi ngos gnyis na sha'i sbrel mtshams su gyur ba yod de /
translated: There are two flesh connections on each side of the spine.

original: de las kyang gnyis ni phyi rol na gnas la gnyis ni nang na gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de las kyang gnyis ni phyi rol na gnas la gnyis ni nang na gnas pa yin no //
translated: Two of these are located externally and two are located internally.

original: rus pa'i tshogs 'dus bcu bzhi yod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rus pa'i tshogs 'dus bcu bzhi yod // ces bya ba la /
translated: There are fourteen collections of bones.

original: lus 'di la rus pa'i tshogs 'dus shing 'dus shing phrad pa ni bcu bzhi yod de /
analyzed: lus 'di la rus pa'i tshogs 'dus shing 'dus shing phrad pa ni bcu bzhi yod de /
translated: In this body there are fourteen collections of bones that are assembled, gathered, and joined.

original: de dag kyang 'di ltar long mo dang pus mo dang brla rtsa dang mkhrig ma dang gru mo dang dpung mgo'i bar gnyis gnyis dang / mjug do dang mgo bo rnams su re re yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'di ltar long mo dang pus mo dang brla rtsa dang mkhrig ma dang gru mo dang dpung mgo'i bar gnyis gnyis dang / mjug do dang mgo bo rnams su re re yin no //
translated: These are the two ankle bones, the two knee bones, the two thigh bones, the two hip bones, the two shoulder bones, the two upper arm bones, the two collar bones, the two breast bones, and the skull bone.

original: mtshams ni dgu phrag gnyis yod la //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshams ni dgu phrag gnyis yod la //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are two groups of nine joints.

original: lus 'di la sbrel mtshams dgu phrag gnyis te bco brgyad yod do //
analyzed: lus 'di la sbrel mtshams dgu phrag gnyis te bco brgyad yod do //
translated: This body has two groups of nine joints, making eighteen.

original: de yang mgo bo la lnga /
analyzed: de yang mgo bo la lnga /
translated: There are five in the head,

original: mjug dol gcig / long mo gnyis la gnyis /🔽brla gnyis su gnyis /🔽pus mo gnyis la gnyis /🔽gru mo gnyis su gnyis /
analyzed: mjug dol gcig / long mo gnyis la gnyis / brla gnyis su gnyis / pus mo gnyis la gnyis / gru mo gnyis su gnyis /
translated: one in the tail, two in the ankles,🔽two in the knees,🔽two in the elbows,

original: dpung mgo gnyis na gnyis so //
analyzed: dpung mgo gnyis na gnyis so //
translated: and two in the shoulders.

original: so dang sen mor bcas par yi ;
analyzed: so dang sen mor bcas par yi ;
translated: Together with the teeth and nails,

original: / rus pa sum brgya drug cu yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / rus pa sum brgya drug cu yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: there are three hundred and sixty bones.

original: lus 'di la rus pa sum brgya drug cu yod de /
analyzed: lus 'di la rus pa sum brgya drug cu yod de /
translated: In this body there are three hundred and sixty bones.

original: de yang yan lag la rus pa brgya bzhi bcu /
analyzed: de yang yan lag la rus pa brgya bzhi bcu /
translated: There are one hundred and forty in the limbs,

original: khog pa la rus pa brgya nyi shu /
analyzed: khog pa la rus pa brgya nyi shu /
translated: one hundred and twenty in the trunk,

original: mgo bo la rus pa brgya ste /
analyzed: mgo bo la rus pa brgya ste /
translated: and one hundred in the head.

original: de ltar sum brgya drug cu yod pa yang so dang sen mo dang bcas pa bgrangs @33b pa yin gyi lus 'ba' zhig gi ni ma yin no //🔽thang la 'bar ni sum brgyar 'dod //
analyzed: de ltar sum brgya drug cu yod pa yang so dang sen mo dang bcas pa bgrangs @33b pa yin gyi lus 'ba' zhig gi ni ma yin no // thang la 'bar ni sum brgyar 'dod //
translated: Thus there are three hundred and sixty. This also includes the teeth and nails, but not the body alone.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: It is held that there are three hundred on the plain.

original: drang srong thang la 'bar gyis ni lus 'di la rus pa sum brgyar yod bar 'dod do //
analyzed: drang srong thang la 'bar gyis ni lus 'di la rus pa sum brgyar yod bar 'dod do //
translated: The sage Thang la 'bar asserts that there are three hundred bones in this body.

original: tshigs ni nyis brgya rtsa bcur 'dod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: tshigs ni nyis brgya rtsa bcur 'dod // ces bya ba la /
translated: There are two hundred and ten joints.

original: lus 'di la rus pa'i tshigs ni nyis brgya dang bcu yod do //
analyzed: lus 'di la rus pa'i tshigs ni nyis brgya dang bcu yod do //

original: de dag las ni yan lag la ni rus pa'i tshigs drug cu rtsa brgyad yod la /
analyzed: de dag las ni yan lag la ni rus pa'i tshigs drug cu rtsa brgyad yod la /
translated: Among them, there are sixty-eight joints in the limbs,

original: khog pa la lnga bcu rtsa dgu /
analyzed: khog pa la lnga bcu rtsa dgu /

original: nam tshong yan la brgyad cu rtsa gsum mo //🔽rgyun shes bus ni tshigs kyi grangs //
analyzed: nam tshong yan la brgyad cu rtsa gsum mo // rgyun shes bus ni tshigs kyi grangs //

original: nyis stong dag ni yod bar 'dod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: nyis stong dag ni yod bar 'dod // ces bya ba la /
translated: The son of Ātreya asserts that there are two thousand joints.

original: drang srong rgyun shes kyi bus ni rus pa'i tshigs kyi grangs nyis stong yod bar 'dod cing ston gyis nyis brgya rtsa bcu ni ma yin no zhes bshad /
analyzed: drang srong rgyun shes kyi bus ni rus pa'i tshigs kyi grangs nyis stong yod bar 'dod cing ston gyis nyis brgya rtsa bcu ni ma yin no zhes bshad /

original: de'i bzhed kyis rus pa dang rgyus pa dang sha'i mtshams dang bcas par grangs ni spyir nyis stong yod par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bzhed kyis rus pa dang rgyus pa dang sha'i mtshams dang bcas par grangs ni spyir nyis stong yod par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: He asserts that in general there are two thousand joints, counting the joints of bones, ligaments, and flesh.

original: rgyus pa dgu brgya /
analyzed: rgyus pa dgu brgya /
translated: There are nine hundred ligaments.

original: zhes pa lus 'di la rgyus pa dgu brgya yod de ;
analyzed: zhes pa lus 'di la rgyus pa dgu brgya yod de ;
translated: There are nine hundred ligaments in this body.

original: de yang yan lag rnams la sum brgya /🔽khog pa la sum brgya /
analyzed: de yang yan lag rnams la sum brgya / khog pa la sum brgya /
translated: There are three hundred in the limbs,🔽three hundred in the torso,

original: nam tshong yan chad du sum brgya'o //
analyzed: nam tshong yan chad du sum brgya'o //
translated: and three hundred in the neck and above.

original: skyes pa la /
analyzed: skyes pa la /
translated: In males,

original: sha ni spar tshad lnga brgya yod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: sha ni spar tshad lnga brgya yod // ces bya ba la /
translated: there are five hundred ounces of flesh.

original: skyes pa la sha spar tshad lnga brgya yod do //
analyzed: skyes pa la sha spar tshad lnga brgya yod do //
translated: In males, there are five hundred ounces of flesh.

analyzed: de las kyang yan lag la ni sha mtshams bzhi brgya yod la /
translated: Of that, there are four hundred ounces of flesh in the limbs,

original: khog pa la drug cu /
analyzed: khog pa la drug cu /
translated: sixty in the torso,

original: nam tshong yan tshad bzhi bcu yod par 'dod do /🔽bud med kyi ni nu ma dang // mo mtshan la gnas nyi shu lhag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: nam tshong yan tshad bzhi bcu yod par 'dod do / bud med kyi ni nu ma dang // mo mtshan la gnas nyi shu lhag / ces bya ba la /
translated: and forty in the neck and above.🔽In females, there are twenty more ounces of flesh in the breasts and genitals.

original: bud med la ni sha'i spar tshad nyi shu lhag par 'dod do //
analyzed: bud med la ni sha'i spar tshad nyi shu lhag par 'dod do //

original: de las kyang nu ma la bcu yod la /
analyzed: de las kyang nu ma la bcu yod la /

original: bcu ni mo mtshan mngal la yod do //
analyzed: bcu ni mo mtshan mngal la yod do //
translated: and ten in the genitals and womb.

original: rtsa chen rtsa ba snying la gnas //
analyzed: rtsa chen rtsa ba snying la gnas //
translated: The major channels are rooted in the heart,

original: de dag kun gyis lus la khyab //
analyzed: de dag kun gyis lus la khyab //
translated: and all of them pervade the body.

original: dangs ma'i bdag nyid mdangs su gyur //
analyzed: dangs ma'i bdag nyid mdangs su gyur //
translated: The essence is transformed into radiance.

original: de ni phra ba kun dang 'brel //
analyzed: de ni phra ba kun dang 'brel //
translated: It is connected with all the subtle channels.

original: rtsa ba sbom zhing rtse rab phra //
analyzed: rtsa ba sbom zhing rtse rab phra //
translated: The root is thick and the tip is very fine.

original: lo ma'i rtsa ltar gyes pa yin //
analyzed: lo ma'i rtsa ltar gyes pa yin //
translated: It divides like the root of a leaf.

original: gyes pa de las rtsa phran ni //
analyzed: gyes pa de las rtsa phran ni //
translated: From that division, there are

original: bdun brgya dag tu gyur ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdun brgya dag tu gyur ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: seven hundred subtle channels.

original: snying gar gnas pas na snying gnas te /
analyzed: snying gar gnas pas na snying gnas te /
translated: The one that abides in the heart is the heart-abiding.

original: rtsa'i gtso bo'am /
analyzed: rtsa'i gtso bo'am /
translated: It is the principal channel,

original: rtsa ba bcu po snying la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: rtsa ba bcu po snying la gnas pa yin /
translated: or the ten channels that abide in the heart.

original: de las gyes pa yin pas lus thams cad khyab cing dangs ma'i rang bzhin du kha zas smin par 'gyur pa las /
analyzed: de las gyes pa yin pas lus thams cad khyab cing dangs ma'i rang bzhin du kha zas smin par 'gyur pa las /
translated: Since it divides from that, it pervades the entire body and ripens food into the nature of the essence.

original: de'i snying por gyur ba mdangs zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i snying por gyur ba mdangs zhes bya bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The essence of that becomes what is called “radiance.”

original: de bzhin du lus kyi bya ba thams cad de dang 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi bya ba thams cad de dang 'brel pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, all the activities of the body are connected with that.

original: de yang @34a * //
analyzed: de yang @34a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: rtsa ba spom zhing che la rtse mo ni rab tu phra zhing shin tu phra mor gyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa ba spom zhing che la rtse mo ni rab tu phra zhing shin tu phra mor gyes pa yin no //
translated: the root is thick and large, and the tip is very fine and extremely subtle.

original: de yang lo ma'i rtsa ba ltar gyes pa yin te //
analyzed: de yang lo ma'i rtsa ba ltar gyes pa yin te //
translated: It divides like the root of a leaf.

original: sor gnyis dang sor gcig dang sor phyed dang nas dang nas kyi phyed tsam du gyes shing lo ma'i 'dab ma gyes pa ltar 'dra bar gnas shing du mar gyes pa yin no //
analyzed: sor gnyis dang sor gcig dang sor phyed dang nas dang nas kyi phyed tsam du gyes shing lo ma'i 'dab ma gyes pa ltar 'dra bar gnas shing du mar gyes pa yin no //
translated: They branch out two finger-widths, one finger-width, a half finger-width, a barley grain, and a half barley grain in size, and they are situated like the leaves of a tree, branching out into many.

original: de bas na rtsa phran de rnams ni bdun brgya yod pa yin no //🔽de la yan lag re re zhing //
analyzed: de bas na rtsa phran de rnams ni bdun brgya yod pa yin no // de la yan lag re re zhing //
translated: Therefore, there are seven hundred of these minor channels.🔽In each of those,

original: brgyad brgyad der ni gnas pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brgyad brgyad der ni gnas pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: there are eight.

original: des na yan lag bzhi bzhi brgyad yod do //
analyzed: des na yan lag bzhi bzhi brgyad yod do //
translated: Thus, there are four sets of eight.

original: yan lag re re zhing rtsa brgyad brgyad yod do //
analyzed: yan lag re re zhing rtsa brgyad brgyad yod do //
translated: In each of those, there are eight channels.

original: zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: de la dbug bar mi bya ba //
analyzed: de la dbug bar mi bya ba //
translated: One should not pierce the one

original: rtsa yi dra ba 'dzin zhes bya //
analyzed: rtsa yi dra ba 'dzin zhes bya //
translated: that holds the network of channels.

original: nang na gnas pa'i gsum po yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nang na gnas pa'i gsum po yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the inner of the three.

original: rtsa brgyad po de dag gi nang nas dra ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i rtsa'i dra ba gong du bshad pa de dag 'dzin pa'i rten la gtsags pus gdab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa brgyad po de dag gi nang nas dra ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i rtsa'i dra ba gong du bshad pa de dag 'dzin pa'i rten la gtsags pus gdab par mi bya ste /
translated: Of those eight channels, one should not pierce the one called “holder of the network of channels,” which is the support for holding the network of channels explained above.

original: de lta bu'i rtsa dang nang na gnas pa'i rtsa gsum ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtsa dang nang na gnas pa'i rtsa gsum ste /
translated: The three channels that exist within the body are as follows.🔽

original: rtsa bzhi po mtshon gyis gdab cing gtsags bus dbug tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rtsa bzhi po mtshon gyis gdab cing gtsags bus dbug tu mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to stab or pierce with a needle the four channels, namely, the three channels that exist inside the body and the one that exists outside.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa la brla dang dpung pa'i rtsa gnyis dbug tu mi rung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa la brla dang dpung pa'i rtsa gnyis dbug tu mi rung ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, it is not suitable to stab the two channels of the thighs and the two channels of the shoulders.

original: rked par bcu drug phrag gnyis te //
analyzed: rked par bcu drug phrag gnyis te //
translated: Two sets of sixteen at the waist.

original: de las brla'i rtsar gnyis gnyis dang // rked pa'i gnad rnams gnyis gnyis te //
analyzed: de las brla'i rtsar gnyis gnyis dang // rked pa'i gnad rnams gnyis gnyis te //
translated: Two in the thigh channels and two in the waist vital points.

original: de brgyad gtsags bus gdab mi bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de brgyad gtsags bus gdab mi bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Do not stab those eight with a needle.

original: rked pa'i gnas dang rtsa bcu drug phrag gnyis te sum cu rtsa gnyis yod pa la /
analyzed: rked pa'i gnas dang rtsa bcu drug phrag gnyis te sum cu rtsa gnyis yod pa la /
translated: In the place of the waist there are two sets of sixteen channels, making thirty-two.

original: rtsa de dag gi nang nas brla'i rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / rked pa gzhon nu rtsa gnyis gnyis te gnad kyi rtsa brgyad po de dag la gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung bas na mtshon gyi las mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa de dag gi nang nas brla'i rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / rked pa gzhon nu rtsa gnyis gnyis te gnad kyi rtsa brgyad po de dag la gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung bas na mtshon gyi las mi bya'o //
translated: From among those channels, two in the thigh channels and two in the youthful waist channels, making eight vital point channels, are not suitable to be stabbed with a needle, so do not perform the act of stabbing with a weapon.

original: zhes bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don no //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: rtsib logs gnyis la rtsa bcu drug / de las gyen 'gro zhes bya spang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsib logs gnyis la rtsa bcu drug / de las gyen 'gro zhes bya spang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: On the two sides there are sixteen channels.🔽The ones that go upwards are to be avoided.

original: rtsib logs gnyis gnyis la rtsa bcu drug yod pa las /
analyzed: rtsib logs gnyis gnyis la rtsa bcu drug yod pa las /
translated: On the two sides there are sixteen channels.

original: de las gyen du 'gro ba'i rtsib logs kyi mtshams na gnas pa zhes bya ba la gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de las gyen du 'gro ba'i rtsib logs kyi mtshams na gnas pa zhes bya ba la gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung ngo //
translated: The ones that go upwards are located at the edge of the side. They are to be avoided.

original: rgyab tu rtsa ni nyi shu bzhi //
analyzed: rgyab tu rtsa ni nyi shu bzhi //
translated: In the back there are twenty-four channels.

original: sgal tshigs kyi ni ngos gnyis na //
analyzed: sgal tshigs kyi ni ngos gnyis na //
translated: On both sides of the spine

original: de las gnyis gnyis gyen 'gro ba //
analyzed: de las gnyis gnyis gyen 'gro ba //
translated: two by two go upwards.

original: mtshon gyis gdab par mi bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshon gyis gdab par mi bya'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are to be avoided.

original: rgyab na gnas pa'i rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa de las sgal tshigs kyi ngos gnyis na rtsa gnyis gnyis yod @34b pa gyen du 'gro ba'i rtsa bzhi ni gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rgyab na gnas pa'i rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa de las sgal tshigs kyi ngos gnyis na rtsa gnyis gnyis yod @34b pa gyen du 'gro ba'i rtsa bzhi ni gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung ngo //
translated: In the back there are twenty-four channels. On both sides of the spine there are two channels each. The four channels that go upwards are to be avoided.

original: rgyab bzhin lto na gnas rtsa de //
analyzed: rgyab bzhin lto na gnas rtsa de //
translated: In the belly there are channels like those in the back.

original: pho mtshan steng na gnas pa dang // spu yi phreng ba'i ngos gnyis rtsa //
analyzed: pho mtshan steng na gnas pa dang // spu yi phreng ba'i ngos gnyis rtsa //
translated: Those located above the penis and the two channels on both sides of the line of hair🔽are to be avoided.

original: gnyis gnyis mtshon gyis mi gdab bo //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyis gnyis mtshon gyis mi gdab bo // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not pierce the two pairs.

original: rgyab kyi sgal tshigs kyi rtsa dang 'dra bar lto la nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: rgyab kyi sgal tshigs kyi rtsa dang 'dra bar lto la nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod de /
translated: In the belly there are twenty-four channels like the vertebrae of the back.

original: rtsa de dag gi nang na pho mtshan gyi steng na gnas pa'i rtsa dang / spu'i phreng ba'i ngos gnyis na gnas pa'i rtsa gnyis gnyis mtshon gyis gdab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa de dag gi nang na pho mtshan gyi steng na gnas pa'i rtsa dang / spu'i phreng ba'i ngos gnyis na gnas pa'i rtsa gnyis gnyis mtshon gyis gdab par mi bya'o //
translated: Among those channels, one should not pierce the two pairs of channels located above the male organ and on both sides of the line of hair.

original: brang la gnas pa bzhi bcu las //
analyzed: brang la gnas pa bzhi bcu las //
translated: Of the forty in the chest,

original: bcu bzhi dbug par mi bya ste //
analyzed: bcu bzhi dbug par mi bya ste //
translated: one should not pierce fourteen.

original: nu 'jing de yi rtsa ba dang // snying ga dag ni so sor gnyis //🔽gnod bral gnad ni gnyis pa dang // mi gsal zhes bya gnyis kyi gnyis //
analyzed: nu 'jing de yi rtsa ba dang // snying ga dag ni so sor gnyis // gnod bral gnad ni gnyis pa dang // mi gsal zhes bya gnyis kyi gnyis //
translated: The two at the base of the breasts, the two at the heart,🔽the two at the base of the armpits, and the two at the base of the collar bone.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two of the second vital point free from harm, the two of the one called unclear,

original: brang la rtsa bzhi bcu gnas te /
analyzed: brang la rtsa bzhi bcu gnas te /
translated: In the chest there are forty channels.

original: de rnams kyi nang nas rtsa bcu bzhi gang yod pa de dag tu dbug cing dbral bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang nas rtsa bcu bzhi gang yod pa de dag tu dbug cing dbral bar mi bya'o //
translated: Among those, one should not pierce or cut the fourteen that exist there.

original: de yang gang dag ce na /
analyzed: de yang gang dag ce na /
translated: What are they?

original: nu ma'i rtse mo'i rtsa gnyis dang / snying ga'i rtsa gnyis dang / gnod bral zhes bya ba'i gnad dang / mi gsal zhes bya ba'i gnad dang re re la yang gnyis gnyis te de ltar bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: nu ma'i rtse mo'i rtsa gnyis dang / snying ga'i rtsa gnyis dang / gnod bral zhes bya ba'i gnad dang / mi gsal zhes bya ba'i gnad dang re re la yang gnyis gnyis te de ltar bcu bzhi'o //
translated: Two channels at the tip of the breast, two channels at the heart, the vital point called “free from harm,” the vital point called “unclear,” and two for each of those, thus fourteen.

original: mgrin pa ltag pa 'dra ba las //
analyzed: mgrin pa ltag pa 'dra ba las //
translated: In the throat, like the nape of the neck,

original: sngon po mjing pa ltag pa dang // 'gal ba dang ni ma mo brgyad //
analyzed: sngon po mjing pa ltag pa dang // 'gal ba dang ni ma mo brgyad //
translated: blue, the nape of the neck, the opposing, and the eight mothers,

original: bcu drug yongs su spang bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bcu drug yongs su spang bar bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: sixteen are to be avoided.

original: mgrin pa na ltag pa dang 'dra bar nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: mgrin pa na ltag pa dang 'dra bar nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod de /
translated: In the throat, like the nape of the neck, there are twenty-four.

original: de las sngon po zhes bya ba'i gnad kyi rtsa gnyis dang / mjing pa'i rtsa gnyis dang ltag pa'i rtsa gnyis dang / 'gal pa zhes bya ba'i gnad kyi rtsa gnyis dang / ma mo zhes bya ba brgyad de ;
analyzed: de las sngon po zhes bya ba'i gnad kyi rtsa gnyis dang / mjing pa'i rtsa gnyis dang ltag pa'i rtsa gnyis dang / 'gal pa zhes bya ba'i gnad kyi rtsa gnyis dang / ma mo zhes bya ba brgyad de ;
translated: Of those, two channels of the vital point called “blue,” two channels of the neck, two channels of the nape of the neck, two channels of the vital point called “opposing,” and eight called “mothers,”

original: de ltar rtsa bcu drug po gtsags bus mi gdab par spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtsa bcu drug po gtsags bus mi gdab par spang bar bya'o //
translated: thus sixteen channels are to be avoided without being pierced by a needle.

original: 'gram pa bcu drug de las gnyis //
analyzed: 'gram pa bcu drug de las gnyis //
translated: Sixteen cheeks, two of those,

original: mtshams ni 'brel bar byed pa spang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshams ni 'brel bar byed pa spang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The “junctions” are the two channels that connect the two sides.

original: 'gram pa gnyis la rtsa bcu drug po yod de /
analyzed: 'gram pa gnyis la rtsa bcu drug po yod de /
translated: The two sides of the mouth have sixteen channels each.

original: de las mtshams 'brel bar byed pa'i rtsa gnyis gtsags bus mi gdab par spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las mtshams 'brel bar byed pa'i rtsa gnyis gtsags bus mi gdab par spang bar bya'o //
translated: Of those, the two channels that connect the two sides should not be pierced, and are therefore to be avoided.

original: lce yang 'gram pa dang 'dra ste //🔽'og gi ro tshor byed gnyis dang // tshig 'byin byed pa gnyis po spang //
analyzed: lce yang 'gram pa dang 'dra ste // 'og gi ro tshor byed gnyis dang // tshig 'byin byed pa gnyis po spang //
translated: The tongue is similar to the mouth.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The two channels that experience taste below, and the two that produce speech, should be avoided.

original: lce la yang 'gram pa dang 'dra bar rtsa bcu drug yod de /
analyzed: lce la yang 'gram pa dang 'dra bar rtsa bcu drug yod de /
translated: The tongue has sixteen channels, just like the mouth.

original: rtsa de rnams kyi nang nas lce'i 'og gi rtsa ro tshor bar byed pa gnyis dang / @35a * //
analyzed: rtsa de rnams kyi nang nas lce'i 'og gi rtsa ro tshor bar byed pa gnyis dang / @35a * //
translated: Of those, the two channels that experience taste below, and

original: de bzhin du tshig 'byin par byed pa'i rtsa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig 'byin par byed pa'i rtsa gnyis yod de /
translated: similarly the two channels that produce speech,

original: bzhi po de dag gcags bus mi gdab par spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag gcags bus mi gdab par spang bar bya'o //
translated: should not be pierced, and are therefore to be avoided.

original: sna yi rtsa ni nyi shu bzhi //
analyzed: sna yi rtsa ni nyi shu bzhi //
translated: The nose has twenty-four channels.

original: de las dri tshor byad gnyis dang // rkan du 'gro ba'i rtsa gcig spang //
analyzed: de las dri tshor byad gnyis dang // rkan du 'gro ba'i rtsa gcig spang //
translated: Of those, the two that experience smell, and the one that goes to the palate, should be avoided.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The tongue is similar to the mouth.

original: sna'i rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: sna'i rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are twenty-four channels of the nose.

original: de las sna'i gnyis ni dri tshor zhing snom par byed pas rtsa de gnyis dbug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de las sna'i gnyis ni dri tshor zhing snom par byed pas rtsa de gnyis dbug par mi bya'o //
translated: Of those, the two channels of the nose are for smelling and inhaling.

original: de bzhin du sna'i rtsa rkan du 'gro ba gcig yod pa de yang gtsags bus mi gdab pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sna'i rtsa rkan du 'gro ba gcig yod pa de yang gtsags bus mi gdab pa ste /
translated: Similarly, there is one channel of the nose that goes to the palate.

original: de ltar gsum spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsum spang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, three should be avoided.🔽The two eyes have fifty-six,

original: mig gnyis kyi ni lnga bcu drug /'byed dang 'dzums pa'i las byed pa //
analyzed: mig gnyis kyi ni lnga bcu drug /'byed dang 'dzums pa'i las byed pa //
translated: which perform the functions of opening and closing.

original: gnyis gnyis dang ni mig 'gram gnyis //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis dang ni mig 'gram gnyis //
translated: Two pairs and two eye corners

original: drug po de dag spang bar bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: drug po de dag spang bar bya'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are the six that should be avoided.

original: mig gnyis la rtsa lnga bcu rtsa drug yod de /
analyzed: mig gnyis la rtsa lnga bcu rtsa drug yod de /
translated: The two eyes have fifty-six channels.

original: de rnams las mig 'dzums pa dang 'byed par byed pa'i rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / de bzhin du mig 'gram gyi rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: de rnams las mig 'dzums pa dang 'byed par byed pa'i rtsa gnyis gnyis dang / de bzhin du mig 'gram gyi rtsa gnyis te /
translated: Of those, there are two pairs of channels that open and close the eyes, and similarly, there are two channels of the eye corners.

original: de ltar drug po de dag gtsags bus mi gdab ste spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar drug po de dag gtsags bus mi gdab ste spang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, those six should be avoided and not pierced with a needle.

original: mig dang snar gnas dpral ba la //
analyzed: mig dang snar gnas dpral ba la //
translated: The channels located in the eyes and nose

original: brten pa'i rtsa ni drug cu las //
analyzed: brten pa'i rtsa ni drug cu las //
translated: are supported on the forehead.

original: gzhag pa gcig dang gtsug gi gnyis //
analyzed: gzhag pa gcig dang gtsug gi gnyis //
translated: One is located in the forehead, two in the crown,

original: skra mtshams gnas pa'i rtsa bzhi ste //
analyzed: skra mtshams gnas pa'i rtsa bzhi ste //
translated: and four at the hairline.

original: bdun po de dag mtshon gdab spang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdun po de dag mtshon gdab spang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: These seven are to be avoided when piercing.

original: mig dang snar gnas shing brten pa'i rtsa dpral bar 'dus pa bcu drug yod de /
analyzed: mig dang snar gnas shing brten pa'i rtsa dpral bar 'dus pa bcu drug yod de /
translated: There are sixteen channels that are located in and support the eyes and nose and converge in the forehead.

original: rtsa de rnams kyi nang nas gzhag pa zhes bya ba gnad kyi rtsa gcig dang gtsug 'khyil ba'i gnad kyi rtsa gnyis dang / de bzhin du skra mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi ste bdun po de dag la gtsags bus gdab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa de rnams kyi nang nas gzhag pa zhes bya ba gnad kyi rtsa gcig dang gtsug 'khyil ba'i gnad kyi rtsa gnyis dang / de bzhin du skra mtshams kyi rtsa bzhi ste bdun po de dag la gtsags bus gdab par mi bya'o //
translated: Among these channels, one is called the “located” channel, which is a vital channel, two are vital channels of the crown channel-wheel, and four are channels at the hairline. These seven are to be avoided when piercing with a needle.

original: rna bar bcu drug de las 'dir //
analyzed: rna bar bcu drug de las 'dir //
translated: Sixteen are in the ears, and of these,

original: sgra thos byed pa'i rtsa gnyis spang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra thos byed pa'i rtsa gnyis spang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: two are to be avoided for hearing sounds.

original: rna ba la rtsa bcu drug yod de /🔽de dag las sgra thos par byed pa'i rtsa gnyis po la mtshon gyis mi gdab bo //
analyzed: rna ba la rtsa bcu drug yod de / de dag las sgra thos par byed pa'i rtsa gnyis po la mtshon gyis mi gdab bo //
translated: There are sixteen channels in the ears.

original: de nyid las ni mur 'gram gyi //
analyzed: de nyid las ni mur 'gram gyi //
translated: Of these, two are channels for hearing sounds, and these two are to be avoided when piercing with a weapon.

original: mtshams su 'gro ba gnyis po spang //
analyzed: mtshams su 'gro ba gnyis po spang //
translated: Two are to be avoided at the jawline

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: in the same place.

original: rna ba la brten pa'i rtsa bcu drug po de las mur 'gram gyi mtshams su 'gro ba'i rtsa gnyis po la mtshon gyis mi gdab bo //🔽spyi bor bcu gnyis de las ni //
analyzed: rna ba la brten pa'i rtsa bcu drug po de las mur 'gram gyi mtshams su 'gro ba'i rtsa gnyis po la mtshon gyis mi gdab bo // spyi bor bcu gnyis de las ni //
translated: Of those sixteen nāḍīs that are based in the ears, do not pierce the two nāḍīs that go to the corners of the mouth.🔽Twelve are in the head.

original: gyen 'gro skra mtshams bdag po las //
analyzed: gyen 'gro skra mtshams bdag po las //
translated: Of those, the two nāḍīs that go upward and the one nāḍī of the crest

original: so so'i re re spang bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so so'i re re spang bar bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are to be avoided.

original: spyi bor gnas pa'i rtsa bcu gnyis yod de /
analyzed: spyi bor gnas pa'i rtsa bcu gnyis yod de /
translated: There are twelve nāḍīs located in the head.

original: de dag las kyang gyen du 'gro @35b ba'am 'degs pa zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis kyi rtsa re re dang / skra mtshams kyi rtsa lnga po re re dang / bdag po zhes bya ba'i gnad kyi rtsa gcig ste /
analyzed: de dag las kyang gyen du 'gro @35b ba'am 'degs pa zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis kyi rtsa re re dang / skra mtshams kyi rtsa lnga po re re dang / bdag po zhes bya ba'i gnad kyi rtsa gcig ste /
translated: Of those, one nāḍī of each of the two nāḍīs that go upward and the five nāḍīs of the crest and the one nāḍī of the nāḍī called lord are to be avoided.

original: de ltar mgo bo'i rtsa la gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar mgo bo'i rtsa la gtsags bus gdab tu mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, the nāḍīs of the head are not to be pierced with a needle.

original: spang zhing dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: spang zhing dor bar bya'o //
translated: They are to be avoided and left alone.

original: de ltar yan lag re re'i rtsa'i //🔽dbye ba dbug min shes phyir bshad //
analyzed: de ltar yan lag re re'i rtsa'i // dbye ba dbug min shes phyir bshad //
translated: The divisions of the nāḍīs of each limb

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: are explained for the sake of knowing which are to be pierced and which are not.

original: rnam pa de ltar na yan lag re re'i rtsa'i dbye ba dbug tu mi rung ba dang rung ba shes par bya ba'i phyir so so'i dbye ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de ltar na yan lag re re'i rtsa'i dbye ba dbug tu mi rung ba dang rung ba shes par bya ba'i phyir so so'i dbye ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the individual classifications are explained in order to understand which channels of each limb are suitable and unsuitable for piercing.

original: de las lus la dbug mi rung //
analyzed: de las lus la dbug mi rung //
translated: Among those, do not pierce the body.

original: ma lus dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yod //🔽dog dang rtsa mdud shin tu phra //
analyzed: ma lus dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yod // dog dang rtsa mdud shin tu phra //
translated: There are ninety-eight in total.

original: yo dang tshigs la gnas mi dbug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: yo dang tshigs la gnas mi dbug / ces bya ba la /
translated: Do not pierce the constricted, knotted, or very fine channels,🔽The crooked, or those located in the joints.

original: lus kyi yan lag la dbug tu mi rung zhing gtsags bus gdab par mi bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus kyi yan lag la dbug tu mi rung zhing gtsags bus gdab par mi bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to not pierce or stab the limbs of the body,

original: ma lus pa mtha' dag bsdu ba la rtsa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yod do //
analyzed: ma lus pa mtha' dag bsdu ba la rtsa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad yod do //
translated: there are ninety-eight channels in total.

original: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis dbug tu mi rung ba de dag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rtsa gang dog cing gcig la gcig 'brel ba dang / rtsa mdud chags pa'i gnas dang / shin tu phra ba dang chung ba dang / ya yor gnas pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa de dag gis dbug tu mi rung ba de dag 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi rtsa gang dog cing gcig la gcig 'brel ba dang / rtsa mdud chags pa'i gnas dang / shin tu phra ba dang chung ba dang / ya yor gnas pa dang /
translated: Not only are those unsuitable for piercing by those aspects, but also any constricted channels that are connected to each other, the locations of knotted channels, very fine and small channels, and crooked channels,

original: de bzhin du rus pa'i tshigs la gnas shing brten pa gang yin pa de dag dbug cing gtsags bus gdab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rus pa'i tshigs la gnas shing brten pa gang yin pa de dag dbug cing gtsags bus gdab par mi bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should not pierce or stab those that are located in and supported by the joints of the bones.

original: rtsa ni bdun brgya de rnams las //
analyzed: rtsa ni bdun brgya de rnams las //
translated: There are seven hundred channels.

original: bzhi char phrag ni so sor rgyu //
analyzed: bzhi char phrag ni so sor rgyu //
translated: Each of the four humors moves through one quarter of them.

original: rlung dang mkhris pa bad kan khrag / nad med khrag ni de ltar gnas //
analyzed: rlung dang mkhris pa bad kan khrag / nad med khrag ni de ltar gnas //
translated: Wind, bile, phlegm, and blood remain in the body in this way.

original: de ni lus la phan 'dogs te //
analyzed: de ni lus la phan 'dogs te //
translated: They benefit the body

original: gzhan du gnod pa skyed par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan du gnod pa skyed par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and cause harm when they are otherwise.🔽Among the seven hundred channels, each of the four humors moves through one quarter of them, that is, through one hundred and seventy-five.

original: rtsa bdun brgya yod pa de rnams las rang rang gi bzhi cha ste brgya bdun cu rtsa lngar rlung re res mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi khrag dang nad med pa'i khrag so sor rgyu ba yin no //
analyzed: rtsa bdun brgya yod pa de rnams las rang rang gi bzhi cha ste brgya bdun cu rtsa lngar rlung re res mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi khrag dang nad med pa'i khrag so sor rgyu ba yin no //
translated: Thus, each of the humors moves through a different set of channels.

original: de ltar rlung la sogs pa'i nad gnas shing snyoms par 'jug pa'i ni lus la phan 'dogs shing gnas par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar rlung la sogs pa'i nad gnas shing snyoms par 'jug pa'i ni lus la phan 'dogs shing gnas par byed pa yin la /
translated: When the humors remain in balance, they benefit the body and maintain health.

original: gzhan du ste go rims 'chol zhing 'khrugs par gnas na lus la gnod pa skyed cing nad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ste go rims 'chol zhing 'khrugs par gnas na lus la gnod pa skyed cing nad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If they are in other places, in disorder, they cause harm to the body and become disease.

original: de la gnag dang dmar dang phra //
analyzed: de la gnag dang dmar dang phra //
translated: There, black, red, and thin,🔽filled and empty,

original: skad cig re re gang zhing stongs //🔽mgul ba rlung gi khrag rtsa yin //
analyzed: skad cig re re gang zhing stongs // mgul ba rlung gi khrag rtsa yin //
translated: in each moment,

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽rtsa de dag gi nang nas rtsa'i mdog gnag pa dang / dmar bar gnas pa dang / phra ba dang / skad cig re re zhing gang @36a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / rtsa de dag gi nang nas rtsa'i mdog gnag pa dang / dmar bar gnas pa dang / phra ba dang / skad cig re re zhing gang @36a * //
translated: the throat is the wind and blood channel.🔽In those channels, the color of the channels is black and red, thin, filled and empty,

original: zhing stongs pa ste /
analyzed: zhing stongs pa ste /
translated: in each moment.

original: rlung ni g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pas na lan 'ga' ni gang zhing rgyas par snang la /
analyzed: rlung ni g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid can yin pas na lan 'ga' ni gang zhing rgyas par snang la /
translated: Since wind has the characteristic of movement, sometimes it appears filled and full,🔽sometimes empty and hollow. In each moment, it changes.

original: lan 'ga' ni stong zhing khong stong gi tshul du skad cig re rer 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du rtsa gang shin tu 'gul zhing 'phar ba gang yin pa de ni rlung gi khrag rgyu ba'i rtsa yin no //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ni stong zhing khong stong gi tshul du skad cig re rer 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin du rtsa gang shin tu 'gul zhing 'phar ba gang yin pa de ni rlung gi khrag rgyu ba'i rtsa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the channel that moves and jumps a lot is the channel of the wind and blood.

original: reg tshe tsha zhing myur du rgyu //
analyzed: reg tshe tsha zhing myur du rgyu //
translated: When touched, it is hot and moves quickly.

original: mdog sngo ser por 'dug pa ni //
analyzed: mdog sngo ser por 'dug pa ni //
translated: The veins of bile-blood are blue or yellow.🔽The veins of phlegm-blood are white, shiny, stable, and cold.

original: mkhris pa'i khrag rtsa'i mtshan ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhris pa'i khrag rtsa'i mtshan ma yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The veins of combined blood are mixed.🔽The veins of bile-blood are those in which bile-blood flows. They are hot to the touch, and not cold.

original: mkhris pa'i khrag rgyu ba'i rtsa yin pa de ni reg na tsha ba 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa yin gyi grang bar gnas pa ma yin pa dang // de bzhin du myur du rgyu zhing 'bab pa dang / de bzhin du mdog sngon po'am /
analyzed: mkhris pa'i khrag rgyu ba'i rtsa yin pa de ni reg na tsha ba 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa yin gyi grang bar gnas pa ma yin pa dang // de bzhin du myur du rgyu zhing 'bab pa dang / de bzhin du mdog sngon po'am /
translated: Similarly, they flow quickly and move rapidly.

original: ser por 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: ser por 'dug pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, they are blue or yellow in color.

original: dkar snum brtan grang bad kan rtsa //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dkar snum brtan grang bad kan rtsa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The veins of phlegm-blood are white, shiny, stable, and cold.

original: bad kan gyi khrag rgyu ba'i rtsa ni 'di ltar gnas te /
analyzed: bad kan gyi khrag rgyu ba'i rtsa ni 'di ltar gnas te /
translated: The veins of phlegm-blood are those in which phlegm-blood flows. They are as follows:

original: kha dog dkar ba dang / mdangs snum pa dang / rgyu ba brtan zhing 'gyur ba med pa dang / reg na grang ba yin no //
analyzed: kha dog dkar ba dang / mdangs snum pa dang / rgyu ba brtan zhing 'gyur ba med pa dang / reg na grang ba yin no //
translated: They are white in color, shiny, stable, and unchanging, and cold to the touch.

original: 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid 'dren ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dres pa'i mtshan nyid 'dren ma yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The veins of combined blood are mixed.🔽The veins of combined blood are those in which combined blood flows.

original: ldan pa'i nad dang 'dus pa'i nad kyi rtsa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dren mar rgyu ba yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa'i nad dang 'dus pa'i nad kyi rtsa'i mtshan nyid ni 'dren mar rgyu ba yin te /
translated: They are mixed.

original: rlung dang bad kan 'dres pa'am /🔽rlung dang mkhris pa 'dres pa 'am //
analyzed: rlung dang bad kan 'dres pa'am / rlung dang mkhris pa 'dres pa 'am //
translated: The characteristics of a combination of wind and phlegm,🔽or of wind and bile,

original: mkhris pa dang bad kan 'dres pa'am /
analyzed: mkhris pa dang bad kan 'dres pa'am /
translated: or of bile and phlegm,

original: gsum char 'dus pa las gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang rang gi mtshan ma 'dren mar snang ba yin no //🔽mi mngon mnyam gnas snum pa dang // mdog dmar khrag rtsa nad med yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum char 'dus pa las gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni rang rang gi mtshan ma 'dren mar snang ba yin no // mi mngon mnyam gnas snum pa dang // mdog dmar khrag rtsa nad med yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: or of all three, are the appearance of the individual characteristics of each.🔽The characteristics of a healthy person are: the pulse is not visible, is even, is oily, is red, and the blood vessels are free of disease.

original: rtsa mi mngon zhing nang du nub pa dang / mnyam zhing snyoms par gnas pa dang / rtsub cing snum bag med pa dang / khrag gi mdog dmar ba'i rtsa ni nad med pa'i khrag rgyu ba yin no //
analyzed: rtsa mi mngon zhing nang du nub pa dang / mnyam zhing snyoms par gnas pa dang / rtsub cing snum bag med pa dang / khrag gi mdog dmar ba'i rtsa ni nad med pa'i khrag rgyu ba yin no //
translated: The pulse is not visible, is sunken, is even, is smooth, is oily, and the blood is red.

original: rtsa bo che ni nyi shu bzhi //🔽lte ba la ni brten pa yin //
analyzed: rtsa bo che ni nyi shu bzhi // lte ba la ni brten pa yin //
translated: The major pulses are twenty-four.🔽They are based at the navel.

original: de rnams kyis bsor lte ba ni //
analyzed: de rnams kyis bsor lte ba ni //
translated: The navel is the center of the wheel,

original: 'khor lo'i lte ba rtsibs bskor mtshungs //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i lte ba rtsibs bskor mtshungs //
translated: like the center of a wheel with spokes.

original: des ni steng 'og thad ka ru //
analyzed: des ni steng 'og thad ka ru //
translated: Above, below, and across,

original: lus 'di rjes su 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: lus 'di rjes su 'dzin pa yin //
translated: this body is sustained by them.🔽The major pulses are twenty-four.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are based at the navel.🔽The navel is the center of the wheel, like the center of a wheel with spokes.🔽Above, below, and across, this body is sustained by them.

original: lus la rtsa bo che nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa gang yin pa de ni lte ba la brten cing gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: lus la rtsa bo che nyi shu rtsa bzhi yod pa gang yin pa de ni lte ba la brten cing gnas pa yin la /
translated: The twenty-four major nāḍīs are located at the navel.

original: de yang de rnams kyis lte ba yongs su bskor bar gnas te /
analyzed: de yang de rnams kyis lte ba yongs su bskor bar gnas te /
translated: They are arranged around the navel,

original: ji ltar shing rta'i lte ba gang yin pa de rtsibs kyis kun nas bskor cing gnas pa dang mtshungs pa yin no //🔽de lta bu'i rtsa bo che des ni lus kyi steng dang 'og dang thad ka dag tu gyes @36b pas phung po ni rjes su 'dzin cing 'tsho bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar shing rta'i lte ba gang yin pa de rtsibs kyis kun nas bskor cing gnas pa dang mtshungs pa yin no // de lta bu'i rtsa bo che des ni lus kyi steng dang 'og dang thad ka dag tu gyes @36b pas phung po ni rjes su 'dzin cing 'tsho bar byed pa yin te /
translated: like the spokes of a wheel around the hub.🔽These major nāḍīs extend up, down, and across the body,

original: rtsa bo che de dag kyang kun dga' ra ba'i chu 'dren pa'i wa lta bu'am zhing gi yur ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rtsa bo che de dag kyang kun dga' ra ba'i chu 'dren pa'i wa lta bu'am zhing gi yur ba lta bu yin no //
translated: nourishing and sustaining the body, like the canals that carry water to the fields.

original: rtsa bo che de dag las bcu ni steng du 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: rtsa bo che de dag las bcu ni steng du 'gro ba yin la /
translated: Ten of these major nāḍīs extend upward,

original: bcu ni 'og tu 'gro ba yin /
analyzed: bcu ni 'og tu 'gro ba yin /
translated: ten extend downward,

original: bzhi ni thad kar 'gro ba yin no //🔽bu ga sna dang rna ba gnyis //
analyzed: bzhi ni thad kar 'gro ba yin no // bu ga sna dang rna ba gnyis //
translated: and four extend across the body.🔽The two nostrils and ears,

original: mig gnyis kha rkub pho mtshan no //
analyzed: mig gnyis kha rkub pho mtshan no //
translated: the two eyes, the mouth, the anus, and the penis.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: skyes pa la ni bu ga dgu yod de /
analyzed: skyes pa la ni bu ga dgu yod de /
translated: The nine openings of the male

original: sna'i bu ga gnyis dang / rna ba gnyis dang / mig gnyis dang / kha dang / rkub dang / pho mtshan gyi bu ga'o //
analyzed: sna'i bu ga gnyis dang / rna ba gnyis dang / mig gnyis dang / kha dang / rkub dang / pho mtshan gyi bu ga'o //
translated: are the two nostrils, the two ears, the two eyes, the mouth, the anus, and the urethra.

original: bud med nu ma gnyis khrag sgo //
analyzed: bud med nu ma gnyis khrag sgo //
translated: The female has two additional openings, the breasts.

original: gsum gyis lhag par gyur pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum gyis lhag par gyur pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: She has three more openings than the male.🔽The female has three more openings than the male, the two nipples and the vagina.

original: bud med rnams ni snga ma las lhag par gyur pa'i bu ga gsum yod de nu ma gnyis kyi bu ga dang / zla mtshan rgyu ba'i bu ga'o //
analyzed: bud med rnams ni snga ma las lhag par gyur pa'i bu ga gsum yod de nu ma gnyis kyi bu ga dang / zla mtshan rgyu ba'i bu ga'o //
translated: The thirteen openings

original: nang gi srog gi gnas gyur pa'i //🔽bu ga bcu gsum yod par bshad //
analyzed: nang gi srog gi gnas gyur pa'i // bu ga bcu gsum yod par bshad //
translated: are said to be the seats of the inner life-force.

original: srog dang lus zungs dri mchu //
analyzed: srog dang lus zungs dri mchu //
translated: The life-force, body-elements, smell, taste,

original: zas rgyu / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zas rgyu / zhes bya ba la /
translated: and food move through them.

original: de bzhin du nang gi bu ga snga ma las gzhan pa srog la sogs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i bu ga bcu gsum yod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi bu ga snga ma las gzhan pa srog la sogs pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i bu ga bcu gsum yod de /
translated: The thirteen openings are the seats of the inner life-force, etc., other than the previously mentioned openings.

original: de la srog ces bya ba'i rlung ni srog gi gnas su rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la srog ces bya ba'i rlung ni srog gi gnas su rgyu'o //
translated: The life-force wind moves through the life-force seat.

original: lus zungs rgyu ba rnams su ni dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rgyu'o //
analyzed: lus zungs rgyu ba rnams su ni dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rgyu'o //
translated: The body constituents circulate in the channels of the body constituents.

original: dri ma rgyu ba'i gnas su bshang ba dang gci ba dang rdul rgyu'o //
analyzed: dri ma rgyu ba'i gnas su bshang ba dang gci ba dang rdul rgyu'o //
translated: The impurities circulate in the channels of impurities, such as feces, urine, and sweat.

original: chu rgyu ba'i gnas su ni chu 'thungs pa rgyu'o //
analyzed: chu rgyu ba'i gnas su ni chu 'thungs pa rgyu'o //
translated: Water circulates in the channels of water, such as the water drunk.

original: zas rgyu ba'i gnas su ni zas zos pa rnams rgyu ste /
analyzed: zas rgyu ba'i gnas su ni zas zos pa rnams rgyu ste /
translated: Food circulates in the channels of food, such as the food eaten.

original: de ltar na rnam pa bcu gsum yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa bcu gsum yin no //
translated: Thus, there are thirteen types.

original: zas rgyu mi mthun bstan pa yin //
analyzed: zas rgyu mi mthun bstan pa yin //
translated: The food that is not suitable causes harm.

original: de la gnod pas nad skyed la //
analyzed: de la gnod pas nad skyed la //
translated: From that, disease arises.

original: skyon med dag pas bde bar byed //🔽ces bya ba la /🔽bu ga de dag zas dang spyod lam mi mthun zhing phan pa ma yin ba bsten pas de la gnod par gyur cing 'khrugs par byas pa las nad rnams skyed par 'gyur la skyon med cing dag pa'i zas dang spyod lam bsten pas gnod pa med na bde
analyzed: skyon med dag pas bde bar byed // ces bya ba la / bu ga de dag zas dang spyod lam mi mthun zhing phan pa ma yin ba bsten pas de la gnod par gyur cing 'khrugs par byas pa las nad rnams skyed par 'gyur la skyon med cing dag pa'i zas dang spyod lam bsten pas gnod pa med na bde
translated: The faultless and pure food causes health.🔽In that regard, the food and conduct that are not suitable and not beneficial for those channels causes harm and agitation, from which diseases arise.

original: ba nyid du 'gyur zhing nad med pa skyed bar byed do //
analyzed: ba nyid du 'gyur zhing nad med pa skyed bar byed do //
translated: The faultless and pure food and conduct that are not harmful cause health and generate freedom from disease.

original: rang gi lus zungs mdog mnyam zhing //
analyzed: rang gi lus zungs mdog mnyam zhing //
translated: The channels of the body are the same color as the body elements.

original: zlum dang sbom dang phra ba dang // bu ga'i dbyibs kyi ring po ste //
analyzed: zlum dang sbom dang phra ba dang // bu ga'i dbyibs kyi ring po ste //
translated: Some are round, some are thick, some are thin, and some are long.

original: lo ma'i rtsa 'phros lta bu yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lo ma'i rtsa 'phros lta bu yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are like the veins of a leaf.

original: rang gi lus zungs kyi gzhir gyur pa'i bu ga gang ba ste nad pa'i lus zungs de dang mdog mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi lus zungs kyi gzhir gyur pa'i bu ga gang ba ste nad pa'i lus zungs de dang mdog mnyam zhing mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: The channels that are the basis of the body elements are filled with the same color as the body elements of the patient.

original: des na dangs ma rgyu ba'i bu ga ni lus zungs kyi dangs ma bu ga dang kha dog mtshungs pa yin pa @37a * //
analyzed: des na dangs ma rgyu ba'i bu ga ni lus zungs kyi dangs ma bu ga dang kha dog mtshungs pa yin pa @37a * //
translated: Therefore, the channels that carry the pure essences are the same color as the pure essence of the body elements.

original: la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: bu ga de dag thams cad las bu ga la la ni zlum po yin la /
analyzed: bu ga de dag thams cad las bu ga la la ni zlum po yin la /
translated: Of all those channels, some are round,

original: bu ga la la ni sbom pa yin la /
analyzed: bu ga la la ni sbom pa yin la /
translated: some are thick,

original: la la ni phra zhing chung ba yin te /
analyzed: la la ni phra zhing chung ba yin te /
translated: some are thin and small,

original: bu ga de dag thams cad kyi dbyibs ni ring por gnas shing /
analyzed: bu ga de dag thams cad kyi dbyibs ni ring por gnas shing /
translated: and all of them are long.

original: rtsa sbubs de dag kyang lo ma'i rtsa rgyus kyi ri mo dang mthun pa'i ring thung du mar gyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsa sbubs de dag kyang lo ma'i rtsa rgyus kyi ri mo dang mthun pa'i ring thung du mar gyes pa yin no //
translated: Those channels are divided into many short and long sections, like the veins of a leaf.

original: zas dang spyod lam dag gis gang //
analyzed: zas dang spyod lam dag gis gang //
translated: By food and conduct.🔽When they are equal to the power of the humors,

original: nad kyi mthu dang mnyam gyur dang // gang yang lus zungs mi mnyam ste //
analyzed: nad kyi mthu dang mnyam gyur dang // gang yang lus zungs mi mnyam ste //
translated: and when the body elements are not in balance,

original: bu ga'i rgyun la gnod byed yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bu ga'i rgyun la gnod byed yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: they obstruct the channels.🔽The food that has the characteristics of eating, drinking, etc.,🔽when it is equal to the power of the humors such as wind, etc.,

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zas gang rlung la sogs pa'i nad kyi mthu rtsub ba la sogs pa dang mnyam zhing mtshungs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bu ga rnams 'gags shing gnod par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi zas gang rlung la sogs pa'i nad kyi mthu rtsub ba la sogs pa dang mnyam zhing mtshungs par gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bu ga rnams 'gags shing gnod par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: is the cause of obstruction and harm to the channels.

original: spyod lam ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: spyod lam ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: Conduct is characterized by physical, verbal, and mental activity.

original: de yang nad kyi mthu dang cha mnyam par gyur na bu ga rnams la gnod cing 'gags pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de yang nad kyi mthu dang cha mnyam par gyur na bu ga rnams la gnod cing 'gags pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: When it is equal to the power of the humors, it is the cause of obstruction and harm to the channels.

original: de bzhin du lus zungs bdun po zas dang spyod lam la sogs pa de'i mthu dang nus pa mi mnyam zhing yon tan tha dad par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bu ga'i rgyun la gnod cing 'gags pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus zungs bdun po zas dang spyod lam la sogs pa de'i mthu dang nus pa mi mnyam zhing yon tan tha dad par gyur pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bu ga'i rgyun la gnod cing 'gags pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Likewise, the seven bodily constituents, which have unequal power and capacity from food, conduct, etc., and which have different qualities, are the cause of obstruction and harm to the continuity of the channels.

original: mang du 'byung ba'am 'gags pa'am //
analyzed: mang du 'byung ba'am 'gags pa'am //
translated: Excessive discharge or obstruction,

original: rtsa ni mdud pa chags pa'am //
analyzed: rtsa ni mdud pa chags pa'am //
translated: knots in the channels,

original: lam gzhan dag tu 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: lam gzhan dag tu 'gro ba ni //
translated: or going to other paths,

original: bu ga'i rgyu 'khrugs mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: bu ga'i rgyu 'khrugs mtshan nyid yin //
translated: are the characteristics of disturbance of the channels.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: bu ga la mang du byung ba ni ji ltar gcin 'bab pa'i bu ga las gcin snyi ba'i nad ltar mang du byung ba na /
analyzed: bu ga la mang du byung ba ni ji ltar gcin 'bab pa'i bu ga las gcin snyi ba'i nad ltar mang du byung ba na /
translated: excessive discharge in the channels is like excessive discharge of urine from the urethra in a condition of diabetes.

original: 'gags pa ni mi 'byung ba'am cung zad byung ba ste gcin sri ba'i nad lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gags pa ni mi 'byung ba'am cung zad byung ba ste gcin sri ba'i nad lta bu'o //
translated: Obstruction is non-discharge or slight discharge, like in diabetes.

original: de bzhin du bshang ba 'byung ba'i bu ga las tshad pa 'khru ba ltar bshang gci lhag par 'khru ba ni mang du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bshang ba 'byung ba'i bu ga las tshad pa 'khru ba ltar bshang gci lhag par 'khru ba ni mang du 'byung ba'o //
translated: Similarly, excessive discharge of feces and urine from the anus and urethra is excessive discharge, like diarrhea with fever from the anus.

original: 'gags pa ni bshang ba cung zad byung ba'am /
analyzed: 'gags pa ni bshang ba cung zad byung ba'am /
translated: Obstructed means that feces are slightly expelled,

original: yang na rtug 'gags kyi nad ltar thams cad nas thams cad du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de ni bu ga'i rgyu 'khrugs shing gnod pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin te de bzhin gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rtug 'gags kyi nad ltar thams cad nas thams cad du 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba de ni bu ga'i rgyu 'khrugs shing gnod pa dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin te de bzhin gzhan dag la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: or else, like the disease of obstructed flatus, they do not come out at all. That is the characteristic of a wound or disturbance in the channels. The same should be applied to the others.🔽Similarly, a knot forms in the channels,

original: de bzhin du rtsa la mdud pa chags par gyur pa dang / de bzhin du lam gzhan du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa la mdud pa chags par gyur pa dang / de bzhin du lam gzhan du 'gro ba ste /
translated: and similarly, it goes to another path,

original: rang gi rgyu'i 'am ma spangs nas lam gzhan du 'gro ba de yang bu ga la @37b gnod pa yod cing 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i 'am ma spangs nas lam gzhan du 'gro ba de yang bu ga la @37b gnod pa yod cing 'khrugs pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: having not abandoned its own cause, and goes to another path. That is also the characteristic of a wound or disturbance in the channels.

original: padma'i rtsa ba phra mo las //
analyzed: padma'i rtsa ba phra mo las //
translated: Like a thin lotus root

original: ring du rgyu bar byed pa ltar //
analyzed: ring du rgyu bar byed pa ltar //
translated: is made to extend far,

original: gang gis dangs ma nyer 'phel ba //
analyzed: gang gis dangs ma nyer 'phel ba //
translated: by which the pure essence is increased,

original: lus kyi sgo ni bu ga yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus kyi sgo ni bu ga yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: the body’s opening is a wound.

original: ji ltar padma'i rtsa ba'i sbubs shin tu phra ba'i bu ga las ring du rgyu bar byed cing thams cad la khyab par byed pa de bzhin du bu ga'i sgo gang nas lus 'di la dangs ma nye bar sogs shing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gang lus
analyzed: ji ltar padma'i rtsa ba'i sbubs shin tu phra ba'i bu ga las ring du rgyu bar byed cing thams cad la khyab par byed pa de bzhin du bu ga'i sgo gang nas lus 'di la dangs ma nye bar sogs shing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas gang lus
translated: throughout the entire body.

original: ma lus pa khyab par byed pa de ni bu ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa khyab par byed pa de ni bu ga zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called an opening.

original: bu ga rnams ni brtol gyur na //🔽'dar myos lto sbos lkugs dang rims //
analyzed: bu ga rnams ni brtol gyur na // 'dar myos lto sbos lkugs dang rims //
translated: When the openings are pierced,

original: sla dang gzer dang bshang gci 'gags //
analyzed: sla dang gzer dang bshang gci 'gags //
translated: there is trembling, madness, distension of the stomach, muteness, and paralysis.🔽There is looseness, pain, and obstruction of feces and urine,

original: yang na 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: or else there is death itself.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: bu ga brtol zhing phyung bar gyur nas 'dar ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: bu ga brtol zhing phyung bar gyur nas 'dar ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: when the openings are pierced and emerge, trembling and so forth occur,

original: yang na 'chi zhing dus byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na 'chi zhing dus byed pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: or else there is death and the end of life.

original: de la 'dar ba ni lus g-yo zhing 'gul ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'dar ba ni lus g-yo zhing 'gul ba'o //
translated: Therein, trembling is the shaking and moving of the body.

original: myos pa ni sems stor ba'o //
analyzed: myos pa ni sems stor ba'o //
translated: Madness is the loss of mind.

original: lto spos pa ni dbugs kyis khengs pa'o //
analyzed: lto spos pa ni dbugs kyis khengs pa'o //
translated: Distension of the stomach is the inflation with breath.

original: de bas sman pas bu ga brtol //
analyzed: de bas sman pas bu ga brtol //
translated: Therefore, the physician should open the wound.

original: re thag bcad de gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: re thag bcad de gso bar bya'o //
translated: Having given up hope, he should treat the patient.

original: 'phral du rma byung cho ga yis //
analyzed: 'phral du rma byung cho ga yis //
translated: Immediately, by the rite of extracting the arrow,

original: 'bad de zug rngu dbyung bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bad de zug rngu dbyung bar bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: he should make an effort to remove the dart.

original: de ltar srog dang bral ba'i nyes pa de bas na sman pa dag gis bu ga brtol ba'i nad pa la re thag bcad cing bzlog ste bya ba 'dis ni nges par 'chi ba yin te zhes smra la /
analyzed: de ltar srog dang bral ba'i nyes pa de bas na sman pa dag gis bu ga brtol ba'i nad pa la re thag bcad cing bzlog ste bya ba 'dis ni nges par 'chi ba yin te zhes smra la /
translated: Thus, because of the fault of separation from life, the physician should open the wound of the patient who has given up hope.

original: mtshon gyis zug rngu de phyung nas 'bad de gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshon gyis zug rngu de phyung nas 'bad de gso bar bya'o //
translated: Having extracted the dart with the knife, he should make an effort to treat him.

original: de yang ji ltar dbyung zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar dbyung zhe na /
translated: And how should it be extracted?

original: 'phral du zug rngu dbyung ba'i cho ga sngar bshad pa ltar dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'phral du zug rngu dbyung ba'i cho ga sngar bshad pa ltar dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Immediately, by the rite of extracting the dart, as previously explained, it should be extracted.

original: zas 'ju byed pa mkhris pa ni //
analyzed: zas 'ju byed pa mkhris pa ni //
translated: The bile, which digests food,

original: 'ju byed yin zhes sngar bshad do //
analyzed: 'ju byed yin zhes sngar bshad do //
translated: is the digester, as previously explained.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus,

original: zas 'ju bar byed pa ni mkhris pa lnga'i khyad par 'ju bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i mkhris pa yin no zhes sngar nad kyi bye brag shes par bya ba'i le'u las bshad pa yin no //🔽nad dang lus zungs dri ma yi //
analyzed: zas 'ju bar byed pa ni mkhris pa lnga'i khyad par 'ju bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i mkhris pa yin no zhes sngar nad kyi bye brag shes par bya ba'i le'u las bshad pa yin no // nad dang lus zungs dri ma yi //
translated: The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”🔽This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”🔽The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”🔽This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”

original: drod yin zhes ni rgyun shes zer //
analyzed: drod yin zhes ni rgyun shes zer //
translated: The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”🔽The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”🔽This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”🔽The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”🔽This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”

original: drang srong rgyun shes kyi bus ni nad dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams kyi drod de rlung la sogs pa'i nad rnams dang / dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams dang / bshang gci zhes bya ba'i dri ma de rnams kyi drod ni me drod de /
analyzed: drang srong rgyun shes kyi bus ni nad dang lus zungs dang dri ma rnams kyi drod de rlung la sogs pa'i nad rnams dang / dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams dang / bshang gci zhes bya ba'i dri ma de rnams kyi drod ni me drod de /
translated: The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”🔽This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”🔽The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”🔽This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”🔽The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”

original: nad dang lus zungs dang dri ma dang 'dus ba las byung ba'i nang gi me drod ji skad du bstan pa'i mes @38a * //
analyzed: nad dang lus zungs dang dri ma dang 'dus ba las byung ba'i nang gi me drod ji skad du bstan pa'i mes @38a * //
translated: This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”

original: las byed pa yin no //🔽zhes zer ro //🔽de ni zas kyi gnas yin zhing //
analyzed: las byed pa yin no // zhes zer ro // de ni zas kyi gnas yin zhing //
translated: The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”🔽This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”🔽The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”🔽This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding the Specifics of Illness.”

original: 'dzin cing 'dzin byed ces bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzin cing 'dzin byed ces bstan to //
translated: The one that digests food is the bile called “that which digests the five special biles.”🔽This was explained previously in the chapter on “Understanding

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: 'ju bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i mkhris pa dang / me drod ni zas kyi gnas yin zhing /🔽zas de nyid 'dzin cing chags par byed pas na 'dzin par byed pa'o ;
analyzed: 'ju bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i mkhris pa dang / me drod ni zas kyi gnas yin zhing / zas de nyid 'dzin cing chags par byed pas na 'dzin par byed pa'o ;
translated: The passage, The heat of the fire of digestion and the bile that digests food are the site of food.

original: / zhes bshad do //🔽de nyid thang la 'bar gzhung gis //🔽mkhris pa 'dzin pa'i cha ru bshad //
analyzed: / zhes bshad do // de nyid thang la 'bar gzhung gis // mkhris pa 'dzin pa'i cha ru bshad //
translated: The passage, Because it holds and clings to food, it is called the 'holder.'

original: ces bya ba la /🔽'dzin pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba la / 'dzin pa de nyid ni /
translated: The passage, That very [bile] is explained as the part of bile that holds [food] in the treatise of the sage Bhārgava.

original: drang srong thang la 'bar gyis gzhung ngam phyogs kyis de mkhris pa 'dzin pa'i cha yin no //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: drang srong thang la 'bar gyis gzhung ngam phyogs kyis de mkhris pa 'dzin pa'i cha yin no // zhes bshad do //
translated: The passage, That very [bile] is explained as the part of bile that holds [food] in the treatise of the sage Bhārgava.

original: tshe dang nad med brtson gzi mdangs //
analyzed: tshe dang nad med brtson gzi mdangs //
translated: The passage, It increases life, health, diligence, radiance,

original: lus zungs me drod stobs 'phel byed //
analyzed: lus zungs me drod stobs 'phel byed //
translated: the bodily constituents, digestive heat, and strength.

original: zhu ba'i gnas kyi sgor zhugs pa //
analyzed: zhu ba'i gnas kyi sgor zhugs pa //
translated: The passage, When it is located at the door of the site of digestion,

original: zas kyi lam gyi sgo gtan yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zas kyi lam gyi sgo gtan yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is the door of the path of food.

original: 'dzin pa de nyid zhu ba'i gnas kyi sgo na 'dug par gyur na tshe 'phel bar byed pa dang / nad med pa la sogs pa 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin pa de nyid zhu ba'i gnas kyi sgo na 'dug par gyur na tshe 'phel bar byed pa dang / nad med pa la sogs pa 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The passage, When that very [bile] is located at the door of the site of digestion, it increases life, health, and so forth.

original: de bzhin du zas kyi lam zhu ba'i gnas kyi nang du 'gro ba'i gnas byed pa yin te sgo byed pa'i gags byed pa ni sgo gtan yin pa dang 'dra bar 'dir yang zhu ba'i gnas kyi sgor 'dug ste ma zhu ba'i gnas dang zhu ba'i gnas kyi
analyzed: de bzhin du zas kyi lam zhu ba'i gnas kyi nang du 'gro ba'i gnas byed pa yin te sgo byed pa'i gags byed pa ni sgo gtan yin pa dang 'dra bar 'dir yang zhu ba'i gnas kyi sgor 'dug ste ma zhu ba'i gnas dang zhu ba'i gnas kyi
translated: Just as a door bolt acts as a barrier to opening a door, it sits at the door of the site of digestion and blocks the passage to the site of nondigestion and the site of digestion.🔽It generates the heat of fire inside and blocks the food that is about to enter the site of nondigestion.

original: bar du gnas nas des kyang me'i drod nang du skyed pas ma zhu ba'i gnas su 'gro bar bdog pa'i zas stobs kyis bkag nas mkhris pa'i me drod kyis smin cing skem par byed do //
analyzed: bar du gnas nas des kyang me'i drod nang du skyed pas ma zhu ba'i gnas su 'gro bar bdog pa'i zas stobs kyis bkag nas mkhris pa'i me drod kyis smin cing skem par byed do //
translated: The heat of bile digests and dries it.🔽It is said:

original: de ni stobs ldan zos ba rnams //
analyzed: de ni stobs ldan zos ba rnams //
translated: When it is strong, it digests food

original: zhu nas thur du 'dren par byed //
analyzed: zhu nas thur du 'dren par byed //
translated: and draws it downward.

original: stobs zhan gyur na kha zas ni //
analyzed: stobs zhan gyur na kha zas ni //
translated: When it is weak,

original: ma smin nyid du 'byung bar byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ma smin nyid du 'byung bar byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: it causes indigestion.

original: 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ste stobs dang ldan par gyur na kha zas zos pa rnams ma zhu ba'i gnas su bkag cing stobs kyis bkag nas smin cing zhu bar byas te /
analyzed: 'dzin par byed pa zhes bya ba ste stobs dang ldan par gyur na kha zas zos pa rnams ma zhu ba'i gnas su bkag cing stobs kyis bkag nas smin cing zhu bar byas te /
translated: When it is strong, it blocks the food that is eaten in the site of nondigestion and digests and draws it downward.

original: de'i 'og tu zas de dri ma'i rnam par zhu ba'i gnas su 'dren par byed la /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zas de dri ma'i rnam par zhu ba'i gnas su 'dren par byed la /
translated: Then, it is drawn to the place where the food is digested.

original: de ni stobs dang ldan pa las gyur gyi stobs gzhan las ni ma yin no //🔽gal te 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ste ;
analyzed: de ni stobs dang ldan pa las gyur gyi stobs gzhan las ni ma yin no // gal te 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ste ;
translated: This is due to the power of the food, not to any other power.

original: stobs zhan cing nyam chung bar gyur ba la /
analyzed: stobs zhan cing nyam chung bar gyur ba la /
translated: If the power of the food is weak and feeble,

original: nad kyis nyen pa yin na /
analyzed: nad kyis nyen pa yin na /
translated: and if the person is afflicted by a disease,

original: kha zas ma zhu zhing ma smin pa nyid du 'byung zhing dor bar byed do //
analyzed: kha zas ma zhu zhing ma smin pa nyid du 'byung zhing dor bar byed do //
translated: the food will not be digested and will be expelled.

original: 'dzin byed stobs ni me drod de //
analyzed: 'dzin byed stobs ni me drod de //
translated: The power of retention is the digestive heat.

original: de yang 'dzin byed stobs can yin //
analyzed: de yang 'dzin byed stobs can yin //
translated: And that is the power of retention.

original: de bas me drod nyams gyur na //🔽'dzin byed nad ni skyed par byed //
analyzed: de bas me drod nyams gyur na // 'dzin byed nad ni skyed par byed //
translated: Therefore, when the digestive heat is impaired,

original: @38b ces bya ba la /
analyzed: @38b ces bya ba la /
translated: the disease of retention is produced.

original: 'dzin byed de'i stobs ni 'ju bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i me drod yin la me drod de'i stobs kyang 'dzin byed yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin byed de'i stobs ni 'ju bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i me drod yin la me drod de'i stobs kyang 'dzin byed yin te /
translated: The power of retention is the digestive heat, called “that which digests.” The power of that digestive heat is also retention.

original: de ltar na grub pa dang / bde ba'i sbyor ba gcig gis de gnyis lus gnas bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na grub pa dang / bde ba'i sbyor ba gcig gis de gnyis lus gnas bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the two are mutually supportive in maintaining the body.

original: rgyu de bas na khong ba'i me drod nyams shing bri bar gyur na 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de nad 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu de bas na khong ba'i me drod nyams shing bri bar gyur na 'dzin pa zhes bya ba de nad 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the digestive heat in the stomach declines and diminishes, it becomes the cause of a disease called “retention.”

original: zas gang lus kyi lus zungs mdangs //
analyzed: zas gang lus kyi lus zungs mdangs //
translated: Food that nourishes the body, the body’s constituents, complexion,

original: stobs dang kha dog sogs rgyas byed //
analyzed: stobs dang kha dog sogs rgyas byed //
translated: strength, and color, etc.

original: der rgyu kha zas me drod ni //🔽mi 'ju dangs ma sogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: der rgyu kha zas me drod ni // mi 'ju dangs ma sogs mi 'gyur //
translated: The cause of that is digestive heat,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: because undigested food does not become lymph, blood, etc.

original: gang zas 'di zos shing bsten pas lus dang lus zungs la sogs pa rgyas shing 'phel bar byed pa de'i rgyu ni me drod kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang zas 'di zos shing bsten pas lus dang lus zungs la sogs pa rgyas shing 'phel bar byed pa de'i rgyu ni me drod kho na yin te /
translated: The food that, when eaten and relied on, nourishes and increases the body and the body’s constituents, etc., the cause of that is digestive heat alone.

original: gang gi phyir kha zas ma zhu ba las ni dangs ma dang khrag la sogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kha zas ma zhu ba las ni dangs ma dang khrag la sogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because undigested food does not become lymph, blood, etc.

original: de bas na lus dang lus zungs la sogs pa rgyas par byed pa la ni thams cad du me'i drod kyis 'ju ba'i bya ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir me drod kho na rgyu'i gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: de bas na lus dang lus zungs la sogs pa rgyas par byed pa la ni thams cad du me'i drod kyis 'ju ba'i bya ba rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir me drod kho na rgyu'i gtso bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, in nourishing the body, the body’s constituents, etc., digestive heat alone is the primary cause, because it completely performs the function of digesting by means of heat.

original: zas ni dus su zos gyur pa //
analyzed: zas ni dus su zos gyur pa //
translated: Food that is eaten at the proper time

original: lto bar srog gi rlung gis drangs //
