analyzed: lto bar srog gi rlung gis drangs //
translated: The life-force wind draws it into the stomach.

original: skom gyis gong bor rnam par dbye //
analyzed: skom gyis gong bor rnam par dbye //
translated: Thirst separates it into upper and lower parts.

original: snum gyis mnyen par byas pa yin //
analyzed: snum gyis mnyen par byas pa yin //
translated: Oiliness makes it soft.

original: me mnyam gnas kyis bus nas ni //
analyzed: me mnyam gnas kyis bus nas ni //
translated: The fire of equal heat cooks it.

original: ma zhu'i gnas nas rnam smin byed //🔽phyi yi snod gnas 'bras chu ltar //
analyzed: ma zhu'i gnas nas rnam smin byed // phyi yi snod gnas 'bras chu ltar //
translated: It ripens in the place of undigested food.🔽The fire of the stomach digests it,

original: lto ba'i me yis zhu bar byed //
analyzed: lto ba'i me yis zhu bar byed //
translated: like rice and water in an outer vessel.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: As for the words of the text,

original: zas su za ba'i kha zas dus su bsten //
analyzed: zas su za ba'i kha zas dus su bsten //
translated: one should enjoy food that is eaten as food at the proper time,

original: bshang ba dang ni gci ba bsal //
analyzed: bshang ba dang ni gci ba bsal //
translated: eliminating feces and urine.

original: dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bstan pa'i tshul du longs spyod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dag zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung gis bstan pa'i tshul du longs spyod par 'gyur na /
translated: If one enjoys food in the manner taught by the text beginning with the words “pure” and so on,

original: lto'i gnas su srog ces bya ba'i rlung gis drangs shing bcug nas skom gyi rnam pa gsher ba'i rdzas chu dang 'o ma dang chang la sogs pa gong por gnas pa che zhing bshig par 'gyur ba dang / snum gyi rdzas mar la sogs pas mnyen zhing 'jam pa nyid du byas pa yin pa la /
analyzed: lto'i gnas su srog ces bya ba'i rlung gis drangs shing bcug nas skom gyi rnam pa gsher ba'i rdzas chu dang 'o ma dang chang la sogs pa gong por gnas pa che zhing bshig par 'gyur ba dang / snum gyi rdzas mar la sogs pas mnyen zhing 'jam pa nyid du byas pa yin pa la /
translated: the life-force wind draws it into the stomach and inserts it there. Thirst separates the liquid substances such as water, milk, and beer into upper and lower parts, and they expand and break apart. Oiliness makes the substances such as butter soft and smooth.

original: de bzhin du ma zhu ba'i gnas na 'dug pa na smin cing 'jug par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma zhu ba'i gnas na 'dug pa na smin cing 'jug par byed pa yin la /
translated: Likewise, when it is in the place of nondigestion, it ripens and digests.

original: de yang me dang mnyam du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rlung gis de mnyam par spar zhing bus nas smin cing 'ju bar byed ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang me dang mnyam du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rlung gis de mnyam par spar zhing bus nas smin cing 'ju bar byed ba yin no //
translated: And that is done by the wind called Abiding with Fire, which kindles and ignites it, and so it ripens and is digested.

original: de yang ji ltar phyi'i mes snod kyi nang na gnas pa'i sa dang chu 'tshod cing smin par byed ba dang 'dra bar lto ba'i mes kyang smin cing zhu bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar phyi'i mes snod kyi nang na gnas pa'i sa dang chu 'tshod cing smin par byed ba dang 'dra bar lto ba'i mes kyang smin cing zhu bar byed pa yin no //
translated: And just as external fire cooks and ripens the earth and water in the interior of the container, the fire in the stomach cooks and digests it.

original: dang bor ro drug zas kyang ni //
analyzed: dang bor ro drug zas kyang ni //
translated: First, the six tastes of food

original: mngar ba nyid du @39a * //🔽gyur nas ni //
analyzed: mngar ba nyid du @39a * // gyur nas ni //
translated: become sweet.

original: lbu ba can gyur bad kan 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lbu ba can gyur bad kan 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Then, they become foam and phlegm.

original: kha zas ro drug po de dag kyang dang po'i gnas skabs la bab pa'i tshe /
analyzed: kha zas ro drug po de dag kyang dang po'i gnas skabs la bab pa'i tshe /
translated: The six tastes of food, when they first arrive in the stomach,

original: lto ba'i me drod kyis 'ju bar byed pas na /
analyzed: lto ba'i me drod kyis 'ju bar byed pas na /
translated: are digested by the heat of the stomach fire.

original: kha zas ro drug car zos su zin kyang ro mngar ba nyid du gyur cing mngar ba'i rang bzhin gyis bad kan gyi nad bslangs shing de'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur ba dang / lbu ba can lbu ba 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha zas ro drug car zos su zin kyang ro mngar ba nyid du gyur cing mngar ba'i rang bzhin gyis bad kan gyi nad bslangs shing de'i mtshan nyid can du 'gyur ba dang / lbu ba can lbu ba 'dra ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though one has eaten food with all six tastes, it becomes sweet in taste, and by its sweet nature it produces phlegm disease and one becomes characterized by that.

original: zhu ba'i gnas nas 'pho ba na //🔽rnam par tsha bas skyur nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: zhu ba'i gnas nas 'pho ba na // rnam par tsha bas skyur nyid 'gyur //
translated: When it moves from the place of digestion,🔽it becomes sour due to complete digestion.

original: mkhris gyur // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhris gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It becomes bile.

original: dang po'i gnas skabs 'das nas gnas skabs bar ma la bab pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dang po'i gnas skabs 'das nas gnas skabs bar ma la bab pa'i tshe /
translated: After passing the first stage and arriving at the intermediate stage,

original: lto ba me'i drod kyis smin par byed cing 'ju bar byed pas na /
analyzed: lto ba me'i drod kyis smin par byed cing 'ju bar byed pas na /
translated: the stomach matures and digests the food with the heat of fire.

original: rnam par tsha bas skyur ba nyid du gyur pas mkhris par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par tsha bas skyur ba nyid du gyur pas mkhris par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it becomes sour due to complete digestion, and it becomes bile.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zas de zhu ba'i gnas nas 'pho ba na mkhris pa bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zas de zhu ba'i gnas nas 'pho ba na mkhris pa bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when that food moves from the place of digestion, it produces bile.

original: 'phos pa'i rjes la ni /
analyzed: 'phos pa'i rjes la ni /
translated: After moving,

original: me drod kyis skams zhu ba dang // kha zhing gong bur gyur rlung skyed ;
analyzed: me drod kyis skams zhu ba dang // kha zhing gong bur gyur rlung skyed ;
translated: the heat of fire dries it up and digests it, making it sour and lumpy, producing wind.

original: / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: / ces bya ba la /

original: zas de ma zhu ba'i gnas nas zhu ba'i gnas su 'phos shing zhu ba'i gnas su phyin pa dang / khong pa'i me drod kyis skams pa dang / ro kha ba dang gong bur bsdus par gyur pa na /
analyzed: zas de ma zhu ba'i gnas nas zhu ba'i gnas su 'phos shing zhu ba'i gnas su phyin pa dang / khong pa'i me drod kyis skams pa dang / ro kha ba dang gong bur bsdus par gyur pa na /
translated: The food, having moved from the place where it is not digested to the place where it is digested, and having been dried by the heat of the stomach fire, and having become sour and collected into lumps,

original: gnas skabs gsum par sra bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum par sra bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: at that time it becomes solid in the third stage.

original: de'i tshe na rlung skyed par 'gyur ba yin no ;
analyzed: de'i tshe na rlung skyed par 'gyur ba yin no ;
translated: At that time, the wind arises.

original: / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
analyzed: / sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind,

original: nam mkhar bcas pa'i drod lnga pos //
analyzed: nam mkhar bcas pa'i drod lnga pos //
translated: and the warmth of space, the fifth,

original: rang rang yon tan zas lnga po //
analyzed: rang rang yon tan zas lnga po //
translated: the five foods with their own qualities,

original: sa sogs kyis smin de 'og tu //
analyzed: sa sogs kyis smin de 'og tu //
translated: are ripened by earth and so forth.

original: de dag rang rang ji bzhin rgyas //
analyzed: de dag rang rang ji bzhin rgyas //
translated: Then, below, they increase according to their own nature.

original: smin 'byung yon tan tha dad yin //
analyzed: smin 'byung yon tan tha dad yin //
translated: The arising of ripening is a different quality.

original: sa ru gtogs pas sa nyid dang // lhag mas lus gtogs lhag ma rgyas //
analyzed: sa ru gtogs pas sa nyid dang // lhag mas lus gtogs lhag ma rgyas //
translated: Earth is earth, and the rest increase the body.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i me drod rlung dang bcas par gnas pa'i drod lnga po dag gis zas kyi yon tan lnga po lci ba la sogs ba rang rang gi yon tan la sogs pa rjes su mched cing smin par byed la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i me drod rlung dang bcas par gnas pa'i drod lnga po dag gis zas kyi yon tan lnga po lci ba la sogs ba rang rang gi yon tan la sogs pa rjes su mched cing smin par byed la /
translated: The five kinds of heat that reside in the fire element together with the wind element increase and ripen the five qualities of food, such as heaviness, in their respective qualities.

original: de'i 'og tu sa la sogs pa de dag rang rang gi yon tan gang yin pa lus la ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du gnas shing 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sa la sogs pa de dag rang rang gi yon tan gang yin pa lus la ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du gnas shing 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Then, earth and so on increase and expand in the body according to their respective qualities.

original: de yang so so nas tha dad pa byed pa yin /
analyzed: de yang so so nas tha dad pa byed pa yin /
translated: They each perform their own function.

original: de yang sa ru gtogs pa'i 'byung ba chen pos lus la gtogs pa'i sa'i yon tan rgyas shing 'phel bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang sa ru gtogs pa'i 'byung ba chen pos lus la gtogs pa'i sa'i yon tan rgyas shing 'phel bar byed pa yin la /
translated: The great element of earth increases and expands the quality of earth that belongs to the body.

original: lhag ma sa'i yon tan las gzhan pa me dang chu dang rlung dang nam mkha' rnams kyis kyang sa'i yon @39b tan las ma gtogs pa lhag ma rang rang gi yon tan rnams lus la gnas pa rgyas shing 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma sa'i yon tan las gzhan pa me dang chu dang rlung dang nam mkha' rnams kyis kyang sa'i yon @39b tan las ma gtogs pa lhag ma rang rang gi yon tan rnams lus la gnas pa rgyas shing 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The remaining elements of fire, water, wind and space increase and expand the qualities of their own elements that are not included in the quality of earth.

original: zas de zhu ba'i tshigs ma dang // dangs ma zhes bya gnyis su 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zas de zhu ba'i tshigs ma dang // dangs ma zhes bya gnyis su 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the coarse part and the refined part.

original: zas de zhu ba'i tshe rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: zas de zhu ba'i tshe rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The food, when digested, is twofold:

original: tshigs ma'i tshul can dang / dangs ma'i tshul can no //🔽de las zas kyi tshigs ma sla //
analyzed: tshigs ma'i tshul can dang / dangs ma'i tshul can no // de las zas kyi tshigs ma sla //
translated: the coarse part and the refined part.

original: gcin 'gyur ska ba bshang bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽de la tshigs ma dang dangs ma de nyid las zas kyi tshigs ma'i dangs mar gyur pa de ni gcin yin par shes par bya la /
analyzed: gcin 'gyur ska ba bshang bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la / de la tshigs ma dang dangs ma de nyid las zas kyi tshigs ma'i dangs mar gyur pa de ni gcin yin par shes par bya la /
translated: The coarse part of the food is the feces.🔽The refined part of the food is the urine.🔽The coarse part of the food is the feces.

original: tshigs ma'i skabs gong bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bshang ba yin par shes par bya'o //🔽dangs ma lus zungs rang rang gi //
analyzed: tshigs ma'i skabs gong bur gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bshang ba yin par shes par bya'o // dangs ma lus zungs rang rang gi //
translated: The refined part of the food is the urine.

original: me drod kyis smin rnam bdun 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: me drod kyis smin rnam bdun 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: The refined part of the food is transformed by the digestive heat of the body into seven parts.🔽The refined part of the food is transformed by the digestive heat of the body into seven parts.

original: zas kyi dangs ma bcud du gyur pa'i dangs pa'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de lus zungs rang gi me drod kyis yang smin cing tshos par byas ba na rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas kyi dangs ma bcud du gyur pa'i dangs pa'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de lus zungs rang gi me drod kyis yang smin cing tshos par byas ba na rnam pa bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: The essence of food, which is the pure part, is the nature of the pure essence. When the body’s own heat ripens and cooks it, it becomes seven parts.🔽From the pure essence, blood arises. From blood, flesh. From flesh, fat. From fat, bone.

original: dangs ma las khrag de las sha / sha las tshil te de las rus //🔽rus rkang de las khu ba yin //
analyzed: dangs ma las khrag de las sha / sha las tshil te de las rus // rus rkang de las khu ba yin //
translated: From bone, marrow. From marrow, semen.

original: khu ba las ni mngal gnas 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khu ba las ni mngal gnas 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: From semen, the embryo.

original: lus zungs kyi dang po dangs ma las ni khrag tu 'gyur ro //🔽khrag de las ni sha ru 'gyur la /
analyzed: lus zungs kyi dang po dangs ma las ni khrag tu 'gyur ro // khrag de las ni sha ru 'gyur la /
translated: From the first body constituent, the pure essence, blood arises.🔽From blood, flesh arises.

original: sha las ni tshil du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sha las ni tshil du 'gyur ro //
translated: From flesh, fat arises.

original: tshil las ni rus pa'o ;🔽/ rus pa las ni rkang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshil las ni rus pa'o ; / rus pa las ni rkang du 'gyur ro //
translated: From fat, bone arises.🔽From bone, marrow arises.

original: rkang las ni khu chur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkang las ni khu chur 'gyur ro //
translated: From marrow, semen arises.

original: khu chu las ni mngal du gnas shing bu chags pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khu chu las ni mngal du gnas shing bu chags pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: From semen, the embryo arises, which is the cause of conception.

original: lus zungs tshigs ma rim bzhin du //
analyzed: lus zungs tshigs ma rim bzhin du //
translated: The body constituents are in order.

original: bad mkhris bu ga'i dri ma dang // rdul dang sen mo ba spu dang // mig lpags bshang snum dangs ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bad mkhris bu ga'i dri ma dang // rdul dang sen mo ba spu dang // mig lpags bshang snum dangs ma yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: eye discharge, feces, oil of the feces, and semen.

original: de las lus zungs kyi nang na dangs ma'i tshigs ma ni bad kan no //🔽khrag gi tshigs ma ni mkhris pa'o //
analyzed: de las lus zungs kyi nang na dangs ma'i tshigs ma ni bad kan no // khrag gi tshigs ma ni mkhris pa'o //
translated: From that, the essence of the body constituents is phlegm.🔽The essence of blood is bile.

original: sha'i tshigs ma ni bu ga ste /
analyzed: sha'i tshigs ma ni bu ga ste /
translated: The essence of flesh is the pores.

original: rna ba dang mig dang sna dang kha dang ba spu'i bu ga dang / bshang sgo dang mtshan gyi nang nas gang dag 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: rna ba dang mig dang sna dang kha dang ba spu'i bu ga dang / bshang sgo dang mtshan gyi nang nas gang dag 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: Those that arise from the ears, eyes, nose, mouth, pores of the body, anus, and the inside of the penis.

original: tshil gyi tshigs ma ni gang lus kyi nang nas rdul 'byung ba'o //🔽rus pa'i tshigs ma ni sen mo dang ba spu'o //
analyzed: tshil gyi tshigs ma ni gang lus kyi nang nas rdul 'byung ba'o // rus pa'i tshigs ma ni sen mo dang ba spu'o //
translated: The essence of fat is the sweat that arises from the inside of the body.🔽The essence of bone is the nails and body hair.

original: rkang gi tshigs ma ni mig dang pags pa dang bshang ba'i yul snum pa'o //
analyzed: rkang gi tshigs ma ni mig dang pags pa dang bshang ba'i yul snum pa'o //
translated: The essence of marrow is the oiliness of the eyes, skin, and feces.

original: khu chu'i tshigs ma ni lus zungs thams cad kyi mdangs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khu chu'i tshigs ma ni lus zungs thams cad kyi mdangs su gyur pa'o //
translated: The essence of semen is the radiance of all the body constituents.

original: de ltar na rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba yin te /
translated: Thus, they are applied in order.

original: tshigs ma @40a * //
analyzed: tshigs ma @40a * //
translated: The essence of the body constituents.

original: zhes bya ba ni dri ma la bya ba'i don no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dri ma la bya ba'i don no //
translated: This is the meaning of “impurity.”

original: de ltar lus zungs smin pa las //
analyzed: de ltar lus zungs smin pa las //
translated: Thus, from the ripening of the body’s constituents,

original: dangs ma tshigs ma gnyis su 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dangs ma tshigs ma gnyis su 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the pure and impure are formed.🔽The pure and so forth, as explained above, are the body’s constituents.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i dangs ma sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams ni me drod kyis smin par byas pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i dangs ma sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams ni me drod kyis smin par byas pa las /
translated: From the ripening of these by the heat of the digestive fire,

original: dangs ma dang snyigs ma ste /
analyzed: dangs ma dang snyigs ma ste /
translated: the pure and the impure are formed.

original: gnyis su 'gyur zhing rnam pa gnyis kho nar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su 'gyur zhing rnam pa gnyis kho nar gnas pa yin no //
translated: They are formed in two parts and remain in two parts.

original: lus zungs snum ni gcig la gcig / phan tshun nye bar brten pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus zungs snum ni gcig la gcig / phan tshun nye bar brten pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The body’s constituents are oily and mutually supportive.

original: lus zungs rnams kyi snum ni dangs ma'i snying po ste /
analyzed: lus zungs rnams kyi snum ni dangs ma'i snying po ste /
translated: The body’s constituents are oily because of the essence of the pure.🔽The essence of the body’s constituents is passed from one to another.🔽When it is satisfied and supported by the nutritive essence of food, it remains uninterrupted and connected.

original: lus zungs kyi snying po de gcig las gcig tu brgyud cing zas kyi ro bcud kyis tshim zhing brten par byas pa las rgyun mi 'chad cing 'brel te gnas pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun nye bar brten pa las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: lus zungs kyi snying po de gcig las gcig tu brgyud cing zas kyi ro bcud kyis tshim zhing brten par byas pa las rgyun mi 'chad cing 'brel te gnas pa gang yin pa de ni phan tshun nye bar brten pa las skyes pa yin te /
translated: This is called “mutually supportive.”

original: lus zungs 'di dag phan tshun gcig la gcig brten cing 'dab 'byor pa de las lus zungs kyi snum gcig nas gcig tu brgyud ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus zungs 'di dag phan tshun gcig la gcig brten cing 'dab 'byor pa de las lus zungs kyi snum gcig nas gcig tu brgyud ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: These bodily constituents are mutually dependent and connected. From one bodily constituent, the oil passes to another.

original: zas 'ju dangs ma sogs rim gyis //
analyzed: zas 'ju dangs ma sogs rim gyis //
translated: The essence of food, etc.,

original: khu chur gyur pa la la ni //🔽nyin zhag gcig 'dod gzhan dag ni //🔽zhag drug kha cig zla gcig 'dod //
analyzed: khu chur gyur pa la la ni // nyin zhag gcig 'dod gzhan dag ni // zhag drug kha cig zla gcig 'dod //
translated: gradually becomes semen.🔽Some say it is in one day, others in six days,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: and still others in one month.

original: zas dang po zhu nas dangs ma la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khu chu nyid du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: zas dang po zhu nas dangs ma la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khu chu nyid du gyur pa ni /
translated: The essence of food, etc., having been digested, gradually becomes semen by the characteristic of complete transformation.

original: sman pa la la nyin zhag gcig gis 'gyur bar 'dod la /
analyzed: sman pa la la nyin zhag gcig gis 'gyur bar 'dod la /
translated: Some physicians say that it is in one day.

original: sman pa gzhan dag ni zhag drug gis khu chu dag tu 'gyur ro //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sman pa gzhan dag ni zhag drug gis khu chu dag tu 'gyur ro // zhes zer ro //
translated: Other physicians say that it becomes semen in six days.

original: yang srog 'tsho ba'i slob dpon kha cig zas zhu nas dangs ma la sogs pa rim gyis zla ba gcig gis khu chur 'gyur bar 'dod do //
analyzed: yang srog 'tsho ba'i slob dpon kha cig zas zhu nas dangs ma la sogs pa rim gyis zla ba gcig gis khu chur 'gyur bar 'dod do //
translated: Again, some masters of life say that it becomes semen in one month, after the essence of food, etc., has been digested.

original: lus kyi zungs ni zas kyi rgyun //
analyzed: lus kyi zungs ni zas kyi rgyun //
translated: The bodily constituents are the continuum of food.

original: 'khor lo lta bur yongs su 'khor //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor lo lta bur yongs su 'khor // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is like a wheel, it turns around.

original: lus zungs rnams kyi zas yin pas na lus zungs kyi zas te /
analyzed: lus zungs rnams kyi zas yin pas na lus zungs kyi zas te /
translated: The food of the elements of the body is the food of the elements of the body.

original: lus zungs rnams ni lus zungs kyi zas yin no //🔽zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus zungs rnams ni lus zungs kyi zas yin no // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The elements of the body are the food of the elements of the body.

original: de ltar na lus zungs rnams kyi rten du ni lus zungs rnams gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na lus zungs rnams kyi rten du ni lus zungs rnams gnas pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the elements of the body are the support of the elements of the body.

original: de rnams kyi rgyu ba'i rgyun ni 'khor lo'i tshul ltar rgyun mi 'chad par 'khor ba yin zhing zas la brten pas brtas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyu ba'i rgyun ni 'khor lo'i tshul ltar rgyun mi 'chad par 'khor ba yin zhing zas la brten pas brtas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The continuity of their movement is like a wheel, it turns around without interruption, because it is nourished by food.

original: ro tsa la sogs mthu yis ni //🔽'phral du khu ba la sogs skyed //
analyzed: ro tsa la sogs mthu yis ni // 'phral du khu ba la sogs skyed //
translated: By the power of alchemy, etc.,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: semen, etc. are immediately generated.🔽By the power of alchemy, etc.🔽Food that is made into elixir, such as milk, meat broth, etc. and likewise, by the power of alchemy, etc.

original: 'o ma dang sha khu la sogs ba ro tsa bar byed pa'i kha zas @40b dang de bzhin du sogs zhes smos pas dug dang sbyar dug rab tu zhi ba la sogs pas 'phral du ste /🔽de'i mod la de'i khu ba la sogs pa skyed do //
analyzed: 'o ma dang sha khu la sogs ba ro tsa bar byed pa'i kha zas @40b dang de bzhin du sogs zhes smos pas dug dang sbyar dug rab tu zhi ba la sogs pas 'phral du ste /🔽de'i mod la de'i khu ba la sogs pa skyed do //
translated: By the power of alchemy, etc.

original: phal cher sman gzhan nyin zhag ni //
analyzed: phal cher sman gzhan nyin zhag ni //
translated: Most medicines act for one day and night.

original: gcig gis las rnams byed pa yin //
analyzed: gcig gis las rnams byed pa yin //
translated: The others act for a day.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ro tsa ba la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i sman gzhan phye ma dang bu ram la sogs pa /
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ro tsa ba la sogs pa ma gtogs pa'i sman gzhan phye ma dang bu ram la sogs pa /
translated: “most” refers to medicines other than mercury and so forth, such as powders and molasses.

original: smin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa dag ni /
analyzed: smin pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa dag ni /
translated: They act to ripen and so forth.

original: phal cher nyin zhag gcig ni rang gi las byed pa yin no //🔽khyab byed kyis dangs lus zungs rnams //
analyzed: phal cher nyin zhag gcig ni rang gi las byed pa yin no // khyab byed kyis dangs lus zungs rnams //
translated: They act for one day and night.

original: 'thor bar byed pa'i las kyis ni //
analyzed: 'thor bar byed pa'i las kyis ni //
translated: The pervading wind, by its function of scattering the pure essence and body constituents,

original: cig car rgyun mi 'chad kun tu //
analyzed: cig car rgyun mi 'chad kun tu //
translated: continuously and all at once

original: lus la rtag tu rnam par 'thor //
analyzed: lus la rtag tu rnam par 'thor //
translated: always scatters them throughout the body.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: rlung khyab byed kyis dangs ma dang / lus zungs rnams la 'thor zhing khyab par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rlung khyab byed kyis dangs ma dang / lus zungs rnams la 'thor zhing khyab par byed pa yin la /
translated: the pervading wind scatters and pervades the pure essence and body constituents.

original: 'thor zhing khyab par byed pa'i las de dang 'tsham pa'i rang bzhin du grub pa gang yin pa des cig car rgyun mi 'chad cing bar chad med par lus la rtag tu rnam par 'thor zhing khyab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'thor zhing khyab par byed pa'i las de dang 'tsham pa'i rang bzhin du grub pa gang yin pa des cig car rgyun mi 'chad cing bar chad med par lus la rtag tu rnam par 'thor zhing khyab par byed pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the wind that scatters and diffuses is such that it always scatters and diffuses throughout the body, without interruption and without break.

original: gtor tshe bu ga'i skyon gyis ni //
analyzed: gtor tshe bu ga'i skyon gyis ni //
translated: When it is disturbed, the pure

original: dangs ma gong du chags gyur te //
analyzed: dangs ma gong du chags gyur te //
translated: nutriment is formed above,

original: der ni gnod pa skyed byed de //🔽mkha' la sprin chags char 'bab mtshungs //
analyzed: der ni gnod pa skyed byed de // mkha' la sprin chags char 'bab mtshungs //
translated: and it produces harm there,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: like clouds gathering in the sky and rain falling.

original: dangs ma'i zas rab tu sgrub bor byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dangs ma'i zas rab tu sgrub bor byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The wind that forms the pure nutriment is called “the one that scatters and diffuses.”

original: khyab byed kyis gtor ba'i tshe bu ga nad kyis 'khrugs pa'i skyon gyis dangs ma'i phyogs gang du chags shing gnas par gyur pa'i lus kyi phyogs der gnod pa byed cing nad skyed par byed do //
analyzed: khyab byed kyis gtor ba'i tshe bu ga nad kyis 'khrugs pa'i skyon gyis dangs ma'i phyogs gang du chags shing gnas par gyur pa'i lus kyi phyogs der gnod pa byed cing nad skyed par byed do //
translated: When it is disturbed, the pure nutriment is formed in the place where the body is disturbed by the fault of a disease, and it produces harm and disease in that place of the body.

original: de yang ji ltar nam mkha'i bar snang la sprin chags par gyur na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar nam mkha'i bar snang la sprin chags par gyur na /
translated: And that is like clouds gathering in the sky and rain falling.

original: de las char bab par 'gyur ba dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de las char bab par 'gyur ba dang mtshungs so //
translated: It is like rain falling from that.

original: nad kyang ma snyoms gyur pa las //
analyzed: nad kyang ma snyoms gyur pa las //
translated: Also, disease is from imbalance.

original: phyogs gcig 'dus na ldang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyogs gcig 'dus na ldang bar 'gyur //
translated: If it is collected in one place, it arises.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the statement,

original: rlung la sogs pa'i nad rnams kyang tshul de bzhin du ma snyoms par gyur pa las phyogs gcig tu 'dus na gnas kyi skyon gyis nad skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nad rnams kyang tshul de bzhin du ma snyoms par gyur pa las phyogs gcig tu 'dus na gnas kyi skyon gyis nad skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “Also, disease such as wind is from imbalance. If it is collected in one place, it arises from the fault of location.”

original: de ltar 'byung ba lus zungs me'i //
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba lus zungs me'i //
translated: Thus, the function of fire in the body

original: las ni yongs su bshad pa yin ;
analyzed: las ni yongs su bshad pa yin ;
translated: is completely explained.

original: / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the statement,

original: de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas me'i las bshad cing bstan pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa'i rim pas me'i las bshad cing bstan pa yin /
translated: “Thus, the function of fire is explained in this order.”

original: de yang zas 'ju zhing smin pa'i las dang de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po lnga dang de bzhin du lus zungs kyi me bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang zas 'ju zhing smin pa'i las dang de bzhin du 'byung ba chen po lnga dang de bzhin du lus zungs kyi me bshad pa yin te /
translated: Also, it is the function of digesting and ripening food. Likewise, it is the function of the five great elements. Likewise, it is the fire of the body’s constituents.

original: zas kyi me ni /
analyzed: zas kyi me ni /
translated: The fire of food🔽is explained by the statement,

original: zas ni dus su zos gyur ba //
analyzed: zas ni dus su zos gyur ba //
translated: “Food is eaten at the proper time.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas @41a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas @41a * //
translated: And so on.

original: lto ba'i me'i las bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: lto ba'i me'i las bshad pa yin no //
translated: The function of the fire of the stomach is explained.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung //
translated: Earth, water, fire, and wind

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: This and the rest

original: 'byung ba lnga'i las bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba lnga'i las bshad pa yin no //
translated: explain the functions of the five elements.

original: dangs ma lus zungs rang rang gis //
analyzed: dangs ma lus zungs rang rang gis //
translated: The pure essence of the body is the🔽constituents.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This

original: lus zungs kyi me'i las bshad pa yin no //🔽smin byed kun la zas 'ju ba'i //
analyzed: lus zungs kyi me'i las bshad pa yin no // smin byed kun la zas 'ju ba'i //
translated: explains the functions of the fire of the body constituents.🔽The fire that digests all food is

original: me ni lhag pa yin par 'dod //
analyzed: me ni lhag pa yin par 'dod //
translated: considered to be the most important.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: This

original: smin par byed pa me'i drod thams cad kyi nang nas zas 'ju bar byed pa'i pho ba'i me drod gang yin pa de ni lhag cing mchog tu gyur par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: smin par byed pa me'i drod thams cad kyi nang nas zas 'ju bar byed pa'i pho ba'i me drod gang yin pa de ni lhag cing mchog tu gyur par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: means that from among all the digestive heat of fire that ripens, the digestive heat of the stomach that digests food is considered to be the most important and the best.

original: de ni rtsa ba de 'phel 'phel //
analyzed: de ni rtsa ba de 'phel 'phel //
translated: That is the root. When it increases,

original: zad gyur zad pa'i bdag nyid 'gyur //
analyzed: zad gyur zad pa'i bdag nyid 'gyur //
translated: all increase. When it diminishes, it diminishes.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This

original: gang gi phyir zas 'ju ba'i me drod de ni rtsa ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zas 'ju ba'i me drod de ni rtsa ba yin te /
translated: means that because that digestive heat of food is the root,

original: 'phel bar gyur na /
analyzed: 'phel bar gyur na /
translated: when it increases,

original: me drod gzhan dag kyang 'phel bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: me drod gzhan dag kyang 'phel bar 'gyur la /
translated: all other digestive heat increases.

original: zas kyi me drod de zad par gyur na 'byung ba lnga dang lus zungs kyi me drod kyang zas kyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zas kyi me drod de zad par gyur na 'byung ba lnga dang lus zungs kyi me drod kyang zas kyi bdag nyid can du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the fire of digestion is extinguished, the fire of the five elements and the body’s constituents also become the nature of food.

original: de bas rigs pas cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: de bas rigs pas cho ga bzhin //
translated: Therefore, by the method,

original: zas skom rigs shing phan pa yin //
analyzed: zas skom rigs shing phan pa yin //
translated: food and drink are appropriate and beneficial.

original: de 'bad pas bsrung gnas gyur na //
analyzed: de 'bad pas bsrung gnas gyur na //
translated: If one guards it with effort,

original: tshe dang stobs ni gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe dang stobs ni gnas par 'gyur //
translated: life and strength remain.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: de ltar rtsa ba yin pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: de ltar rtsa ba yin pa'i rgyu yin pa de bas na /
translated: since it is the root cause,

original: zas 'ju bar byed pa'i me drod de rigs shing phan pa'i cho ga bzhin du zas dang skom gyi bud shing rjes su mthun par bsrung zhing bskyang ba la 'bad pa dang ldan bar bya'o //
analyzed: zas 'ju bar byed pa'i me drod de rigs shing phan pa'i cho ga bzhin du zas dang skom gyi bud shing rjes su mthun par bsrung zhing bskyang ba la 'bad pa dang ldan bar bya'o //
translated: one should guard and protect the fire of digestion that digests food with the effort of being endowed with the method, with food and drink that are appropriate and beneficial, like fuel for the fire.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽zas 'ju ba'i pho ba'i me gnas par gyur na tshe gnas par 'gyur ba dang / lus kyi stobs gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / zas 'ju ba'i pho ba'i me gnas par gyur na tshe gnas par 'gyur ba dang / lus kyi stobs gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Why is that?🔽If the fire of digestion in the stomach remains, life remains and the strength of the body remains.

original: mnyam gnas rang gnas 'dug na mnyam //
analyzed: mnyam gnas rang gnas 'dug na mnyam //
translated: If the fire of digestion remains in its own place, it is balanced.

original: mnyam las gzhan 'gro drod mi snyoms //
analyzed: mnyam las gzhan 'gro drod mi snyoms //
translated: From balance, going elsewhere, heat is not balanced.

original: mkhris pa shas cher rno bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhris pa shas cher rno bar 'gyur //
translated: If it is aggravated by bile, it becomes sharp.

original: bad kan gyis gnod me drod chung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bad kan gyis gnod me drod chung // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is impaired by phlegm, it is weak.

original: me dang mnyam du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rlung rang gi gnas su 'dug la /
analyzed: me dang mnyam du gnas pa zhes bya ba'i rlung rang gi gnas su 'dug la /
translated: The wind that is called “abiding with fire” is located in its own place.

original: me'i drod kyang mnyam zhing snyoms par 'gyur la /
analyzed: me'i drod kyang mnyam zhing snyoms par 'gyur la /
translated: The heat of fire is even and balanced.

original: lam gzhan du 'gro zhing rang gi gnas na 'dug na me'i drod mi snyoms shing cha mi snyoms par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: lam gzhan du 'gro zhing rang gi gnas na 'dug na me'i drod mi snyoms shing cha mi snyoms par 'gyur ro ;
translated: If it goes elsewhere and is not in its own place, the heat of fire is not balanced and is not equal.

original: / me dang mnyam du gnas pa de bad kan gyi shas kyis mnan cing gnod par gyur na /
analyzed: / me dang mnyam du gnas pa de bad kan gyi shas kyis mnan cing gnod par gyur na /
translated: If that “abiding with fire” is oppressed and impaired by an excess of phlegm,

original: me drod chung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me drod chung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the heat of fire becomes weak.

original: me drod mnyam dang mi mnyam rno //
analyzed: me drod mnyam dang mi mnyam rno //
translated: The heat of fire is even, uneven, sharp,

original: chung dang de ltar rnam bzhi yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chung dang de ltar rnam bzhi yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and weak—thus it is of four kinds.

original: me'i drod kyi stobs kyi dbye ba ni cha mnyam pa dang / cha mi mnyam pa dang / rno ba dang chung @41b ba ste rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: me'i drod kyi stobs kyi dbye ba ni cha mnyam pa dang / cha mi mnyam pa dang / rno ba dang chung @41b ba ste rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The classification of the power of the heat of fire is of four kinds: even, uneven, sharp, and weak.

original: gang zhig zas ni legs zos pa //
analyzed: gang zhig zas ni legs zos pa //
translated: If one eats food well,

original: legs par 'ju 'di mnyam pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: legs par 'ju 'di mnyam pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: 1. The fire is equal in strength.

original: da la me shas mnyam pa ni zas kyi tshod la sogs pa legs par brtags te /
analyzed: da la me shas mnyam pa ni zas kyi tshod la sogs pa legs par brtags te /
translated: The fire is equal in strength when one has eaten the right amount of food, etc.

original: zos ba de legs par 'ju bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: zos ba de legs par 'ju bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The food is well digested.🔽2. The fire is not equal in strength.🔽The fire is not equal in strength when one has not eaten the right amount of food, etc.

original: legs par ma zos myur 'ju ba'am //
analyzed: legs par ma zos myur 'ju ba'am //
translated: The food is digested too quickly or too slowly.🔽The fire is not equal in strength when one has not eaten the right amount of food, etc.

original: legs zos ring zhing 'ju mi mnyam //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽me drod mi mnyam zhing mi snyoms pa ni /
analyzed: legs zos ring zhing 'ju mi mnyam // zhes bya ba la / me drod mi mnyam zhing mi snyoms pa ni /
translated: The food is digested too quickly or too slowly.🔽3. The fire is sharp.🔽The fire is sharp when one has not eaten the right amount of food, etc.🔽The food is digested quickly.

original: zas kyi cho ga'i tshul bzhin du legs par ma zos kyang myur du 'ju ba'am legs par zos su zin kyang ring zhig na 'ju bar gyur pa yin no //🔽zas ni legs par ma zos kyang //
analyzed: zas kyi cho ga'i tshul bzhin du legs par ma zos kyang myur du 'ju ba'am legs par zos su zin kyang ring zhig na 'ju bar gyur pa yin no // zas ni legs par ma zos kyang //
translated: The fire is sharp when one has not eaten the right amount of food, etc.🔽The food is digested quickly.

original: myur 'ju me drod rnon po yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽me'i drod rnon po'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: myur 'ju me drod rnon po yin // zhes bya ba la / me'i drod rnon po'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: 4. The fire is weak.🔽The fire is weak when one has not eaten the right amount of food, etc.🔽The food is digested slowly.

original: tshad la sogs pa dang ldan par legs par ma zos su zin kyang myur du 'ju bar byed pa yin te /🔽de nyid 'phel bar gyur na /
analyzed: tshad la sogs pa dang ldan par legs par ma zos su zin kyang myur du 'ju bar byed pa yin te / de nyid 'phel bar gyur na /
translated: The fire is weak when one has not eaten the right amount of food, etc.

original: me drod drags ches par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me drod drags ches par 'gyur ro //
translated: The food is digested slowly.

original: zas ni legs par zos gyur kyang //
analyzed: zas ni legs par zos gyur kyang //
translated: Even though one eats well,

original: ring nas 'ju zhing kha skam dang // sbo dang rgyu ma 'khrugs pa dang // lci ba me drod chung ba yin //
analyzed: ring nas 'ju zhing kha skam dang // sbo dang rgyu ma 'khrugs pa dang // lci ba me drod chung ba yin //
translated: one digests food after a long time, one’s mouth is dry, one’s stomach is distended, one’s intestines are twisted, and one’s digestive heat is low.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: me drod chung ba ni zas kyi cho ga legs par zos su zin kyang kha sgam pa la sogs par byed nas ring zhig na gdod 'ju bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: me drod chung ba ni zas kyi cho ga legs par zos su zin kyang kha sgam pa la sogs par byed nas ring zhig na gdod 'ju bar byed pa yin no //
translated: even though one eats well according to the rules for food, one digests it after a long time, one’s mouth is dry, and so on.

original: rgyu ma 'khrugs pa ni sgra mi gsal bar krug krug zer ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma 'khrugs pa ni sgra mi gsal bar krug krug zer ba'o //
translated: Twisted intestines are indistinct sounds like “krruk krruk.”

original: lci ba ni lus kyi khong lci zhing snyom pa'o //
analyzed: lci ba ni lus kyi khong lci zhing snyom pa'o //
translated: Heavy means the body is heavy and sluggish.

original: me drod nyams na 'chi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: me drod nyams na 'chi 'gyur zhing //
translated: If digestive heat declines, one dies.

original: skyon med na ni yun ring 'tsho //
analyzed: skyon med na ni yun ring 'tsho //
translated: If it is unimpaired, one lives long.

original: ma snyoms nad ni skye 'gyur bas //
analyzed: ma snyoms nad ni skye 'gyur bas //
translated: If it is unbalanced, illness arises.

original: de'i phyir me drod gtso bo yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir me drod gtso bo yin //
translated: Therefore, digestive heat is primary.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gong du smos pa'i me drod nyams shing med par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i me drod nyams shing med par gyur na ni /
translated: if the digestive heat mentioned above declines and disappears,

original: 'chi zhing srog 'dor bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'chi zhing srog 'dor bar 'gyur la /
translated: one dies and loses one’s life.

original: skyon med cing nad kyi nyes pa dang ma 'dres na yun ring du 'tsho zhing tshe gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon med cing nad kyi nyes pa dang ma 'dres na yun ring du 'tsho zhing tshe gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the body is free from faults and not mixed with the faults of disease, it will live long and endure.

original: me'i drod che chung ma snyoms par gyur na ni nad rnams skyed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: me'i drod che chung ma snyoms par gyur na ni nad rnams skyed par 'gyur la /
translated: If the heat of the fire is not balanced, diseases will arise.

original: de bas na me'i drod ni lus gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na me'i drod ni lus gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the heat of the fire is the basis of the body.

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus it is explained.🔽The strength of the body is threefold:

original: lus stobs lhan cig skyes pa dang // dus skyes rigs pa las byug gsum //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus stobs lhan cig skyes pa dang // dus skyes rigs pa las byug gsum // zhes bya ba la /
translated: innate, arisen from time, and arisen from practice.

original: lus kyi stobs kyi tshul ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: lus kyi stobs kyi tshul ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the way of the strength of the body is threefold:

original: lhan cig skyes pa dang / dus kyi dbang gis skyes pa dang / rigs pa'i sbyor ba las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa dang / dus kyi dbang gis skyes pa dang / rigs pa'i sbyor ba las skyes pa'o //
translated: innate, arisen from the power of time, and arisen from the practice of reason.

original: de la lus sems las byung ba //
analyzed: de la lus sems las byung ba //
translated: Among them, the strength of the body and mind

original: rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i stobs //
analyzed: rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i stobs //
translated: is the innate strength by nature.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: stobs de dag gi @42a * //
analyzed: stobs de dag gi @42a * //
translated: among those strengths,

original: nang nas lus dang sems las byung ba'i stobs rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'am /
analyzed: nang nas lus dang sems las byung ba'i stobs rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'am /
translated: the strength of the body and mind is the innate strength that exists by nature.

original: tha mal par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyas pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha mal par gnas pa gang yin pa de ni lhan cig skyas pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is present as ordinary is called the power of co-emergence.

original: na tshod dus tshigs las byung ba //🔽dus skyes yin te /
analyzed: na tshod dus tshigs las byung ba // dus skyes yin te /
translated: That which arises from age and season

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is called the power of time.🔽That which arises from age is divided by the divisions of childhood, youth, and so on.

original: na tshod byis pa dang dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba'i dbang las byung zhing na tshod ji lta ba'i tshul ma skyes pa dang / dgun la sogs pa'i dus las byung zhing skyed pa'i dus las bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: na tshod byis pa dang dar la bab pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas phye ba'i dbang las byung zhing na tshod ji lta ba'i tshul ma skyes pa dang / dgun la sogs pa'i dus las byung zhing skyed pa'i dus las bskyed pa ste /
translated: That which arises from season is generated by the season of winter and so on.

original: de gnyis ni dus las skyes pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni dus las skyes pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: Those two are called the power of time.

original: rigs pa las /🔽byung ba spyod lam zas gyis bskyed ;
analyzed: rigs pa las / byung ba spyod lam zas gyis bskyed ;
translated: From the Principles of Reasoning:🔽Arising from conduct, behavior, and food,

original: / de bzhin gzi bskyed sbyor las byung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / de bzhin gzi bskyed sbyor las byung //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: and likewise from the power of the elements and from application.

original: de la rigs pa las byung ba'i stobs spyod lam zhes pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byas pa'i spyod lam rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / de bzhin du zas kyi rnam pa bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldag pa dang / myang ba la sogs pa rnam pa du ma ste /
analyzed: de la rigs pa las byung ba'i stobs spyod lam zhes pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyis byas pa'i spyod lam rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / de bzhin du zas kyi rnam pa bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / bldag pa dang / myang ba la sogs pa rnam pa du ma ste /
translated: The power derived from reasoning is the various kinds of conduct of body, speech, and mind, and likewise, the various kinds of food, such as what is eaten, drunk, chewed, and tasted.

original: de gnyis las byung ba ni rigs pa las byung ba zhes bya'o //🔽de yang rigs pa ni 'di dang 'di ltar bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las byung ba ni rigs pa las byung ba zhes bya'o // de yang rigs pa ni 'di dang 'di ltar bya'o //
translated: That which arises from those two is called “derived from reasoning.”

original: zhes bya ba'i cho ga'i tshul nges pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i cho ga'i tshul nges pa ste /
translated: Moreover, reasoning is the ascertained rule of the form “This is to be done in this way.”

original: de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from that.

original: de bzhin du gzi mdangs bskyed pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba de yang rigs pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzi mdangs bskyed pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba de yang rigs pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: Likewise, that which arises from the application that generates brilliance is also derived from reasoning.

original: gzi mdangs bskyed pa'i sbyor ba ni phal cher bcud kyis len pa dang / ro tsa ba'i sbyor ba yin pas /
analyzed: gzi mdangs bskyed pa'i sbyor ba ni phal cher bcud kyis len pa dang / ro tsa ba'i sbyor ba yin pas /
translated: The application that generates brilliance is for the most part the application of elixirs and ointments,

original: de gnyis las skyes pas na gzi mdangs bskyed pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las skyes pas na gzi mdangs bskyed pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and because it arises from those two, it is called “that which arises from the application that generates brilliance.”

original: yul phyogs shing ri chu nyung la //
analyzed: yul phyogs shing ri chu nyung la //
translated: The country is dry, with few trees, mountains, and rivers.

original: skams nad nyung skyed byed yin //
analyzed: skams nad nyung skyed byed yin //
translated: It produces few diseases and is healthy.

original: rlan can de las bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: rlan can de las bzlog pa yin //
translated: A wet country is the opposite of that.

original: cha mnyam thun mong yin par bshad //
analyzed: cha mnyam thun mong yin par bshad //
translated: A country with a balance of the two is said to be common.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: skam sa'i yul phyogs shing dang ri dang chu nyung zhing shas chung ba gang yin pa de ni nad nyung ba skyed cing nad med pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: skam sa'i yul phyogs shing dang ri dang chu nyung zhing shas chung ba gang yin pa de ni nad nyung ba skyed cing nad med pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: A dry country, with few trees, mountains, and rivers, produces few diseases and is a cause of good health.

original: yul sa rlan can dag ni skams las go bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: yul sa rlan can dag ni skams las go bzlog pa yin te /
translated: A wet country is the opposite of that.

original: shing dang ri dang chu mang ba de nad skyed pa yin no ;
analyzed: shing dang ri dang chu mang ba de nad skyed pa yin no ;
translated: It has many trees, mountains, and rivers, and produces diseases.

original: / de gnyi ga'i cha mnyam pa ni thun mong yin te /
analyzed: / de gnyi ga'i cha mnyam pa ni thun mong yin te /
translated: A country with a balance of the two is common,

original: gnyi ga'i cha yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽rkang dang tshil dang zhag dang gcin //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha yod pa'i phyir ro // rkang dang tshil dang zhag dang gcin //
translated: because it has a balance of the two.🔽Bones, fat, marrow, and phlegm,

original: mkhris pa bad kan phyi sa khrag / dangs ma chu rnams lus gnas pa'i //
analyzed: mkhris pa bad kan phyi sa khrag / dangs ma chu rnams lus gnas pa'i //
translated: bile, feces, blood, and lymph,

original: snyim pa re res bskyed par bya //
analyzed: snyim pa re res bskyed par bya //
translated: are produced by each of the body’s🔽two hundred half-palms.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: lus dang rkang nas chu'i bar dag gang @42b yod pa ni snyim pa re res bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: lus dang rkang nas chu'i bar dag gang @42b yod pa ni snyim pa re res bskyed par bya ste /
translated: The body, legs, and so on, up to water, are generated by each handful.

original: de'ang / rkang ni snyim pa gcig go //
analyzed: de'ang / rkang ni snyim pa gcig go //
translated: The legs are one handful.

original: tshil ni snyim pa gnyis so //
analyzed: tshil ni snyim pa gnyis so //
translated: The fat is two handfuls.

original: zhag ni snyim pa gsum mo //
analyzed: zhag ni snyim pa gsum mo //
translated: The lymph is three handfuls.

original: gcin ni snyim pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gcin ni snyim pa bzhi'o //
translated: The urine is four handfuls.

original: mkhris pa ni snyim pa lnga'o //
analyzed: mkhris pa ni snyim pa lnga'o //
translated: The bile is five handfuls.

original: bad kan ni drug go //
analyzed: bad kan ni drug go //
translated: The phlegm is six handfuls.

original: phyis ni bdun no //
analyzed: phyis ni bdun no //
translated: The pus is seven handfuls.

original: khrag ni brgyad do //
analyzed: khrag ni brgyad do //
translated: The blood is eight handfuls.

original: dangs ma ni dgu'o //
analyzed: dangs ma ni dgu'o //
translated: The essence is nine handfuls.

original: chu ni snyim pa bcu'o //
analyzed: chu ni snyim pa bcu'o //
translated: The water is ten handfuls.

original: mdangs dang klad rgyas khu chu ni //
analyzed: mdangs dang klad rgyas khu chu ni //
translated: The radiance, the brain, and the semen

original: re re 'ang rang gi khyor gang yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re re 'ang rang gi khyor gang yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: are each one’s own palmful.

original: dangs ma la sogs pa gsum po ni re re zhing yang rang gi khyor tshad kyi khyor re re yod par slob dpon dag gis bshad do //
analyzed: dangs ma la sogs pa gsum po ni re re zhing yang rang gi khyor tshad kyi khyor re re yod par slob dpon dag gis bshad do //
translated: The masters explain that each of the three, the essence and so on, is one’s own palmful.🔽Women have two palmfuls of breast milk

original: bud med nu zho snyim do dang // zla mtshan snyim pa bzhi yod do //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bud med nu zho snyim do dang // zla mtshan snyim pa bzhi yod do // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and four palmfuls of menstrual blood.

original: bud med rnams la nu zho ni rang gi tshad kyi snyim do yod la /
analyzed: bud med rnams la nu zho ni rang gi tshad kyi snyim do yod la /
translated: Women have two palmfuls of breast milk, which is their own measure.

original: zla mtshan gyi khrag ni snyim pa bzhi yod pa yin no //
analyzed: zla mtshan gyi khrag ni snyim pa bzhi yod pa yin no //
translated: The menstrual blood is four seers.

original: 'di ltar snyim pa dang khyor ba zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar snyim pa dang khyor ba zhes smos pa ni /
translated: Thus, it is said that a “handful” and a “palmful”

original: rang rang gi lag pa'i tshad kyi che chung la bya'i /
analyzed: rang rang gi lag pa'i tshad kyi che chung la bya'i /
translated: are the size of one’s own hand.

original: srang tshad kyi yi ge las smos pa ltar srang bzhi dang srang gnyis la mi bya ste /
analyzed: srang tshad kyi yi ge las smos pa ltar srang bzhi dang srang gnyis la mi bya ste /
translated: It is not four or two seers, as stated in the text on weights and measures,

original: 'dir rang gi zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi zhes smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it says “one’s own” here.

original: de la snyim pa ni lag pa gnyis sbyar ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la snyim pa ni lag pa gnyis sbyar ba las byung ba'o //
translated: A “handful” is the amount that comes from joining the two hands together.

original: khyor ba ni lag pa gcig skyor te bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: khyor ba ni lag pa gcig skyor te bzhag pa'o //
translated: A “palmful” is the amount that comes from holding up one hand.

original: lus zungs mnyam nas tshad 'di yin //
analyzed: lus zungs mnyam nas tshad 'di yin //
translated: When the body elements are in balance, this is the measure.

original: de las 'phel dang zad ces bya //
analyzed: de las 'phel dang zad ces bya //
translated: From this, there is increase and decrease.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this way,

original: gong du bshad pa'i tshul 'di ni /
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i tshul 'di ni /
translated: this method that was explained above

original: skyes bu lus zungs cha mnyam par gnas pa las tshad du bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: skyes bu lus zungs cha mnyam par gnas pa las tshad du bya ba yin pas /
translated: is the measure for a person whose body elements are in a state of balance.

original: tshad de la 'phel ba dang zad par gyur par shes shing rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: tshad de la 'phel ba dang zad par gyur par shes shing rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand and know that this measure can be increased or decreased.

original: khu chu khrag dang sbrum ma'i zas //
analyzed: khu chu khrag dang sbrum ma'i zas //
translated: Semen, blood, and the food of a pregnant woman

original: spyod lam mngal gnas dus tshigs nas //🔽gang zhig nyes pa lhag gyur des //
analyzed: spyod lam mngal gnas dus tshigs nas // gang zhig nyes pa lhag gyur des //
translated: The conduct is from the time of being in the womb🔽up to the time of the season.🔽🔽

original: rang bzhin rnam pa bdun du bshad ;🔽/ ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa bdun du bshad ; / ces bya ba la /
translated: The seven natures of the humors are explained in terms of semen, blood, the pregnant woman’s diet, conduct, the womb, and the season.

original: khu ba dang / khrag dang / sbrum ma'i zas dang / spyod lam mngal gyi gnas dang / dus tshigs de rnams las gang zhig nad kyis nyen pa'i dbang gis tshad las lhag par gyur pa des /
analyzed: khu ba dang / khrag dang / sbrum ma'i zas dang / spyod lam mngal gyi gnas dang / dus tshigs de rnams las gang zhig nad kyis nyen pa'i dbang gis tshad las lhag par gyur pa des /
translated: From among those, semen, blood, the pregnant woman’s diet, conduct, the womb, and the season, whichever is afflicted by a disorder, due to the power of that, becomes excessive.

original: khu chu la sogs par gnas pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa bdun bshad de /
analyzed: khu chu la sogs par gnas pa'i rang bzhin rnam pa bdun bshad de /
translated: The seven natures of the humors that reside in the semen and so forth are explained.

original: rlung gi rang bzhin dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin dang / bad kan gyi rang bzhin dang / rlung dang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi rang bzhin te de ltar bdun no //
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin dang / mkhris pa'i rang bzhin dang / bad kan gyi rang bzhin dang / rlung dang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin dang / rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi rang bzhin te de ltar bdun no //
translated: They are the nature of wind, the nature of bile, the nature of phlegm, the nature of wind and bile, the nature of wind and phlegm, the nature of bile and phlegm, and the nature of wind, bile, and phlegm. Thus there are seven.

original: khyab dang myur bar byed phyir dang // stobs ldan pa dang gzhan ldang byed //🔽rang dbang can dang nad mang phyir //
analyzed: khyab dang myur bar byed phyir dang // stobs ldan pa dang gzhan ldang byed // rang dbang can dang nad mang phyir //
translated: Because they pervade, move quickly, are powerful, and cause other disorders,

original: nad @43a * //
analyzed: nad @43a * //
translated: because they are independent, and because there are many diseases,🔽the humors are taught to be three.

original: las phal cher rlung stobs can //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las phal cher rlung stobs can // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The humors are predominantly wind.

original: rlung nad kyi rang bzhin ni khyab cing kun tu 'gro ba dang / myur zhing rengs bar nad skyed pa dang / stobs dang ldan zhing mthu che ba dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nad ldang bar byed pa dang / bshang gci la sogs pa 'dren par byed pa dang /
analyzed: rlung nad kyi rang bzhin ni khyab cing kun tu 'gro ba dang / myur zhing rengs bar nad skyed pa dang / stobs dang ldan zhing mthu che ba dang / mkhris pa dang bad kan gyi nad ldang bar byed pa dang / bshang gci la sogs pa 'dren par byed pa dang /
translated: The nature of wind disorders is to pervade and spread, to move quickly and cause stiffness, to be strong and powerful, to provoke bile and phlegm disorders, and to expel feces, urine, and so on.

original: rang dbang can rang rgyud du gnas pa dang / de bzhin du nad mang ba ste /
analyzed: rang dbang can rang rgyud du gnas pa dang / de bzhin du nad mang ba ste /
translated: They are independent and remain in the body, and likewise, there are many disorders.

original: rlung nad brgyad cu skyed pa'i phyir nad gzhi gsum cha las kyang rlung nad ni phal cher zhes smos pa ni khyad par du byas pa'i tshig smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rlung nad brgyad cu skyed pa'i phyir nad gzhi gsum cha las kyang rlung nad ni phal cher zhes smos pa ni khyad par du byas pa'i tshig smos pa yin no //
translated: Since wind disorders produce eighty disorders, wind disorders are said to be the most common among the three humors. The term “predominantly” indicates a distinction.

original: de nyid kyis na rlung gis bskyod pa'i mi rnams ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rlung gis bskyod pa'i mi rnams ni /
translated: Therefore, people disturbed by wind

original: nad kyi bdag nyid rdul can skra bshor pags pa gas //
analyzed: nad kyi bdag nyid rdul can skra bshor pags pa gas //
translated: have a dusty nature, lose their hair and skin,🔽and cannot endure cold winds.

original: grang lhags mi bzod brtan dran blo gros spyod mdzad sred //
analyzed: grang lhags mi bzod brtan dran blo gros spyod mdzad sred //
translated: They are steady, mindful, intelligent, and have little desire.

original: blta dang 'gro ba g-yo zhing smra ba shin tu mang //
analyzed: blta dang 'gro ba g-yo zhing smra ba shin tu mang //
translated: Looking, walking, moving, and talking a lot,🔽

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are unsteady in looking, walking, and talking, and they talk a lot.

original: rgyu de nyid kyis ni rlung gi nad kyis bskyod pa'i mi rlung gis khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa bskyod par 'gyur ba'i mi rnams ni /
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyis ni rlung gi nad kyis bskyod pa'i mi rlung gis khu chu dang khrag la sogs pa bskyod par 'gyur ba'i mi rnams ni /
translated: Because of that, people who are disturbed by wind disorders have semen and blood disturbed by wind.🔽They are unsteady in standing and walking, like someone with a disease, like someone covered with dust, with hair and body, and so on.🔽Likewise, they are unable to bear cold winds and desire warmth.

original: nad kyi bdag nyid can du gnas pa dang / rdul gyis gtor ba lta bur skra dang lus la sogs par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du grang lhags mi bzod cing dro bar 'dod pa dang / de bzhin du brten pa nas 'gro ba'i bar shin tu g-yo zhing brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nad kyi bdag nyid can du gnas pa dang / rdul gyis gtor ba lta bur skra dang lus la sogs par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du grang lhags mi bzod cing dro bar 'dod pa dang / de bzhin du brten pa nas 'gro ba'i bar shin tu g-yo zhing brten pa ma yin te /
translated: They are unsteady in standing and walking, like someone with a disease, like someone covered with dust, with hair and body, and so on.

original: brtan pa ni sran thub pa'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni sran thub pa'o //
translated: Steadfast means enduring.

original: dran pa ni mi brjed pa'o ;
analyzed: dran pa ni mi brjed pa'o ;
translated: Mindfulness means not forgetting.

original: / blo gros ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: / blo gros ni shes rab bo //
translated: Intelligence means wisdom.

original: spyod pa ni rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa ni rtsom pa'o //
translated: Behavior means undertaking.

original: mdza' la sred pa ni yid gcugs par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mdza' la sred pa ni yid gcugs par dga' ba'o //
translated: Craving for friends means delighting in intimacy.

original: blta ba ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: blta ba ni mthong ba'o //
translated: Looking means seeing.

original: 'gro ba ni kun tu 'phyan pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni kun tu 'phyan pa ste /
translated: Walking means wandering.

original: de dag g-yo zhing mi brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag g-yo zhing mi brtan pa'o //
translated: They are unsteady and not steadfast.

original: de bzhin du shin tu mang du smra zhing smra ba la dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu mang du smra zhing smra ba la dga' ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, they talk a lot and enjoy talking.🔽Those with phlegm have little wealth, short lives, little sleep,🔽are timid, slow to speak, deceitful, hoarse,

original: bad kan nor nyung tshe thung gnyid srab dang // gcom chung tshig thogs g-yo zhing skad 'dzer dang // chad lta mang du za zhing sgeg dang bcas //
analyzed: bad kan nor nyung tshe thung gnyid srab dang // gcom chung tshig thogs g-yo zhing skad 'dzer dang // chad lta mang du za zhing sgeg dang bcas //
translated: have many nihilistic views, eat a lot, are proud,

original: glu dang dgod dang rngon las 'thab la dga' //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: glu dang dgod dang rngon las 'thab la dga' // zhes bya ba la /
translated: sing, laugh, and enjoy hunting and fighting.

original: gzhan yang rlung can gyi mi'i mtshan nyid ni bad kan dang nor nyung ba la sogs pa yin te /🔽gcom chung ba ni tshig phra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rlung can gyi mi'i mtshan nyid ni bad kan dang nor nyung ba la sogs pa yin te / gcom chung ba ni tshig phra ba'o //
translated: The characteristics of a person with wind are having little phlegm, little wealth, and so on.🔽Timid means having few words.

original: tshig thogs pa ni phyed lus pa'o //
analyzed: tshig thogs pa ni phyed lus pa'o //
translated: Slow to speak means speaking haltingly.

original: g-yo ba ni mi brtan pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni mi brtan pa'o //
translated: Deceitful means unstable.

original: skad 'dzer ba ni skad gsang nyams pa'o //
analyzed: skad 'dzer ba ni skad gsang nyams pa'o //
translated: Hoarse means having a weak voice.

original: chad par lta ba ni med par lta ba'i gzhung la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: chad par lta ba ni med par lta ba'i gzhung la dga' ba'o //
translated: Having many nihilistic views means enjoying texts that view nonexistence.

original: mang du za ba ni lto che ba'o //
analyzed: mang du za ba ni lto che ba'o //
translated: Eating a lot means having a large stomach.

original: sgeg pa dang bcas pa ni bsgyings tshul dang bcas pa @43b dang glu dang dgod pa'o //
analyzed: sgeg pa dang bcas pa ni bsgyings tshul dang bcas pa @43b dang glu dang dgod pa'o //
translated: Proud means having a haughty manner, singing, and laughing.

original: rngon pa'i las ri dags shor ba dang 'thab pa la dga' ba rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: rngon pa'i las ri dags shor ba dang 'thab pa la dga' ba rnams dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: They are fond of hunting and of fighting with wild beasts.

original: mngar skyur kha dang tsha ba'i ro goms sred //
analyzed: mngar skyur kha dang tsha ba'i ro goms sred //
translated: Those whose nature is wind crave sweet, sour, and sharp tastes.

original: lus skem dbyibs reng 'gro tshe sgra dang bcas //
analyzed: lus skem dbyibs reng 'gro tshe sgra dang bcas //
translated: Their bodies are emaciated, their forms are tall, and they walk with a sound.

original: mi brtan dbang po mi thul dam pa min //🔽bud med mi chags bu mang skye mi 'gyur ;
analyzed: mi brtan dbang po mi thul dam pa min // bud med mi chags bu mang skye mi 'gyur ;
translated: They are unstable, hard to control, and not noble.

original: / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not attached to women, and they do not have many children.

original: rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi bu gang yin pa de ni ro mngar ba la sogs pa'i goms par sred pa dang / lus skem zhing dbyibs ring ba dang / 'gro zhing rgyu ba'i tshe tshigs sgra 'khrol ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin can gyi bu gang yin pa de ni ro mngar ba la sogs pa'i goms par sred pa dang / lus skem zhing dbyibs ring ba dang / 'gro zhing rgyu ba'i tshe tshigs sgra 'khrol ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Those whose nature is wind crave sweet and so on. Their bodies are emaciated and their forms are tall. They walk with a sound.

original: 'gro zhing 'chags mi brtan zhing g-yo ba dang / dbang po mi thul zhing zhi ba'i spyod pa med pa dang / dam pa'i spyod pa med cing 'phags pa ma yin pa dang / bud med rnams la mngon par mi dga' zhing rjes su chags par mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: 'gro zhing 'chags mi brtan zhing g-yo ba dang / dbang po mi thul zhing zhi ba'i spyod pa med pa dang / dam pa'i spyod pa med cing 'phags pa ma yin pa dang / bud med rnams la mngon par mi dga' zhing rjes su chags par mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: He has no noble conduct and is not an ārya. He does not delight in women and does not become attached to them.

original: bu tsha mang po skye zhing 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bu tsha mang po skye zhing 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: He does not have many children and relatives.

original: de yi mig ni rtsub cing rdul gyis gang //
analyzed: de yi mig ni rtsub cing rdul gyis gang //
translated: His eyes are rough and full of dust.

original: zlum zhing mi mdzes 'chi ba lta bu dang // phye gdangs gnyid log lta bur snang ba yin //
analyzed: zlum zhing mi mdzes 'chi ba lta bu dang // phye gdangs gnyid log lta bur snang ba yin //
translated: They are round, ugly, and look like a dead person’s eyes, or like a person sleeping with eyes open.

original: de ni shing dang ri 'dzeg mkha' 'phur rmi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni shing dang ri 'dzeg mkha' 'phur rmi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He dreams of climbing trees and mountains, and flying in the sky.

original: rlung gi rang bzhin gyi skyes bu mig rtsub cing snum pa med pa dang / rdul gyis gang zhing phyag dar gtor ba ltar snang ba la /
analyzed: rlung gi rang bzhin gyi skyes bu mig rtsub cing snum pa med pa dang / rdul gyis gang zhing phyag dar gtor ba ltar snang ba la /
translated: A person whose nature is vāyu has rough eyes and no luster. They are full of dust and appear as if covered with dust.

original: mig gi dbyibs zlum pa dang / mi mdzes shing blta na mi sdug pa dang / 'chi ba'i mig dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba dang / phye zhing gdangs par gyur ba dang / gnyid kyis log pa 'dra bar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbyibs zlum pa dang / mi mdzes shing blta na mi sdug pa dang / 'chi ba'i mig dang mtshungs shing 'dra ba dang / phye zhing gdangs par gyur ba dang / gnyid kyis log pa 'dra bar snang ba yin no //
translated: The eyes are round, ugly, and unpleasant to look at, like the eyes of the dead, wide open, and appearing as if in sleep.

original: de bzhin du rmi lam gyi nang du shing chen po la 'dzeg pa dang / ri la 'dzeg pa dang / nam mkha' la 'phur ba rmi ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rmi lam gyi nang du shing chen po la 'dzeg pa dang / ri la 'dzeg pa dang / nam mkha' la 'phur ba rmi ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, in dreams, one climbs a great tree, climbs a mountain, or flies in the sky.🔽The inauspicious person is very greedy, haughty,🔽steals, is stingy, and has a strong pulse.

original: skal ngan ser sna che zhing khengs pa dang // rku zhing byin snying rtsa rings bcas pa dang // khyi dang wa dang bya rgod rnga mo khrag / byi ba'i mtshan nyid ldan mi rlung can yin //
analyzed: skal ngan ser sna che zhing khengs pa dang // rku zhing byin snying rtsa rings bcas pa dang // khyi dang wa dang bya rgod rnga mo khrag / byi ba'i mtshan nyid ldan mi rlung can yin //
translated: Having the characteristics of a dog, fox, vulture, camel, or rat, he has a windy constitution.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here is the explanation.

original: rlung gi mtshan nyid can gyi mi ni skal ba ngan cing bkra mi shis pa dang / ser sna che ba dang / khengs pa dang ; log par rlom pa dang / rku 'phrog la dga' ba dang byin snying gi rgyab kyi rtsa mtho zhing rtse mo 'khyil zhing /
analyzed: rlung gi mtshan nyid can gyi mi ni skal ba ngan cing bkra mi shis pa dang / ser sna che ba dang / khengs pa dang ; log par rlom pa dang / rku 'phrog la dga' ba dang byin snying gi rgyab kyi rtsa mtho zhing rtse mo 'khyil zhing /
translated: A person with the characteristics of wind is unfortunate, inauspicious, greedy, arrogant, conceited, fond of stealing, and has a vein behind the heart that is high, with a coiled tip.

original: byin pa'i nyva glo zhing mtho ba yin no //
analyzed: byin pa'i nyva glo zhing mtho ba yin no //
translated: The hollow of the knee is deep and high.

original: de bzhin du khyi dang / wa dang / rnga mo dang / bya rgod dang / khra dang / byi ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan zhing de dag gi rang bzhin can gyi gzugs dang ro dang spyod @44a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyi dang / wa dang / rnga mo dang / bya rgod dang / khra dang / byi ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan zhing de dag gi rang bzhin can gyi gzugs dang ro dang spyod @44a * //
translated: Similarly, a person who has the characteristics of a dog, jackal, camel, vulture, hawk, or rat, and whose form, taste, and behavior are consistent with those natures,

original: pa rjes su mthun pa gang dag yin pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: pa rjes su mthun pa gang dag yin pa dang ldan te /
translated: is endowed with those characteristics.

original: de lta bu'i mi ni rlung gi rang bzhin can yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi ni rlung gi rang bzhin can yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Such a person should be known to have the nature of wind.

original: mkhris pa me 'dra me las byung yin phyir //
analyzed: mkhris pa me 'dra me las byung yin phyir //
translated: Because bile is like fire and arises from fire,

original: mkhris pa rgyas pa skom dang bkres shas che //
analyzed: mkhris pa rgyas pa skom dang bkres shas che //
translated: a person with excessive bile has great thirst and hunger,

original: mdog ser lus tsha rkang lag gdong yang dmar //
analyzed: mdog ser lus tsha rkang lag gdong yang dmar //
translated: a yellow complexion, a hot body, and red hands and face.

original: skra ser spu nyung dpa' zhing nga rgyal che //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skra ser spu nyung dpa' zhing nga rgyal che // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The hair is yellow, the body hair is sparse, and they are very proud.

original: drang srong thang la 'bar gyi gzhung gis mkhris pa rang nyid me dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: drang srong thang la 'bar gyi gzhung gis mkhris pa rang nyid me dang 'dra ste /
translated: The text of the sage Bhāllabja explains that bile itself is like fire.

original: smin pa la sogs pa'i las byed pas ma'i sgrar bshad do //🔽me'i rang bzhin can gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: smin pa la sogs pa'i las byed pas ma'i sgrar bshad do // me'i rang bzhin can gyi mtshan nyid yin pa'am /
translated: Since it performs the function of ripening, it is called “mother.”🔽It has the nature of fire,

original: me drod kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me drod kyi gzhi yin par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or it is the basis of the heat of fire.

original: de las byung ba ni tshigs ma'i rang bzhin can gyi khrag ni mkhris pa yin la /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni tshigs ma'i rang bzhin can gyi khrag ni mkhris pa yin la /
translated: From that, blood with the nature of grain is bile.

original: de'i phyir mkhris pa de rgyas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i srog chags rnams ni skom pa dang bkres pa'i shas che ba dang lus kyang mdog ser ba dang / lus tsha ba 'ur 'ur por gnas pa dang / rkang pa dang lag pa dang gdong gi kha dog dmar ba dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhris pa de rgyas shing 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i srog chags rnams ni skom pa dang bkres pa'i shas che ba dang lus kyang mdog ser ba dang / lus tsha ba 'ur 'ur por gnas pa dang / rkang pa dang lag pa dang gdong gi kha dog dmar ba dang /
translated: Therefore, the creatures in whom that bile increases and expands have a great deal of thirst and hunger, their bodies are yellow, their bodies are hot and remain agitated, and the color of their feet, hands, and face is red.

original: skra dmar ser du gnas pa dang / spu'i tshogs 'byi zhing nyung ba dang / dpa' zhing rtul phod pa dang / nga rgyal che zhing khengs pa dang bcas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: skra dmar ser du gnas pa dang / spu'i tshogs 'byi zhing nyung ba dang / dpa' zhing rtul phod pa dang / nga rgyal che zhing khengs pa dang bcas pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He has red-brown hair, a small amount of body hair, is brave and bold, and is endowed with great pride and arrogance.

original: phreng ba byug pa rgyan la lhag par dga' //
analyzed: phreng ba byug pa rgyan la lhag par dga' //
translated: He delights in garlands, ointments, and ornaments.

original: spyod bzang gtsang sbra che zhing mnyes gshin la //
analyzed: spyod bzang gtsang sbra che zhing mnyes gshin la //
translated: He has good conduct, great purity, and is gentle.

original: 'byor dang rtul phod blo gros stobs dang ldan //
analyzed: 'byor dang rtul phod blo gros stobs dang ldan //
translated: He is endowed with wealth, courage, intelligence, and strength.

original: 'jig rten dgra bo 'ang skyabs 'ongs skyob par byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten dgra bo 'ang skyabs 'ongs skyob par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: Even when enemies come for refuge, he protects them.

original: mkhris ba can gyi mi ni /
analyzed: mkhris ba can gyi mi ni /
translated: A person of the bile type

original: phreng ba la sogs pa la mngon par dga' ba yin te /
analyzed: phreng ba la sogs pa la mngon par dga' ba yin te /
translated: has a great fondness for garlands and so forth.

original: phreng ba ni me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phreng ba ni me tog gi phreng ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Garlands are flower garlands and so forth.

original: byug ba ni dri zhim pos bskus pa'o //
analyzed: byug ba ni dri zhim pos bskus pa'o //
translated: Ointments are fragrant oils.

original: rgyan ni mu tig gi phreng ba la sogs pas brgyan cing bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan ni mu tig gi phreng ba la sogs pas brgyan cing bzhag pa'o //
translated: Ornaments are decorations with pearl necklaces and so forth.

original: spyod pa bzang po ni byed spyod mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa bzang po ni byed spyod mdzes pa'o //
translated: Good conduct is beautiful behavior.

original: gtsang sbra che ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: gtsang sbra che ba ni lus dang ngag dang yid skyon med pa'o //
translated: Purity is the absence of faults of body, speech, and mind.

original: mnyes gshin pa ni bran g-yog la sogs pa la byams pa'o //
analyzed: mnyes gshin pa ni bran g-yog la sogs pa la byams pa'o //
translated: Friendliness is love for servants and so on.

original: 'byor pa ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa ni longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Wealth is the abundance of possessions.

original: rtul phod pa ni nyams kyis mi lcogs ba dag kyang byed par spro ba'o //
analyzed: rtul phod pa ni nyams kyis mi lcogs ba dag kyang byed par spro ba'o //
translated: Valiance is the enthusiasm to do what is difficult.

original: blo gros kyi stobs ni shes rab kyi nus pa ste /
analyzed: blo gros kyi stobs ni shes rab kyi nus pa ste /
translated: The power of intellect is the capacity of wisdom.

original: de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One should have these.

original: de bzhin du 'jigs shing skrag pas nyen pa'i dgra bo dag kyang skyabs su 'ongs shing 'dud par byed pas na /
