analyzed: de bzhin du 'jigs shing skrag pas nyen pa'i dgra bo dag kyang skyabs su 'ongs shing 'dud par byed pas na /
translated: Similarly, even enemies who are frightened and terrified come for refuge and bow down,

original: skyob cing gnod pa las srung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skyob cing gnod pa las srung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: so one should protect and guard them from harm.

original: yid @44b gzhungs tshigs kyi mtshams dang sha ni rab tu lhod //
analyzed: yid @44b gzhungs tshigs kyi mtshams dang sha ni rab tu lhod //
translated: The joints of the ribs become loose, and the flesh becomes flabby.

original: bud med mi dga' khu ba dang ni 'dod pa chung //
analyzed: bud med mi dga' khu ba dang ni 'dod pa chung //
translated: One dislikes women, and one's semen and desire decrease.

original: gnyer ma'i tshogs dang skra dkar mig sngo'i gnas gyur la //
analyzed: gnyer ma'i tshogs dang skra dkar mig sngo'i gnas gyur la //
translated: One becomes wrinkled, with white hair and blue eyes.

original: zas ni mngar dang bska dang kha bsil za bar dga' //
analyzed: zas ni mngar dang bska dang kha bsil za bar dga' //
translated: One likes to eat sweet, sour, and cold foods.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who have a phlegm nature are intelligent,🔽have loose joints and are not tense,

original: yang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi ni yid gzhungs shing blo dang ldan pa dang / rus pa'i tshigs kyi 'brel mtshams sha'i tshigs lhod cing grims bag med pa dang / bud med rnams de la dga' bar mi 'gyur ba dang / khu ba'i shas chung ba dang /
analyzed: yang mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi ni yid gzhungs shing blo dang ldan pa dang / rus pa'i tshigs kyi 'brel mtshams sha'i tshigs lhod cing grims bag med pa dang / bud med rnams de la dga' bar mi 'gyur ba dang / khu ba'i shas chung ba dang /
translated: are not liked by women, and have little semen.🔽They have little desire, are not very passionate,🔽have many veins, have lost their hair,

original: 'dod pa chung zhing 'khrig pa la mngon par mi gdu ba dang / phags pa'i tshogs gnyer ma mang ba dang / skra dkar lhags pa dang / mig sngo ba'i nad rnams su 'gyur zhing de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / kha zas kyang mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro dang ldan pa la sred cing dga' ba la longs spyod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa chung zhing 'khrig pa la mngon par mi gdu ba dang / phags pa'i tshogs gnyer ma mang ba dang / skra dkar lhags pa dang / mig sngo ba'i nad rnams su 'gyur zhing de dag dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / kha zas kyang mngar ba la sogs pa'i ro dang ldan pa la sred cing dga' ba la longs spyod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: and have eye diseases. They enjoy and consume sweet and other tastes.🔽Those who have a bile nature are thin,

original: than pa mi bzod rdul zhing dri nga la //
analyzed: than pa mi bzod rdul zhing dri nga la //
translated: have a bad smell, and cannot tolerate heat.

original: bshang gci bza' btung khro dang phrag dog mang //
analyzed: bshang gci bza' btung khro dang phrag dog mang //
translated: They have much feces, urine, food, anger, and envy.

original: rmi lam dong ka ba la sha'i me tog / glog 'gyu phyogs tshig skar mda' nyi me mthong //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rmi lam dong ka ba la sha'i me tog / glog 'gyu phyogs tshig skar mda' nyi me mthong // zhes bya ba la /
translated: In dreams, he sees a pit, a palasha flower, lightning, a conflagration, a meteor, and the sun.

original: gzhan yang mkhris pa can gyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang mkhris pa can gyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: Moreover, the characteristics of one who is of the bilious temperament are as follows:

original: tshad pa mi bzod cing bsten mi nus pa dang / rtag tu rdul 'byung ba dang / lus dri nga zhing mnam pa dang ; de bzhin du bshang gci la sogs pa mang zhing shas che ba dang / gnyid log pa'i rmi lam gyi nang na dong ka'i shing dang /
analyzed: tshad pa mi bzod cing bsten mi nus pa dang / rtag tu rdul 'byung ba dang / lus dri nga zhing mnam pa dang ; de bzhin du bshang gci la sogs pa mang zhing shas che ba dang / gnyid log pa'i rmi lam gyi nang na dong ka'i shing dang /
translated: He is unable to endure heat and cannot be in the sun; he is always sweating; his body is foul-smelling and putrid; likewise, his feces and urine are abundant and strong; and in dreams while sleeping, he sees a pit, a palasha tree,

original: de bzhin du pa la sha'i me tog dang / de bzhin du glog 'gyu ba dang / phyogs tshig pa dang / skar mda' lhung ba dang / nyi ma 'char ba dang / me chen po 'bar ba mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du pa la sha'i me tog dang / de bzhin du glog 'gyu ba dang / phyogs tshig pa dang / skar mda' lhung ba dang / nyi ma 'char ba dang / me chen po 'bar ba mthong ba yin no //
translated: a palasha flower, lightning, a conflagration, a falling meteor, the rising sun, and a great blazing fire.

original: 'di yi lus phra mig ser g-yo ba dang // rdzi ma srab cing nyung zhing grang la dga' //
analyzed: 'di yi lus phra mig ser g-yo ba dang // rdzi ma srab cing nyung zhing grang la dga' //
translated: His body is thin, with yellow, moving eyes; he has few, thin eyelashes, and he likes cold things.

original: khro dang chang dang nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis //
analyzed: khro dang chang dang nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis //
translated: He is angry, fond of alcohol, and the light of the sun

original: mig ni myur bar dmar por 'gyur ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig ni myur bar dmar por 'gyur ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eyes become quickly red.🔽The eyes of a person who is dominated by bile are thin, yellow, and flickering.

original: mkhris pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu 'di'i mig dbyibs phra ba dang / mig ser skyar gnas pa dang / rnam par g-yo zhing dgod pa dang / de bzhin du mig gi rdzi ma'i phyogs srab cing grangs nyung ba dang / grang zhing bsil ba la mngon par dga' ba dang /🔽khro zhing 'khrugs pa dang chang 'thungs pa dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis phog na de'i mig myur du dmar zhing sngo bar @45a * //
analyzed: mkhris pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu 'di'i mig dbyibs phra ba dang / mig ser skyar gnas pa dang / rnam par g-yo zhing dgod pa dang / de bzhin du mig gi rdzi ma'i phyogs srab cing grangs nyung ba dang / grang zhing bsil ba la mngon par dga' ba dang / khro zhing 'khrugs pa dang chang 'thungs pa dang / nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis phog na de'i mig myur du dmar zhing sngo bar @45a * //
translated: The eyelashes are thin and few, and he likes cold things.

original: 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When he is angry, drinks alcohol, or is struck by the sun’s rays, his eyes quickly become red and blue.

original: tshe ni ran zhing stobs ni 'bring ba dang // mkhas shing sdug bsngal dag la sran chung 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe ni ran zhing stobs ni 'bring ba dang // mkhas shing sdug bsngal dag la sran chung 'gyur //
translated: His life is moderate, his strength is middling, and he is wise and has little patience with suffering.

original: stag dang dred dang sbre'u byi la dang // gnod sbyin rang bzhin ldan pa mkhris can yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stag dang dred dang sbre'u byi la dang // gnod sbyin rang bzhin ldan pa mkhris can yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: Tigers, bears, monkeys, jackals, and yakshas are naturally of the bile type.

original: yang de ni tshe'i tshad ran cing 'bring tsam du gnas pa dang / stobs shin tu che ba ma yin gyi 'bring tsam du gnas pa dang / mkhas shing blo dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal sran chung zhing nyon mongs pa la bzod par mi nus shing 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de ni tshe'i tshad ran cing 'bring tsam du gnas pa dang / stobs shin tu che ba ma yin gyi 'bring tsam du gnas pa dang / mkhas shing blo dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal sran chung zhing nyon mongs pa la bzod par mi nus shing 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the life span of this person is moderate, not long or short; his strength is moderate, not very great; he is intelligent and wise; he is of little endurance and cannot tolerate the afflictions; he is fearful.

original: gzhan yang stag la sogs pa'i gzugs dang skad kyi nga ro dang / spyod pa dang rjes su mthun par byed pa ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang stag la sogs pa'i gzugs dang skad kyi nga ro dang / spyod pa dang rjes su mthun par byed pa ni mkhris pa'i rang bzhin can gyi mi yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that a person of the bile type has a form, voice, and behavior that accord with the tiger and so on.

original: bad kan bsil bas bad kan can bsil zhing //
analyzed: bad kan bsil bas bad kan can bsil zhing //
translated: The phlegm type is cool and phlegm-like.

original: rus tshigs mi mngon snum zhing sha rus 'brel //
analyzed: rus tshigs mi mngon snum zhing sha rus 'brel //
translated: His bones and joints are not prominent, he is oily, and his flesh and bones are connected.

original: bkres skom nyon mongs sdug bsngal than pa bzod //
analyzed: bkres skom nyon mongs sdug bsngal than pa bzod //
translated: He can endure hunger, thirst, affliction, suffering, and heat.

original: blo ldan snying stobs che zhing dam bca' brtan //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo ldan snying stobs che zhing dam bca' brtan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The wise one has great courage and firm commitments.

original: gang gi phyir bad kan gyi rang bzhin bsil ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bad kan gyi rang bzhin bsil ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the nature of phlegm is cool,

original: bad kan can gyi rang bzhin skyes bu yang bsil zhing khong drang ba yin te /
analyzed: bad kan can gyi rang bzhin skyes bu yang bsil zhing khong drang ba yin te /
translated: The nature of a person who is a phlegm type is cool and upright.

original: gang gi phyir na 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu dang rjes su mthun par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na 'bras bu rnams ni rgyu dang rjes su mthun par 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because effects arise in accordance with their causes.🔽Similarly, a person who is a phlegm type has a skin color that is not very obvious among the collection of bones, is oily, and the flesh and bones are mutually connected and remain in a state of mutual support.

original: de bzhin du bad kan can gyi skyes bu rus pa'i tshogs mi mngon par bags pa'i mdog snum ba dang / sha rus phan tshun 'brel cing gcig la gcig 'byor par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams bzod cing sran thub pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bad kan can gyi skyes bu rus pa'i tshogs mi mngon par bags pa'i mdog snum ba dang / sha rus phan tshun 'brel cing gcig la gcig 'byor par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du bkres pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal rnams bzod cing sran thub pa dang /
translated: Similarly, he is patient and tolerant of the sufferings of hunger and so forth.

original: blo dang ldan zhing shes rab che ba dang snying stobs kyi rang bzhin shas che ba dang / dam bca' ba brtan zhing mi 'gyur ba yin no ;
analyzed: blo dang ldan zhing shes rab che ba dang snying stobs kyi rang bzhin shas che ba dang / dam bca' ba brtan zhing mi 'gyur ba yin no ;
translated: He is intelligent, has great wisdom, and has a nature of great courage. He is firm and unchanging in his commitments.

original: / pri yang ku dang d'ur ba 'dam bu'i mdog / tshon dang gi wang padma gser mdog can //
analyzed: / pri yang ku dang d'ur ba 'dam bu'i mdog / tshon dang gi wang padma gser mdog can //
translated: The color of his body is like a priyaṅgu flower, a durva plant, or a lotus, the color of vermillion, or the color of gold.

original: lag ngar ring zhing brang ni yangs la rgyas //
analyzed: lag ngar ring zhing brang ni yangs la rgyas //
translated: His forearms are long, and his chest is broad and full.

original: dpral ba'i dbyes che skra ni mthug cing gnag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dpral ba'i dbyes che skra ni mthug cing gnag / ces bya ba la /
translated: The forehead is broad, the hair thick and black.

original: yang bad kan can gyi mi bri yang ku la sogs pa'i mdog dang ldan par 'gyur te /🔽la la ni pri yang ku lta bu'i mdog can yin no //
analyzed: yang bad kan can gyi mi bri yang ku la sogs pa'i mdog dang ldan par 'gyur te / la la ni pri yang ku lta bu'i mdog can yin no //
translated: Moreover, the person who is of the phlegm type has a complexion like the priyangu flower, etc.🔽Some have a complexion like the priyangu flower.

original: la la ni d'ur ba lta bu'i mdog can nas /
analyzed: la la ni d'ur ba lta bu'i mdog can nas /
translated: Some have a complexion like the durva grass,

original: la la ni gser gyi mdog dang 'dra ba'i bar du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: la la ni gser gyi mdog dang 'dra ba'i bar du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: up to some having a complexion like gold.

original: de yang de bzhin du lag ngar ring zhing pus mo'i bar du phyin pa dang / brang pel che zhing yangs la sha rgyas pa dang / dpral ba'i dbyes che zhing yangs pa dang / @45b skra'i tshogs mthug cing mdog gnag par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du lag ngar ring zhing pus mo'i bar du phyin pa dang / brang pel che zhing yangs la sha rgyas pa dang / dpral ba'i dbyes che zhing yangs pa dang / @45b skra'i tshogs mthug cing mdog gnag par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Furthermore, the arms are long, reaching the knees, the chest is broad, full, and fleshy, the forehead is broad and expansive, and the mass of hair is thick and dark.

original: lus 'jam snyoms shing yan lag mdzes pa dang // mdangs che khu bcud bu tsha g-yog 'khor mang //
analyzed: lus 'jam snyoms shing yan lag mdzes pa dang // mdangs che khu bcud bu tsha g-yog 'khor mang //
translated: The body is smooth and even, the limbs are beautiful, the luster is great, the essence is good, the children and retinue are many,

original: chos ldan tshig rtsub nam yang smra mi byed //
analyzed: chos ldan tshig rtsub nam yang smra mi byed //
translated: and the righteous one never speaks harsh words.

original: dgra la zhe sdang 'dam ring sa kho na 'dzin byed //
analyzed: dgra la zhe sdang 'dam ring sa kho na 'dzin byed //
translated: and hatred for the enemy is a long-lasting fetter.🔽

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: He is hostile to his enemies, and is always full of hatred.

original: yang lus kyi sha mdangs 'jam zhing mnyen pa dang / yan lag gi tshogs snyoms pa dang / yan lag dbyes shing mdzes pa dang / mdangs che zhing mang ba dang / 'khrig pa la dga' zhing khu chu'i bcud che ba dang / brang phel che zhing yangs la shas rgyas pa dang /
analyzed: yang lus kyi sha mdangs 'jam zhing mnyen pa dang / yan lag gi tshogs snyoms pa dang / yan lag dbyes shing mdzes pa dang / mdangs che zhing mang ba dang / 'khrig pa la dga' zhing khu chu'i bcud che ba dang / brang phel che zhing yangs la shas rgyas pa dang /
translated: He has a smooth, soft complexion, his limbs are well-proportioned, his limbs are well-spaced and attractive, he has a large, bright complexion, he is fond of sex and has a large supply of semen, and his chest is large, expansive, and full.

original: de bzhin du bu tsha dang 'khor g-yog mang zhing 'phel ba dang / chos dang ldan zhing chos la dga' ba dang / tshig rtsub cing zhe la phog pa'i tshig nam yang mi smra ba dang / de bzhin du dgra bo la zhe sdang gi 'dam rings shing rgyun du 'jog ba kho na du 'dzin cing yid la 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bu tsha dang 'khor g-yog mang zhing 'phel ba dang / chos dang ldan zhing chos la dga' ba dang / tshig rtsub cing zhe la phog pa'i tshig nam yang mi smra ba dang / de bzhin du dgra bo la zhe sdang gi 'dam rings shing rgyun du 'jog ba kho na du 'dzin cing yid la 'jog pa yin no //
translated: He has many children and servants, and they increase, he is righteous and fond of the Dharma, he never speaks harsh or offensive words, and likewise he is hostile to his enemies and is always full of hatred.

original: glang po'i mchog dregs bcas pa lta bur 'gro //
analyzed: glang po'i mchog dregs bcas pa lta bur 'gro //
translated: He walks like a proud elephant.

original: rgya mtsho 'brug dang rnga sgra seng ge yi //
analyzed: rgya mtsho 'brug dang rnga sgra seng ge yi //
translated: He is like the ocean, thunder, a drum, a lion,

analyzed: byis pa'i tshe na'ang du dang skom shas chung // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: smra ba'i tshig nyung ba dang / 'khrug pa'i shas chung ba dang / bza' ba dang btung ba chung du za zhing 'thung pa dang / spyod pa ste lus kyi bya ba nyung ba dang / tshe ring bar gnas pa dang / nor mang zhing longs spyod che ba dang /
analyzed: smra ba'i tshig nyung ba dang / 'khrug pa'i shas chung ba dang / bza' ba dang btung ba chung du za zhing 'thung pa dang / spyod pa ste lus kyi bya ba nyung ba dang / tshe ring bar gnas pa dang / nor mang zhing longs spyod che ba dang /
translated: They speak few words, have little quarreling, eat and drink little, have few activities, live long, have much wealth and enjoyments,

original: ring du lta ba ste phyis 'byung bar 'gyur pa'i don gyi legs nyes rnam par dpyod de 'di ltar byas na las kyi mtha' nges par 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ring du lta ba ste phyis 'byung bar 'gyur pa'i don gyi legs nyes rnam par dpyod de 'di ltar byas na las kyi mtha' nges par 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: and have foresight, that is, they analyze the good and bad of future events and think, “If I do this, then this result will definitely occur.”🔽They speak pleasantly and gently,

original: zhes dpyod pa dang ldan pa dang / tshig snyan cing 'jam par smra ba'am /🔽gtong ba dang ldan ba ste /🔽gtong ldan snyan smra shes par bya //
analyzed: zhes dpyod pa dang ldan pa dang / tshig snyan cing 'jam par smra ba'am / gtong ba dang ldan ba ste / gtong ldan snyan smra shes par bya //
translated: or they are generous.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said, “Be generous, speak pleasantly, and be knowledgeable.”🔽Similarly, generosity and so on are endowed with faith,

original: yang de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa dad pa dang ldan pa dang / blo zab cing gting ring ba ste /
analyzed: yang de bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa dad pa dang ldan pa dang / blo zab cing gting ring ba ste /
translated: and they have deep and far-reaching minds.

original: de yang / gang gis sems dga' spyod pa dang // khro dang mya ngan 'jigs pa yi //
analyzed: de yang / gang gis sems dga' spyod pa dang // khro dang mya ngan 'jigs pa yi //
translated: Moreover,🔽One who does not know the state🔽of mind that is joyful, playful, angry,

original: gnas skabs shes par mi 'gyur ba //🔽de ni zab pa yin zhes bya //
analyzed: gnas skabs shes par mi 'gyur ba // de ni zab pa yin zhes bya //
translated: sad, or frightened,🔽is said to be profound.

original: zhes bshad pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is endowed with that.

original: de bzhin du lta ba che ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lta ba che ba ste /
translated: Similarly, it is great vision,

original: don che ba la gtsor 'dzin pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / rang bzhin bzang zhing dam pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / sdig pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / gnyid che zhing stug pa dang /
analyzed: don che ba la gtsor 'dzin pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / rang bzhin bzang zhing dam pa'i spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / sdig pa la mngon par mi dga' ba dang / gnyid che zhing stug pa dang /
translated: holding the great meaning as primary, being patient, being without disturbance, having a good nature and the conduct of the holy, not delighting in evil, having great sleep and heaviness,

original: las kyi mtha' ring zhing yun ring por rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' ring zhing yun ring por rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: and having a long-term work that is completed over a long time.

original: byas gzo drang mkhas skal bzang ngo tshar ldan //
analyzed: byas gzo drang mkhas skal bzang ngo tshar ldan //
translated: Grateful, honest, skilled, fortunate, and modest,

original: bla ma la gus mdza' bshes dag la brten //🔽rmi lam padma bya yi phreng bar bcas //
analyzed: bla ma la gus mdza' bshes dag la brten // rmi lam padma bya yi phreng bar bcas //
translated: respectful to gurus, relying on friends and relatives,🔽in dreams seeing lotuses, birds, garlands,

original: chu yi gnas dang sprin yang mthong ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chu yi gnas dang sprin yang mthong ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: water, and clouds.

original: phan pa byas pa shes shing byas pa gzo ba dang / bsam pa drang zhing g-yo chung ba dang / mkhas shing bye brag phyed pa dang / skal ba bzang zhing gzugs bzang ba dang / ngo tsha dang ldan zhing 'dzem pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: phan pa byas pa shes shing byas pa gzo ba dang / bsam pa drang zhing g-yo chung ba dang / mkhas shing bye brag phyed pa dang / skal ba bzang zhing gzugs bzang ba dang / ngo tsha dang ldan zhing 'dzem pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: They know what is beneficial and are grateful, are honest and have little deceit, are wise and discerning, are fortunate and have a good physique, are conscientious and reserved,

original: bla ma la gus shing lus 'dud par 'dod pa dang / mdza' bshes la ngo brtan zhing dus thams cad du byams pas gnas kyi nam yang de'i yid dang 'gal bar mi byed la byams pa bsten pa dang / gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam gyi nang du yang me tog padma dang bya'i phreng ba'i tshogs kyis bskor ba dang bcas pa'i chu'i gnas mtsho la sogs pa @46b mthong ba dang sprin gyi tshogs 'dus pa dag mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: bla ma la gus shing lus 'dud par 'dod pa dang / mdza' bshes la ngo brtan zhing dus thams cad du byams pas gnas kyi nam yang de'i yid dang 'gal bar mi byed la byams pa bsten pa dang / gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam gyi nang du yang me tog padma dang bya'i phreng ba'i tshogs kyis bskor ba dang bcas pa'i chu'i gnas mtsho la sogs pa @46b mthong ba dang sprin gyi tshogs 'dus pa dag mthong ba yin no //
translated: are respectful to their gurus and wish to bow to them, are steadfast with their friends and always remain loving, never contradicting their minds and relying on love, and even in dreams while asleep they see themselves surrounded by a multitude of lotus flowers and garlands of birds, and they see themselves in a watery place such as a lake and see a gathering of clouds.

original: tshangs pa drag po dbang phyug chu lha dang // nam mkha' lding dang ngang pa glang po mchog / de bzhin seng ge dang ni khyu mchog dang // bad kan can ni rang bzhin 'drar shes bya //
analyzed: tshangs pa drag po dbang phyug chu lha dang // nam mkha' lding dang ngang pa glang po mchog / de bzhin seng ge dang ni khyu mchog dang // bad kan can ni rang bzhin 'drar shes bya //
translated: and a cloud.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: bad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi mi ni spyod pa'i rang bzhin tshangs pa la sogs pa dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bad kan gyi rang bzhin can gyi mi ni spyod pa'i rang bzhin tshangs pa la sogs pa dang 'dra zhing mtshungs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the person of phlegm nature is similar and equal in conduct nature to Brahma and so forth.

original: glang po che'i mchog ni sa srung ngo //🔽rang bzhin gnyis dang kun las 'byung //
analyzed: glang po che'i mchog ni sa srung ngo // rang bzhin gnyis dang kun las 'byung //
translated: The best of elephants is Airāvaṇa.🔽Arisen from both and all,

original: gnyis gnyis kun gyi yon tan bskyed //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis kun gyi yon tan bskyed //
translated: producing the qualities of both and all.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: nad gzhi gnyis po rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / mkhris pa'am /
analyzed: nad gzhi gnyis po rlung dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / mkhris pa'am /
translated: The two humors are wind, bile, and phlegm, and bile and phlegm.

original: bad kan byung pa'i rang bzhin ni gnyis 'dren ma dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: bad kan byung pa'i rang bzhin ni gnyis 'dren ma dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The nature of phlegm that has arisen is a mixture of two.

original: de ni rang bzhin gsum yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gsum yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: That should be known as the three natures.

original: rang bzhin bzhi pa ni thams cad las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin bzhi pa ni thams cad las skyes pa yin no //
translated: The fourth nature is born from all.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: yon tan gnyis pa las byung ba de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rang bzhin bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan gnyis pa las byung ba de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rang bzhin bskyed pa yin no //
translated: the nature that is born from the second quality is generated in accordance with that.

original: gtsang sbra yod par smra tshogs kyi //
analyzed: gtsang sbra yod par smra tshogs kyi //
translated: The one endowed with purity and the one endowed with the quality of speaking of existence

original: yon tan gyis ni de ldan bshad //
analyzed: yon tan gyis ni de ldan bshad //
translated: are explained as having that.

original: ces bya ba rnams de dag gis na rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin re re dang gnyis gnyis dang / kun las byung ba ni gtsang sbra dang yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis rang rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan par bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba rnams de dag gis na rlung la sogs pa'i rang bzhin re re dang gnyis gnyis dang / kun las byung ba ni gtsang sbra dang yod par smra ba la sogs pa'i snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis rang rang gi mtshan nyid dang ldan par bshad cing bstan pa yin no //
translated: By those, the nature of wind, etc., each, both, and all, is explained and taught as having its own characteristics by the qualities of sattva, etc., purity, speaking of existence, etc.

original: de yang gtsang sbra dang yod par smra ba la sogs pas ni snying stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang gtsang sbra dang yod par smra ba la sogs pas ni snying stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, by purity and speaking of existence, etc., it is explained as having sattva.

original: mang du smra ba la sogs pas ni rdul dang ldan par bshad do //
analyzed: mang du smra ba la sogs pas ni rdul dang ldan par bshad do //
translated: By speaking much, etc., it is explained as having rajas.

original: 'jig pa la sogs pas ni mun pa dang ldan par bshad do //
analyzed: 'jig pa la sogs pas ni mun pa dang ldan par bshad do //
translated: By destruction, etc., it is explained as having tamas.

original: de ltar so sor bshad pa dang rang bzhin gnyis dang ldan pas ni gnyis ka dang ldan pa dang / rang bzhin thams cad kyis ni thams cad dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: de ltar so sor bshad pa dang rang bzhin gnyis dang ldan pas ni gnyis ka dang ldan pa dang / rang bzhin thams cad kyis ni thams cad dang ldan par ston to //
translated: Thus, the verse shows that the person is endowed with both natures, the general and the specific, and that the person is endowed with all natures.

original: de ltar na sems snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin bdun bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems snying stobs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin bdun bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind is shown to have seven natures, such as sattva.

original: na tshod bcu drug bar byis pa //
analyzed: na tshod bcu drug bar byis pa //
translated: The child is up to the sixteenth year;

original: de las lus zungs dbang po gzi //
analyzed: de las lus zungs dbang po gzi //
translated: from then on, the body grows and the faculties mature.

original: 'phel 'gyur bdun cu'i bar bar ma //🔽zad pa phan chad rgan po yin //
analyzed: 'phel 'gyur bdun cu'i bar bar ma // zad pa phan chad rgan po yin //
translated: This is the middle period up to the seventieth year;

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: after that is old age.

original: dus kyis byas shing de las byung ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs la ni na tshod ces bya la /🔽de yang byis pa dang / bar ma dang / rgan @47a * //
analyzed: dus kyis byas shing de las byung ba'i lus kyi gnas skabs la ni na tshod ces bya la / de yang byis pa dang / bar ma dang / rgan @47a * //
translated: The body’s condition is called “age” because it is produced by time.

original: po'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin pa las /
analyzed: po'i dbye bas rnam pa gsum yin pa las /
translated: It is of three types, divided into child, middle-aged, and old.

original: skyes nas lo bcu drug lon pa'i bar du byis pa yin la /🔽byis pa'i na tshod de la ni /
analyzed: skyes nas lo bcu drug lon pa'i bar du byis pa yin la /🔽byis pa'i na tshod de la ni /
translated: Up to the sixteenth year after birth is the child.

original: dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang / de bzhin du mdangs rnams 'phel zhing rgyas bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dangs ma la sogs pa'i lus zungs rnams dang / mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang / de bzhin du mdangs rnams 'phel zhing rgyas bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The body elements, such as the nutritive essence, and the faculties, such as the eyes, and likewise the luster, increase and expand.

original: lo bcu bdun lon pa nas lo bdun cu'i bar du ni na tshod bar ma ste /
analyzed: lo bcu bdun lon pa nas lo bdun cu'i bar du ni na tshod bar ma ste /
translated: From the age of seventeen until the age of seventy, one is in the middle age.

original: gnas skabs der lus zungs la sogs pa shas cher 'phel ba dang 'bri ba gnyis kar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs der lus zungs la sogs pa shas cher 'phel ba dang 'bri ba gnyis kar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this period, the body elements, etc., do not increase or decrease to any great extent.

original: bdun cu rtsa gcig yan chad nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rgan po yin no //
analyzed: bdun cu rtsa gcig yan chad nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rgan po yin no //
translated: From the age of seventy-one until the end of life, one is old.

original: na tshod de'i skabs su ni lus zungs la sogs pa rim gyis zad cing 'bri ba yin te /
analyzed: na tshod de'i skabs su ni lus zungs la sogs pa rim gyis zad cing 'bri ba yin te /
translated: In this period, the body elements, etc., gradually diminish and decrease.

original: byis pa dang bar ma'i na tshod smos pa las ni gsum pa 'di don gyis ston pa yin no //
analyzed: byis pa dang bar ma'i na tshod smos pa las ni gsum pa 'di don gyis ston pa yin no //
translated: The third period is indicated by implication from the mention of the first two periods.

original: rang rang khru ni phyed dang bzhi //🔽lus ni tshe ring bde ba'i snod //
analyzed: rang rang khru ni phyed dang bzhi // lus ni tshe ring bde ba'i snod //
translated: Each is one and a half cubits.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The body is the vessel of long life and happiness.

original: skyes bu rang rang gi khru'i tshad kyi phyed dang bzhi ni skyes bu'i tshad yin pas de dang ldan pa'i lus ni tshe ring ba dang bde ba'i snod yin pas der srog gi dbang po dang / nad med par legs par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu rang rang gi khru'i tshad kyi phyed dang bzhi ni skyes bu'i tshad yin pas de dang ldan pa'i lus ni tshe ring ba dang bde ba'i snod yin pas der srog gi dbang po dang / nad med par legs par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The half and four fingerbreadths of the measure of the individual person is the measure of the person. The body endowed with that is the vessel of long life and happiness. Therefore, the faculty of life force and freedom from disease are well established in that.

original: spu med gnag dang shin tu sbom //
analyzed: spu med gnag dang shin tu sbom //
translated: Without hair, black, and very stout,

original: ring po nyid ni mi mthun bcas //
analyzed: ring po nyid ni mi mthun bcas //
translated: long, with the opposite,

original: smad pa brgyad dang rang nyid ldan //
analyzed: smad pa brgyad dang rang nyid ldan //
translated: having eight reproachable things,

original: gang yin de ni snod mi na 'gyur //
analyzed: gang yin de ni snod mi na 'gyur //
translated: that is not a vessel for life.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: gang gi lus la rang bzhin gyis sbu med pa la sogs pa smad par bya ba brgyad dang rang nyid ldan pa de ni tshe ring ba dang bde ba'i snod du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi lus la rang bzhin gyis sbu med pa la sogs pa smad par bya ba brgyad dang rang nyid ldan pa de ni tshe ring ba dang bde ba'i snod du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one who has eight reproachable things, such as naturally being without body hair, is not a vessel for long life and happiness.

original: smad pa brgyad ni shin tu sbu med pa dang / shin tu sbu mang ba dang / gnag ches pa dang / dkar ches pa dang / shin tu sbom pa dang / shin tu phra ba dang / ring ches pa dang / thung ches pa dang /
analyzed: smad pa brgyad ni shin tu sbu med pa dang / shin tu sbu mang ba dang / gnag ches pa dang / dkar ches pa dang / shin tu sbom pa dang / shin tu phra ba dang / ring ches pa dang / thung ches pa dang /
translated: The eight disparaging marks are: very little hair, too much hair, very black, too white, very thick, very thin, too long, and too short.

original: rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: These are the eight.🔽Hair is praised as being very glossy, soft,

original: skra ni rab snum 'jam pa dang // phra zhing rtsa ba ma 'dres brtan //
analyzed: skra ni rab snum 'jam pa dang // phra zhing rtsa ba ma 'dres brtan //
translated: thin, with roots not mixed, firm.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: skyes bu'i skra kha dog gi mdangs snum pa dang / 'jam zhing mi bshor ba dang / phra zhing mi sbom pa dang / rtsa ba ma 'dres shing bu ga re re nas skyes pa dang / brtan zhing mi 'byi ba bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i skra kha dog gi mdangs snum pa dang / 'jam zhing mi bshor ba dang / phra zhing mi sbom pa dang / rtsa ba ma 'dres shing bu ga re re nas skyes pa dang / brtan zhing mi 'byi ba bsngags pa yin no //
translated: the luster of a man's hair is glossy, soft and does not fall out, thin and not thick, with roots not mixed, growing from each pore, and firm and not brittle.

original: dpral ba mtho zhing mur 'gram 'byar //
analyzed: dpral ba mtho zhing mur 'gram 'byar //
translated: The forehead is high and the temples are full.

original: zla ba kha ma pa 'dra ba bzang //
analyzed: zla ba kha ma pa 'dra ba bzang //
translated: It is good to be like the full moon.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: dpral ba ni dpangs mtho zhing dpral mtshams 'byes pa dang / mur 'gram 'byar zhing legs par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du zla ba kham pa ste /
analyzed: dpral ba ni dpangs mtho zhing dpral mtshams 'byes pa dang / mur 'gram 'byar zhing legs par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du zla ba kham pa ste /
translated: The forehead is high and the hairline is well-defined. The temples are full and well-formed.

original: @47b zla ba phyed pa'i dbyibs 'dra ba bzang ngo //🔽rna ba rgyab phyogs rgya che mdzes //
analyzed: @47b zla ba phyed pa'i dbyibs 'dra ba bzang ngo // rna ba rgyab phyogs rgya che mdzes //
translated: The cheeks are good if they are like a half-moon.

original: rna shal che zhing sha yis rgyas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rna shal che zhing sha yis rgyas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The back of the ears is beautiful if it is broad.

original: rna ba'i rgyab kyi phyogs rgya che zhing mdzes pa dang / rna shal che zhing sha rgyas pa bzang ngo //
analyzed: rna ba'i rgyab kyi phyogs rgya che zhing mdzes pa dang / rna shal che zhing sha rgyas pa bzang ngo //
translated: The earlobes are good if they are large and full.

original: mig ni dkar nag 'byes pa dang // rdzi ma mthug cing snyoms pa bzang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mig ni dkar nag 'byes pa dang // rdzi ma mthug cing snyoms pa bzang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The eyes are good if the white and black parts are distinct,🔽and if the eyelashes are thick and even.🔽The eyes are good if the white and black parts of the eyes are distinct,

original: mig gi mtshan nyid ni mig 'bras dkar nag 'byes pa dang / rdzi ma'i tshogs mthug cing snyoms pa dang ldan pa bzang ngo //🔽sna yi rtse mo dbugs cher 'byung //
analyzed: mig gi mtshan nyid ni mig 'bras dkar nag 'byes pa dang / rdzi ma'i tshogs mthug cing snyoms pa dang ldan pa bzang ngo // sna yi rtse mo dbugs cher 'byung //
translated: and if the eyelashes are thick and even.🔽The tip of the nose is good if it is fleshy,

original: sha rgyas drang zhing snyoms pa bzang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sha rgyas drang zhing snyoms pa bzang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: straight, and even.

original: sna ni mtho zhing legs pa dang / dbugs chen po 'byung zhing rgyu ba rung ba dang / sha rgyas shing ma zhum pa dang / drang zhing ya yo med pa dang / snyoms shing mthon dman med pa bzang ngo //
analyzed: sna ni mtho zhing legs pa dang / dbugs chen po 'byung zhing rgyu ba rung ba dang / sha rgyas shing ma zhum pa dang / drang zhing ya yo med pa dang / snyoms shing mthon dman med pa bzang ngo //
translated: The nose is good if it is high and well-formed, if it is suitable to breathe in and out, if the flesh is full and not sunken, if it is straight and not crooked, and if it is even and not uneven.

original: mchu ni dmar zhing ma 'phyangs pa //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchu ni dmar zhing ma 'phyangs pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The lips are good if they are red and not hanging down.

original: mchu bim pa ltar dmar ba dang / 'phyang zhing phyi rol du ldog pa med pa bzang ngo //
analyzed: mchu bim pa ltar dmar ba dang / 'phyang zhing phyi rol du ldog pa med pa bzang ngo //
translated: The lips are good if they are red like a bimba fruit and not hanging down or turned outward.

original: 'gram pa yangs shing mi 'bur bzang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'gram pa yangs shing mi 'bur bzang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cheeks are good if they are broad and not protruding.

original: skyes bu'i 'gram pa gnyis ni yangs shing rgya che ba dang 'bar 'bur med pa bzang ngo /🔽kha che // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'gram pa gnyis ni yangs shing rgya che ba dang 'bar 'bur med pa bzang ngo / kha che // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The two cheeks of a man are good if they are broad and expansive and not bumpy.

original: kha'i zheng ni che ba bzang ngo //
analyzed: kha'i zheng ni che ba bzang ngo //
translated: The mouth is good if it is not too wide.

original: so yi tshags dam la /
analyzed: so yi tshags dam la /
translated: The teeth are good if they are even,

original: snum zhing 'jam la dkar zhing snyoms //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snum zhing 'jam la dkar zhing snyoms //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: smooth, white, and well-aligned.

original: so tshags dam zhing legs par gnas pa dang / mdangs snum pa dang / 'jam zhing snum bag med pa dang / dkar zhing rnyog pa med pa dang / snyoms shing mtho dman med pa bzang ngo //

analyzed: shes rab dam par 'gyur ba dang de bzhin du bya ba rnams la brtan zhing mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: tshangs par spyod dang byas pa gzo //
translated: he is celibate and grateful;

original: byams ldan bcud kyis len bsten pa //
analyzed: byams ldan bcud kyis len bsten pa //
translated: he is loving and relies on the elixir.

original: tshe dang bsod nams 'phel ba'i sde //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshe dang bsod nams 'phel ba'i sde //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is the one who increases life and merit.

original: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa sde tshan 'di ni tshe dang bsod nams 'phel bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la sogs pa sde tshan 'di ni tshe dang bsod nams 'phel bar byed pa yin te /
translated: This group of generosity, morality, etc. increases life and merit.

original: de yang sbyin pa ni gser la sogs pa'i dngos po ci nus par gtong ba'o //
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa ni gser la sogs pa'i dngos po ci nus par gtong ba'o //
translated: Generosity is giving away gold, etc. to the best of one's ability.

original: tshul khrims ni nyes pa sdom pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni nyes pa sdom pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Morality is the nature of restraining evil.

original: snying brtse ba ni sems can rnams la snying rje ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: snying brtse ba ni sems can rnams la snying rje ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Compassion is having compassion for sentient beings.

original: bden pa ni brdzun med pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa ni brdzun med pa'o //
translated: Truth is non-deception.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni mya ngan @49b 'das pa thob pa'i don du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni mya ngan @49b 'das pa thob pa'i don du spyod pa'o //
translated: Pure conduct is conduct for the sake of attaining nirvana.

original: 'khrig pa'i chos sbang ba'o //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i chos sbang ba'o //
translated: Abandoning sexual intercourse is abandoning sexual intercourse.

original: byas pa gzo ba ni phan du byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba'o //
analyzed: byas pa gzo ba ni phan du byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba'o //
translated: Appreciating what is done is knowing what is beneficial and being grateful.

original: byams pa dang ldan pa ni sems can thams cad bdag dang 'dra bar bde ba dang ldan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang ldan pa ni sems can thams cad bdag dang 'dra bar bde ba dang ldan par byed pa'o //
translated: Having love is making all sentient beings possess happiness, just like oneself.

original: bcud kyis len ni tshangs pa dang 'phrog byed dang gnas 'jog la sogs pas bshad pa'i tshul bcud kyis len gyi le'u las bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcud kyis len ni tshangs pa dang 'phrog byed dang gnas 'jog la sogs pas bshad pa'i tshul bcud kyis len gyi le'u las bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: The Rasayana is the method explained by Brahma, Hara, and Vasistha, and so forth, as it is explained in the chapter on Rasayana.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'di dag la brten cing goms par byas na la la ni bsod nams 'phel bar byed pa yin /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'di dag la brten cing goms par byas na la la ni bsod nams 'phel bar byed pa yin /
translated: If one relies on and becomes accustomed to these perfections such as generosity, some increase merit,

original: la la ni gnyis ka 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: la la ni gnyis ka 'phel bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and some increase both.

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po bsdus pa'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po bsdus pa'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
translated: The Candraprabha commentary on the essence of the eight branches, called “Moonlight on the words and meanings,”

original: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las /
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las /
translated: was composed by the master Candrakīrti.

original: lus kyi gnas kyi le'u gsum pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas kyi le'u gsum pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the third chapter, the chapter on the body’s locations.

original: // / de nas lus kyi gnad kyi bye brag bshad par bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / de nas lus kyi gnad kyi bye brag bshad par bya'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, the specific vital points of the body will be explained.

original: yan lag gi bye brag bsten pa'i 'og tu gnad kyi bye brag brtsams pa ni /
analyzed: yan lag gi bye brag bsten pa'i 'og tu gnad kyi bye brag brtsams pa ni /
translated: After relying on the specific branches, the specific vital points are begun.

original: gnad rnams kyang yan lag la brten pa yin pa'i phyir 'di brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gnad rnams kyang yan lag la brten pa yin pa'i phyir 'di brtsams pa yin no //
translated: The vital points are also based on the limbs, so this is composed.

original: de yang gnad rnams kyi khyad par dbye ba ni bye brag bstan pa ste gong du bstan pa de bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o //🔽gnad ni brgya las bdun lhag pa //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang gnad rnams kyi khyad par dbye ba ni bye brag bstan pa ste gong du bstan pa de bshad par bya'o zhes pa'o // gnad ni brgya las bdun lhag pa // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, the classification of the distinctions of the vital points is the teaching of the distinctions, which should be explained as taught above.🔽There are 107 vital points in this body.

original: lus 'dir gnad ni brgya rtsa bdun yod pas na brgya las bdun lhag ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'dir gnad ni brgya rtsa bdun yod pas na brgya las bdun lhag ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called more than 100 by seven.

original: de las bcu gcig brla dang ni //
analyzed: de las bcu gcig brla dang ni //
translated: Among those, there are 11 in the two thighs,

original: de bzhin lag ngar gnyis so sor //🔽lto ba la gsum brang la dgu //
analyzed: de bzhin lag ngar gnyis so sor // lto ba la gsum brang la dgu //
translated: and likewise, in the two forearms individually,🔽there are three in the abdomen, nine in the chest,

original: rgyab la bcu bzhi nam tshong ni //
analyzed: rgyab la bcu bzhi nam tshong ni //
translated: and 14 in the back.

original: yan chad sum cu rtsa bdun yod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: yan chad sum cu rtsa bdun yod // ces bya ba la /
translated: Above the collar bone, there are 37.

original: gnad de rnams brla gnyis dang / de bzhin lag ngar gnyis ka so sor gnad bcu gcig gnas pa yin no ;
analyzed: gnad de rnams brla gnyis dang / de bzhin lag ngar gnyis ka so sor gnad bcu gcig gnas pa yin no ;
translated: Among those vital points, there are 11 vital points in the two thighs, and likewise, in the two forearms individually,🔽there are three in the abdomen, nine in the chest,🔽and 14 in the back.

original: / lto ba la gnad gsum dang / brang la dgu dang / rgyab la bcu bzhi dang / nam tshong yan chad du gnad sum cu rtsa bdun yod do //
analyzed: / lto ba la gnad gsum dang / brang la dgu dang / rgyab la bcu bzhi dang / nam tshong yan chad du gnad sum cu rtsa bdun yod do //
translated: There are three vital points in the belly, nine in the chest, fourteen in the back, and thirty-seven vital points above the collar bone.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o //🔽rkang pa'i mthil nas gung mo yi //🔽thad ka yi ni mthil 'phrog ba'i //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig gi lhag ma'o // rkang pa'i mthil nas gung mo yi // thad ka yi ni mthil 'phrog ba'i //
translated: This is the remainder of the verse.🔽The vital point called “foot-sole”🔽is in the middle of the sole of the foot,

original: gnad yod ces ni rnam par bshad //
analyzed: gnad yod ces ni rnam par bshad //
translated: in line with the middle finger.

original: de phug gnad kyis 'chi bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽rkang pa'i mthil gyi dbus na gung mo'i sor mo'i thad ka na /
analyzed: de phug gnad kyis 'chi bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la / rkang pa'i mthil gyi dbus na gung mo'i sor mo'i thad ka na /
translated: If it is pierced, the vital point of death.🔽The vital point called “foot-sole” is in the middle of the sole of the foot, in line with the middle finger.

original: mthil 'phrog pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod do zhes sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi bshad do //
analyzed: mthil 'phrog pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod do zhes sngon gyi slob dpon rnams kyi bshad do //
translated: This is the explanation of the former masters.

original: gnad de phug cing brtol na gzer ba la sogs pa'i nad de 'chi zhing lus dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba @50a * //
analyzed: gnad de phug cing brtol na gzer ba la sogs pa'i nad de 'chi zhing lus dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba @50a * //
translated: If that vital point is pierced or penetrated, the person will die from a disease such as gout and will separate from the body.

original: yin no // mtheb sor dbus na rgya tshigs te //
analyzed: yin no // mtheb sor dbus na rgya tshigs te //
translated: The vital point called “toe-joint” is in the middle of the big toe.

original: de phug bskyod pa'i gnad kyis 'chi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phug bskyod pa'i gnad kyis 'chi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is pierced, the vital point of shaking will kill the person.

original: rkang pa'i mthe bong sen mo'i dbus na rgya tshigs zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthe bong sen mo'i dbus na rgya tshigs zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de //
translated: In the middle of the nail of the toe is the vital point called “joint”.

original: de phug na bskyod pa zhes bya ba'i rlung gi gnad kyis 'chi bar byed do //
analyzed: de phug na bskyod pa zhes bya ba'i rlung gi gnad kyis 'chi bar byed do //
translated: Below it is the vital point of the wind called “moving”.

original: de gong sor gnyis shes par bya //
analyzed: de gong sor gnyis shes par bya //
translated: One should know that it is two finger-widths above that.

original: rkang pa 'khor zhing 'dar bar byed //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkang pa 'khor zhing 'dar bar byed // ces bya ba ni /
translated: It causes the foot to turn and tremble.

original: rgya tshigs kyi gong nas sor gnyis kyis chod par pir zhes bya ba'i gnad yod do //
analyzed: rgya tshigs kyi gong nas sor gnyis kyis chod par pir zhes bya ba'i gnad yod do //
translated: Two finger-widths above the joint is the vital point called “brush”.

original: de bcad dam phug na rkang pa 'khor zhing g-yo la 'dar bar byed do //
analyzed: de bcad dam phug na rkang pa 'khor zhing g-yo la 'dar bar byed do //
translated: If it is cut or pierced, the foot turns, moves, and trembles.

original: long mo'i tshigs 'og pir mgo ste //
analyzed: long mo'i tshigs 'og pir mgo ste //
translated: Below the ankle joint is the brush head.

original: de bcad skrang dang nad skyed byed ;🔽/ ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de bcad skrang dang nad skyed byed ; / ces bya ba la /
translated: If it is cut, it causes swelling and disease.

original: long mo'i tshigs kyi 'og na pir gyi mgo 'dra ba dang po'i 'og na pir gyi mgo drangs pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod do //
analyzed: long mo'i tshigs kyi 'og na pir gyi mgo 'dra ba dang po'i 'og na pir gyi mgo drangs pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod do //
translated: Below the ankle joint is the vital point called “brush head” and below the first is the vital point called “drawn brush head”.

original: de phug cing bcad na skrang pa dang nad skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de phug cing bcad na skrang pa dang nad skyed par byed do //
translated: If it is pierced or cut, it causes swelling and disease.

original: byin pa rkang pa gnyis kyi bar //
analyzed: byin pa rkang pa gnyis kyi bar //
translated: Between the two legs is the vital point called “calf”.

original: long mo'i gnad rengs bem por byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: long mo'i gnad rengs bem por byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: The vital part called ankle, when affected, causes paralysis of the body.

original: byin pa dang rkang pa gnyis kyi bar mtshams na long mo zhes bya ba'i gnad phug na na zhing gzer ba dang / brla zug rengs pa bem por 'gyur zhing tshor ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byin pa dang rkang pa gnyis kyi bar mtshams na long mo zhes bya ba'i gnad phug na na zhing gzer ba dang / brla zug rengs pa bem por 'gyur zhing tshor ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Between the two, the shank and the foot, is the vital part called ankle. When affected, it causes pain and piercing pain, and the thigh becomes paralyzed and numb.

original: byin pa'i nang na nyva zhes pa //
analyzed: byin pa'i nang na nyva zhes pa //
translated: The vital part called calf, in the shank,

original: khrag zad pa yis 'chi bar byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: khrag zad pa yis 'chi bar byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: causes death through loss of blood.

original: byin pa'i nang na rting pa yan chad sor bcu gzhal ba na /
analyzed: byin pa'i nang na rting pa yan chad sor bcu gzhal ba na /
translated: In the shank, above the heel, there are ten finger-widths.

original: byin nyva zhes bya ba'i gnad yod do //
analyzed: byin nyva zhes bya ba'i gnad yod do //
translated: In the vital part called calf, there is a vital part.

original: de phug na khrag zad pa'i nad kyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phug na khrag zad pa'i nad kyis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When affected, it causes death through loss of blood.

original: byin pa brla mtshams pus mo ste //
analyzed: byin pa brla mtshams pus mo ste //
translated: The knee is at the junction of the shank and the thigh.

original: de phug gson yang 'theng por 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phug gson yang 'theng por 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: When affected, one lives, but limps.

original: byin pa dang brla gnyis 'dus pa'i mtshams na pus mo zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
analyzed: byin pa dang brla gnyis 'dus pa'i mtshams na pus mo zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
translated: The knee is at the junction of the shank and the thigh.

original: de phug na skyes bu gson zhing srog dang ma bral na yang 'theng po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phug na skyes bu gson zhing srog dang ma bral na yang 'theng po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one pierces it, the person will become lame, even though he is alive and not separated from his life.

original: pus gong sor gsum par gnyan gong //
analyzed: pus gong sor gsum par gnyan gong //
translated: The knee-joint is the “knee-cap”.

original: de phug brla rengs skrang bar byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de phug brla rengs skrang bar byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: If one pierces it, the thigh will be paralyzed and swell.

original: pus mo'i gong du sor gsum gzhal ba'i gnas na gnyan gong zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
analyzed: pus mo'i gong du sor gsum gzhal ba'i gnas na gnyan gong zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
translated: The “knee-cap” is the place three finger-widths above the knee.

original: de phug na brla rengs pa dang skrang bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de phug na brla rengs pa dang skrang bar byed pa yin no //
translated: If one pierces it, the thigh will be paralyzed and swell.

original: brla nang brla dbang zhes bya ba //🔽de phug khrag zags brla skam 'gyur //
analyzed: brla nang brla dbang zhes bya ba // de phug khrag zags brla skam 'gyur //
translated: The “thigh-lord” is inside the thigh.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one pierces it, blood will flow and the thigh will dry up.

original: brla'i nang na brla dbang zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
analyzed: brla'i nang na brla dbang zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
translated: The “thigh-lord” is the vital part inside the thigh.

original: de phug cing gtses pa na khrag gzags shing zad pas brla skam par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phug cing gtses pa na khrag gzags shing zad pas brla skam par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one pierces it, blood will flow and the thigh will dry up because of the loss of blood.

original: brla rtsa mig dmar zhes bya ba //
analyzed: brla rtsa mig dmar zhes bya ba //
translated: The “red-eye” is the thigh-vein.

original: khrag zad pas ni gzhogs phyed @50b 'joms //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khrag zad pas ni gzhogs phyed @50b 'joms //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one pierces it, the side will be paralyzed because of the loss of blood.

original: brla'i steng dang chu so'i mtshams na mig dmar zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
analyzed: brla'i steng dang chu so'i mtshams na mig dmar zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
translated: The vital point called “red eye” is located above the thigh and between the bladder and the rectum.

original: de phug na khrag zad pas lus kyi gzhogs phyed 'joms shing zad par byed do //
analyzed: de phug na khrag zad pas lus kyi gzhogs phyed 'joms shing zad par byed do //
translated: If it is pierced, the blood is exhausted, and the body’s side is destroyed and wasted.

original: brla rtsa rlig pa'i bar gyi gnad //
analyzed: brla rtsa rlig pa'i bar gyi gnad //
translated: The vital point between the thigh and the testicles

original: ljon shing zhes bya ma ning byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ljon shing zhes bya ma ning byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: is called “tree” and “eunuch.”

original: rlig pa dang brla'i bar na ljon shing zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
analyzed: rlig pa dang brla'i bar na ljon shing zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
translated: The vital point called “tree” is located between the testicles and the thighs.

original: de phug na ma ning ste /
analyzed: de phug na ma ning ste /
translated: If it is pierced, one becomes a eunuch.

original: bu tsha med pa'am bud med la spyod pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag brla'i'o //
analyzed: bu tsha med pa'am bud med la spyod pa'i nus pa med par 'gyur ro // de dag brla'i'o //
translated: One will have no offspring or the ability to have intercourse with a woman.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those are the vital points of the thighs.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i tshig se brla rtsa man chad na gnad ji snyed yod ba rdzogs par byas shing bstan zin to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i tshig se brla rtsa man chad na gnad ji snyed yod ba rdzogs par byas shing bstan zin to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word “those” is a perfect participle, meaning that all the vital points that exist below the thigh and the testicles have been taught and completed.

original: dbung de bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbung de bzhin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The shoulders are the same.

original: dpung pa gnyis kyi bar gyi gnad rnams kyang grangs de snyed yod pas na /
analyzed: dpung pa gnyis kyi bar gyi gnad rnams kyang grangs de snyed yod pas na /
translated: The vital points between the two shoulders are the same number.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it says “the same.”

original: de'i khyad par 'di yin te //
analyzed: de'i khyad par 'di yin te //
translated: The difference between them is this:

original: mkhrig ma 'di ni long mor mtshungs //🔽gru mo byin 'dra de gnyis phug / ces bya ba la /🔽rkang pa dang byin pa'i mtshams su ni long mo zhes bya ba'i gnad yod par bshad la /
analyzed: mkhrig ma 'di ni long mor mtshungs // gru mo byin 'dra de gnyis phug / ces bya ba la / rkang pa dang byin pa'i mtshams su ni long mo zhes bya ba'i gnad yod par bshad la /
translated: The wrist is like the ankle.🔽The elbow is like the knee.🔽The ankle is explained as a vital part at the juncture of the foot and the calf.

original: de lag pa'i skabs su lag pa lag dar gyi mtshams kyi gnad ni mkhrig ma zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lag pa'i skabs su lag pa lag dar gyi mtshams kyi gnad ni mkhrig ma zhes pa'o //
translated: In the case of the arm, the vital part at the juncture of the forearm and the hand is the wrist.

original: de bzhin du gru mo dang lag dar gyi mtshams kyi dpung pa'i dbus kyi phyogs kyi gnas ni gru mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gru mo dang lag dar gyi mtshams kyi dpung pa'i dbus kyi phyogs kyi gnas ni gru mo zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the elbow is the vital part in the middle of the arm at the juncture of the forearm and the hand.

original: de ltar mkhrig ma dang gru mo'i gnad gnyis phug na sgur zhing zha bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mkhrig ma dang gru mo'i gnad gnyis phug na sgur zhing zha bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the two vital parts of the wrist and the elbow are pierced, one becomes bent over and crippled.

original: zha bo ljon shing 'dra ba ni //
analyzed: zha bo ljon shing 'dra ba ni //
translated: The cripple is like a tree.

original: mchan khung nang na mchan khung 'dzin //🔽de phug zha bo nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: mchan khung nang na mchan khung 'dzin // de phug zha bo nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The armpit is held in the armpit.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is pierced, one becomes crippled.

original: sngar gyi ji ltar ljon shing zhes bya ba'i gnad la /
analyzed: sngar gyi ji ltar ljon shing zhes bya ba'i gnad la /
translated: The vital part called “tree” is as explained above.

original: rlig pa dang brla rtsa'i bar na 'dug pa dang 'dra bar mchan khung gi dbus nas dpung mgo'i bar na mchan khung 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
analyzed: rlig pa dang brla rtsa'i bar na 'dug pa dang 'dra bar mchan khung gi dbus nas dpung mgo'i bar na mchan khung 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
translated: The vital point called armpit-seizer exists between the middle of the armpit and the shoulder, as if it were between the testicles and the thigh.

original: gnad de phug na lag ngar zha zhing sgur ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnad de phug na lag ngar zha zhing sgur ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that vital point is pierced, the forearm becomes paralyzed and bent.

original: de ltar na de dag gis yan lag gi gnad rnams smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag gis yan lag gi gnad rnams smras pa yin no //
translated: Thus, they have described the vital points of the limbs.

original: long kha'i gnad ni gzhang zhes bya //
analyzed: long kha'i gnad ni gzhang zhes bya //
translated: The vital point of the anus is called the rectum.

original: de phug gzhang rlung gis 'phral gsod //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de phug gzhang rlung gis 'phral gsod // ces bya ba la /
translated: If it is pierced, one dies instantly from the wind of the rectum.

original: long kha rgyu ma sbom po zhes bya ba dang 'brel pa ni gzhang kha zhes bya ste /
analyzed: long kha rgyu ma sbom po zhes bya ba dang 'brel pa ni gzhang kha zhes bya ste /
translated: The rectum is connected to the large intestine called the thick intestine.

original: de phug na bshang ba dang rlung ngam 'phyen 'byung zhing zags pas 'phral du de'i mod la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phug na bshang ba dang rlung ngam 'phyen 'byung zhing zags pas 'phral du de'i mod la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //

original: lgang pa gzhu ltar yo ba yi //
analyzed: lgang pa gzhu ltar yo ba yi //

original: dbus na kha cig thur du lta //

original: rked pa'i dbus na srog 'phral 'joms //
analyzed: rked pa'i dbus na srog 'phral 'joms //

original: rde'u @51a * //
analyzed: rde'u @51a * //

original: 'byin rma phug gnas ma gtogs //
analyzed: 'byin rma phug gnas ma gtogs //

original: de yang ngos gnyis phug ste 'dra //
analyzed: de yang ngos gnyis phug ste 'dra //

original: gcin 'dzag gnas dang gcig tu phug / rma ni 'tsho bar shin tu dka' //
analyzed: gcin 'dzag gnas dang gcig tu phug / rma ni 'tsho bar shin tu dka' //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: lgang ba'i gcin gyi gnas te /
analyzed: lgang ba'i gcin gyi gnas te /

analyzed: de na gzhu'i dbyibs ltar yo ba'i gnad chu so zhes bya ba la /

original: sha dang khrag nyung zhing shas chung bar gnas pa /
analyzed: sha dang khrag nyung zhing shas chung bar gnas pa /

original: dbus na kha gcig yod pa kha thur du bltas pa rked pa'i dbus na yod de /
analyzed: dbus na kha gcig yod pa kha thur du bltas pa rked pa'i dbus na yod de /
translated: In the middle of the waist, there is a single opening facing downward.

original: de phug na srog 'phral du de'i mod la 'jig cing 'jig par byed de gcin nad rde'us 'gags pa 'byin ba'i rma gang zhig byed pa de ma gtogs te /
analyzed: de phug na srog 'phral du de'i mod la 'jig cing 'jig par byed de gcin nad rde'us 'gags pa 'byin ba'i rma gang zhig byed pa de ma gtogs te /
translated: If it is pierced, life is immediately destroyed and destroyed at that very moment, except for the wound that expels the stone that blocks the urinary duct.

original: rde'u 'byin pa'i rma'i skabs der yang ngos gnyis su phug cing brtol na snga ma dang 'dra bar 'phral du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rde'u 'byin pa'i rma'i skabs der yang ngos gnyis su phug cing brtol na snga ma dang 'dra bar 'phral du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even in the case of a wound that expels a stone, if it is pierced and opened on either side, it is similar to the previous case and life is immediately destroyed.

original: chu so'i phyogs gcig tu phug na gcin 'dzag pa'i rmar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chu so'i phyogs gcig tu phug na gcin 'dzag pa'i rmar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is pierced in one part of the urinary duct, it becomes a wound of the urinary bladder.

original: de yang 'tshob cing 'byor pa ni shin tu dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'tshob cing 'byor pa ni shin tu dka' ba yin no //

original: lus ni zhu dang ma zhu'i gnas //
analyzed: lus ni zhu dang ma zhu'i gnas //

original: dbus la lte ba rtsa kun gyi //
analyzed: dbus la lte ba rtsa kun gyi //

analyzed: lus kyi dbus su zhu ba dang ma zhu ba'i gnas na lte ba zhes bya ba'i bar gyi gnad yod de /
translated: In the middle of the body, in the place of digestion and non-digestion, there is a vital point called the navel.

original: de yang rtsa thams cad kyi rten dang gnas yin la /
analyzed: de yang rtsa thams cad kyi rten dang gnas yin la /

analyzed: de phug par gyur na yang 'phral du gsod cing srog dang 'bral bar byed pa yin no //

analyzed: ma zhu ba yi gnas sgor gyur //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de yang brang dang nu ma dang lto ba'i dbus na gnas pa yin te /
