translated: on the two sides of the spine,

original: sog pa zhes bya ba de la brten pa'i gnad yod do //
analyzed: sog pa zhes bya ba de la brten pa'i gnad yod do //
translated: the “shoulder-blade” (bones) are located.

original: de snad pas ni lag ngar bskams pa dang / tshor ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro //🔽mgrin pa gnyis kyi ngos gnyis rtsa //🔽dpung mgo dang ni mgrin pa'i bar //
analyzed: de snad pas ni lag ngar bskams pa dang / tshor ba dang bral bar 'gyur ro // mgrin pa gnyis kyi ngos gnyis rtsa // dpung mgo dang ni mgrin pa'i bar //
translated: If they are injured, the arms will wither and lose sensation.🔽On the two sides of the throat, the two “wind-pipe” (bones) are located.

original: phrag pa phrag pa la brten gnad //
analyzed: phrag pa phrag pa la brten gnad //
translated: Between the shoulders and the throat,🔽the “shoulder” (bones) are located.

original: da phug lag ngar bya ba nyams ;🔽/ zhes bya ba la /🔽mgrin pa gnyis kyi ngos gnyis kyi mtshams gnyis na dpung pa dang / mgo bo dang mgrin pa'i bar na gnas pa'i gnad phrag pa zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: da phug lag ngar bya ba nyams ; / zhes bya ba la / mgrin pa gnyis kyi ngos gnyis kyi mtshams gnyis na dpung pa dang / mgo bo dang mgrin pa'i bar na gnas pa'i gnad phrag pa zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: If they are injured, the armpits and arms will lose their function.🔽On the two sides of the throat,🔽between the shoulders and the throat,🔽the “shoulder” (bones) are located.

original: de yang phrag pa la brten cing gnas la /
analyzed: de yang phrag pa la brten cing gnas la /
translated: They are supported by the shoulders.

original: de lta bu de phug na lag ngar gyi bya ba nyams shing 'jas te /
analyzed: de lta bu de phug na lag ngar gyi bya ba nyams shing 'jas te /
translated: When that is pierced, the function of the arms is impaired and they become stiff.

original: brkyang ba ba dang bskum pa'i bya ba byed mi nus par 'gyur ro //🔽srol gang gi ni ngos gnyis na //🔽'gram pa la ni brten pa'i rtsa //
analyzed: brkyang ba ba dang bskum pa'i bya ba byed mi nus par 'gyur ro // srol gang gi ni ngos gnyis na // 'gram pa la ni brten pa'i rtsa //
translated: One is unable to perform the function of extending and contracting the arms.🔽There are four channels🔽that are located on both sides of the neck.

original: bzhi ste de la sngon po gnyis //
analyzed: bzhi ste de la sngon po gnyis //
translated: Two of them are the vital points of the neck,

original: gnyis pa'ang mjing pa'i gnad du bshad //🔽de phug skad 'gags mi sdug dang // lce yis ro ni mi tshor 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis pa'ang mjing pa'i gnad du bshad // de phug skad 'gags mi sdug dang // lce yis ro ni mi tshor 'gyur //
translated: and two are the vital points of the throat.🔽When they are pierced, one’s voice is impaired, one becomes ugly,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and one cannot taste with the tongue.

original: srol gong gi ngos g-yas g-yon gnyis na 'gram pa la brten cing gnas pa'i rtsa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: srol gong gi ngos g-yas g-yon gnyis na 'gram pa la brten cing gnas pa'i rtsa bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four channels that are located on both sides of the neck, on the right and left, and that are situated in dependence on the cheeks.

original: rtsa de dag gi nang nas rtsa gnyis ni sngon po zhes bya ba'i gnad yin la /
analyzed: rtsa de dag gi nang nas rtsa gnyis ni sngon po zhes bya ba'i gnad yin la /
translated: Two of those channels are the vital points called “blue.”

original: gnyis ni mjing pa'i gnad yin par bshad do //
analyzed: gnyis ni mjing pa'i gnad yin par bshad do //
translated: Two are explained as the vital points of the neck.

original: de phug cing bcad na skad 'gags pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phug cing bcad na skad 'gags pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are pierced and cut, one’s voice is impaired and so forth.

original: de la skad 'gags pa ni skad thams cad nas thams cad du 'gags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la skad 'gags pa ni skad thams cad nas thams cad du 'gags par 'gyur ro //
translated: “One’s voice is impaired” means that all voice is completely impaired.

original: yang na mi sdug pa ste skad gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / ro mi tshor zhing lce bem bem por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na mi sdug pa ste skad gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / ro mi tshor zhing lce bem bem por 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, it is unpleasant, i.e., it changes into another sound, and the tongue becomes numb and stiff.

original: lkog ma'i sbubs kyi ngos gnyis nas //
analyzed: lkog ma'i sbubs kyi ngos gnyis nas //
translated: On both sides of the throat-cavity

original: lce dang snar ni 'gro ba'i rtsa //
analyzed: lce dang snar ni 'gro ba'i rtsa //
translated: are the channels that go to the tongue and nose.

original: so sor bzhi bzhi yod ma mo //
analyzed: so sor bzhi bzhi yod ma mo //
translated: There are four each, it is said.

original: de bcad 'phral du srog 'joms so //
analyzed: de bcad 'phral du srog 'joms so //
translated: If they are pierced, life is immediately destroyed.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: lkog ma'i sbubs kyi g-yas g-yon gnyis nas lcer 'gro zhing rgyu ba'i rtsa dang / de bzhin du snar 'gro zhing rgyu ba'i rtsa so so zhing bzhi bzhi yod de /
analyzed: lkog ma'i sbubs kyi g-yas g-yon gnyis nas lcer 'gro zhing rgyu ba'i rtsa dang / de bzhin du snar 'gro zhing rgyu ba'i rtsa so so zhing bzhi bzhi yod de /
translated: on the right and left sides of the throat-cavity, there are four channels each that go to the tongue and nose.

original: de ni ma mo zhes bya ba'i gnad yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma mo zhes bya ba'i gnad yin te /
translated: This is called the “mother” vital point.

original: de phug na skad cig ma de nyid la 'phral du srog 'joms shing 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phug na skad cig ma de nyid la 'phral du srog 'joms shing 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is pierced, life is immediately destroyed in that very instant and one dies.

original: mgo bo ske mtshams ltag pa ste //
analyzed: mgo bo ske mtshams ltag pa ste //
translated: The back of the neck is at the base of the skull.

original: de phug mgo bo ldem por 'gyur //
analyzed: de phug mgo bo ldem por 'gyur //
translated: If it is pierced, the head will be bent.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: mgo bo dang ske'i mtshams na ltag pa zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis tshigs mtshams kyi ngos gnyis na gnas te /
analyzed: mgo bo dang ske'i mtshams na ltag pa zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis tshigs mtshams kyi ngos gnyis na gnas te /
translated: At the juncture of the head and neck, there are two vital points called “nape of the neck.”

original: de phug na mgo bo ldem zhing 'dar bar @53a * //🔽'gyur ro // rna ba gnyis 'og lcong ba ni //
analyzed: de phug na mgo bo ldem zhing 'dar bar @53a * // 'gyur ro // rna ba gnyis 'og lcong ba ni //
translated: If they are pierced, the head will nod and shake.

original: rna rtsa zhes bya 'on par 'gyur //
analyzed: rna rtsa zhes bya 'on par 'gyur //
translated: “Below the ears, the ‘ear roots’

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: will cause deafness.”

original: rna ba gnyis kyi 'og na lcong zhing dma' ba na rna rtsa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
analyzed: rna ba gnyis kyi 'og na lcong zhing dma' ba na rna rtsa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
translated: “Below the two ears, there are two vital points called ‘ear roots.’

original: de gnyis phug na sgra thos ba 'joms shing 'on bar 'gyur ro //🔽sna yi bu ga gnyis dang ni //🔽sna yi lam 'gro mgrin nang gnas //
analyzed: de gnyis phug na sgra thos ba 'joms shing 'on bar 'gyur ro // sna yi bu ga gnyis dang ni // sna yi lam 'gro mgrin nang gnas //
translated: If they are pierced, the hearing of sounds will be destroyed and one will become deaf.”🔽“In the two nostrils and🔽in the throat, there are two vital points called ‘snake heads.’

original: sbrul mgo zhes bya de bcad na //
analyzed: sbrul mgo zhes bya de bcad na //
translated: If they are pierced,

original: dri mi tshor bar byed par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri mi tshor bar byed par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: the sense of smell will be destroyed.”🔽“In the two nostrils and in the throat, there are two vital points called ‘snake heads.’

original: sprul mgo zhes bya ba'i gnad kyi bye brag sna'i bu ga'i gnas g-yas g-yon gnyis dang / sna'i bu ga'i lam du 'gro ba dang / de bzhin du mgrin pa'i nang na gnas shing brten par byed de /
analyzed: sprul mgo zhes bya ba'i gnad kyi bye brag sna'i bu ga'i gnas g-yas g-yon gnyis dang / sna'i bu ga'i lam du 'gro ba dang / de bzhin du mgrin pa'i nang na gnas shing brten par byed de /
translated: It is also located in the throat, where it supports the nose.

original: de'i ming ni sbrul mgo can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i ming ni sbrul mgo can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is called the “snake-head” because it is shaped like a snake’s head.

original: de bcad na dri mi tshor zhing sna'i dbang po nyams par byed do //🔽mig gnyis kyi ni phyi rol mtshams //
analyzed: de bcad na dri mi tshor zhing sna'i dbang po nyams par byed do // mig gnyis kyi ni phyi rol mtshams //
translated: If it is cut, one cannot smell and the nose faculty is impaired.🔽The “eye-corners” are located outside the eyes.🔽Below the end of the eyebrow,

original: smin ma skyes pa'i mtha' yi 'og / mig zur smin steng dma' bar gnas //🔽'khyil pa phug pas long bar 'gyur //
analyzed: smin ma skyes pa'i mtha' yi 'og / mig zur smin steng dma' bar gnas // 'khyil pa phug pas long bar 'gyur //
translated: the “eye-corners” are below the eyebrows.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The “coiled” is a channel-knot.🔽The “eye-corners” are located outside the eyes, at the edge of the eye sockets.

original: mig gnyis kyi phyi rol mur 'gram gyi phyogs kyi mtshams smin ma skyes pa'i rgyun chad pa'i mtha' 'og nas mig zur zhes bya ba'i rtsa'i gnad yod do //🔽de bzhin du smin ma'i steng na dma' zhing lcong ba la 'khyil pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
analyzed: mig gnyis kyi phyi rol mur 'gram gyi phyogs kyi mtshams smin ma skyes pa'i rgyun chad pa'i mtha' 'og nas mig zur zhes bya ba'i rtsa'i gnad yod do //🔽de bzhin du smin ma'i steng na dma' zhing lcong ba la 'khyil pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
translated: The “coiled” is a channel-knot located above the eyebrows, low and coiled.

original: mig zur dang 'khyil pa zhes bya ba ni gnad bzhi po de dag phug na skyes bu long bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig zur dang 'khyil pa zhes bya ba ni gnad bzhi po de dag phug na skyes bu long bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The so-called “eye-corners” and “twisting” are the four vital points that, if pierced, will cause a person to go blind.

original: rna mchan dpral ba'i mtha' na ni //🔽mur 'gram zhes bya 'phral 'chi byed //
analyzed: rna mchan dpral ba'i mtha' na ni // mur 'gram zhes bya 'phral 'chi byed //
translated: In the middle of the ear-lobes and the forehead

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: are the so-called “cheek-bones” that cause immediate death.

original: rna ba'i mchan dang dpral ba'i mtha' bar na mur 'gram zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis yod de ;
analyzed: rna ba'i mchan dang dpral ba'i mtha' bar na mur 'gram zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis yod de ;
translated: In the middle of the ear-lobes and the forehead are two vital points called “cheek-bones.”

original: de phug na skyes bu de 'phral la 'chi zhing myur du dus byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phug na skyes bu de 'phral la 'chi zhing myur du dus byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are pierced, the person will die immediately and quickly meet with death.

original: mur 'gram gnyis steng skra mtshams na //
analyzed: mur 'gram gnyis steng skra mtshams na //
translated: Above the two cheek-bones, at the hairline,

original: gdeg pa zhes bya gzhag bya yang //
analyzed: gdeg pa zhes bya gzhag bya yang //
translated: are the so-called “protruding” vital points that should be avoided.

original: smin mtshams bar gnas gsum char la'ang //
analyzed: smin mtshams bar gnas gsum char la'ang //
translated: In the middle of the eyebrows, in all three places,

original: zug rngu dag ni ma phyung zhing //
analyzed: zug rngu dag ni ma phyung zhing //
translated: are the so-called “splinters” that should not be removed.

original: smin nas rang nyid byung na 'tsho //
analyzed: smin nas rang nyid byung na 'tsho //
translated: If they ripen and come out on their own, one will live.

original: phyung na 'phral du 'chi bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyung na 'phral du 'chi bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they are removed, one will die immediately.

original: mur 'gram gnyis kyi steng ma ltag skra mtshams kyi steng na gdeg pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod la /
analyzed: mur 'gram gnyis kyi steng ma ltag skra mtshams kyi steng na gdeg pa zhes bya ba'i gnad yod la /
translated: Above the two cheek-bones, at the hairline, there is a vital point called “protruding.”

original: yang gzhag par bya ba'i gnad ni smin mtshams kyi bar na yod de /
analyzed: yang gzhag par bya ba'i gnad ni smin mtshams kyi bar na yod de /
translated: The vital point to be placed is between the eyebrows.

original: gdeg pa gnyis po dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gdeg pa gnyis po dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is endowed with two wings.

original: gnad gsum char la @53b mtshon gyi zug rngus zug na /
analyzed: gnad gsum char la @53b mtshon gyi zug rngus zug na /
translated: If the three vital points are pierced by the pain of a weapon,🔽until that is removed, at another time, when the vital point ripens, one will be born and live.

original: de ma phyung bar dus gzhan zhig na smin nas rang nyid byung bar gyur na 'tsho bar 'gyur gyi zug de phyung na skyes bu de 'phral du 'chi bar 'gyur ro //🔽lce mig sna dang rna ba yi //
analyzed: de ma phyung bar dus gzhan zhig na smin nas rang nyid byung bar gyur na 'tsho bar 'gyur gyi zug de phyung na skyes bu de 'phral du 'chi bar 'gyur ro // lce mig sna dang rna ba yi //
translated: If that pain is removed, that person will die immediately.🔽The four openings of the tongue, eyes, nose, and ears

original: bu ga bzhi ni 'dus ba dag / rkan dang sgo ru kha bzhi ste //
analyzed: bu ga bzhi ni 'dus ba dag / rkan dang sgo ru kha bzhi ste //
translated: are gathered together at the palate and the mouth.

original: bu ga'i gnad ni de rnams kyi ;
analyzed: bu ga'i gnad ni de rnams kyi ;
translated: The vital point of the openings is those.

original: / gnad ni sum mdo ris zhes bya //🔽de bcad srog ni 'phral du 'dor //
analyzed: / gnad ni sum mdo ris zhes bya // de bcad srog ni 'phral du 'dor //
translated: The vital point is called the “triangular channel.”

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: When that is severed, the life force is immediately cast off.

original: lce dang mig dang sna dang rna ba'i bu ga ste /
analyzed: lce dang mig dang sna dang rna ba'i bu ga ste /
translated: With regard to the four openings of the tongue, eyes, nose, and ears,

original: rtsa sgo bzhi po 'du zhing 'phrad par gyur ba dag / rkan gyi phyogs su kha bzhi par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du bu ga dang 'brel ba'i gnad ni sum mdo ris zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtsa sgo bzhi po 'du zhing 'phrad par gyur ba dag / rkan gyi phyogs su kha bzhi par gnas pa dang / de bzhin du bu ga dang 'brel ba'i gnad ni sum mdo ris zhes bya ste /
translated: Similarly, the vital points connected with the orifices are the so-called “triangular points.”

original: gnad de rnams bcad na skyes bu'i srog 'phral du 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnad de rnams bcad na skyes bu'i srog 'phral du 'dor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If these vital points are damaged, a person’s life will be immediately lost.

original: thod pa yi ni mtshams lnga po //
analyzed: thod pa yi ni mtshams lnga po //
translated: The five sutures of the skull🔽are the vital points called “the ends of the sutures.”

original: thad ka gyen 'gro mtshams kyi mtha' //🔽de snad pas ni mgo 'khor dang // smyo zhing dran pa nyams te 'chi //
analyzed: thad ka gyen 'gro mtshams kyi mtha' // de snad pas ni mgo 'khor dang // smyo zhing dran pa nyams te 'chi //
translated: They are located in the horizontal and upward directions.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: If these ends of the sutures are damaged, a person will die from dizziness, insanity, and loss of memory.

original: mgo bo'i thod pa'i mtshams lnga po ni /
analyzed: mgo bo'i thod pa'i mtshams lnga po ni /
translated: The five sutures of the skull

original: mtshams kyi mtha' zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
analyzed: mtshams kyi mtha' zhes bya ba'i gnad yod de /
translated: are the vital points called “the ends of the sutures.”

original: de thad ka dang gyen du 'gro bas gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de thad ka dang gyen du 'gro bas gnas pa yin la /
translated: They are located in the horizontal and upward directions.

original: mtshams kyi mtha'i gnad de rnams snad bas ni mgo 'khor ba dang / smyo zhing dran pa nyams pa'i nad kyis skyes bu 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams kyi mtha'i gnad de rnams snad bas ni mgo 'khor ba dang / smyo zhing dran pa nyams pa'i nad kyis skyes bu 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If these ends of the sutures are damaged, a person will die from dizziness, insanity, and loss of memory.

original: spyi bo'i steng na gtsug 'khyil ba'i //
analyzed: spyi bo'i steng na gtsug 'khyil ba'i //
translated: Above the crown of the head is the “coiled hair.”

original: rtsa dang ldan sbubs 'dus pa na //🔽spu 'khyil bdag po zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: rtsa dang ldan sbubs 'dus pa na // spu 'khyil bdag po zhes bya ba'i //
translated: at the place of the coiled hair,

original: gnad kyis srog ni 'jig par byed //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gnad kyis srog ni 'jig par byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: the vital force is destroyed by the vital point called the lord.

original: mgo bo'i steng gi gtsug rtsa 'khyil pa'i mtshams 'dus pa spu 'khyil ba'i gnas kyi gnad ni ming bdag po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mgo bo'i steng gi gtsug rtsa 'khyil pa'i mtshams 'dus pa spu 'khyil ba'i gnas kyi gnad ni ming bdag po zhes bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the vital point of the place of the coiled hair is the vital point called the lord, where the channel of the crown of the head above the head meets at the place of the coiled hair.

original: gnad de bcom pa na srog 'phral du 'jig cing 'dor bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: gnad de bcom pa na srog 'phral du 'jig cing 'dor bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: When that vital point is struck, the vital force is immediately destroyed and lost.

original: / gang du mnan na shin tu 'gul //
analyzed: / gang du mnan na shin tu 'gul //
translated: Where it shakes violently when pressed,

original: rab na de ni gnad ces bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab na de ni gnad ces bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: that is called a vital point.

original: 'di ni yang gnad rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni yang gnad rnams kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the general characteristic of the vital points.

original: lus kyi phyogs gang du mnan na shin tu 'gul zhing 'phar ba dang / yang de bzhin du mnan par gyur na mi bzod par na ba de ni gnad yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi phyogs gang du mnan na shin tu 'gul zhing 'phar ba dang / yang de bzhin du mnan par gyur na mi bzod par na ba de ni gnad yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: When any part of the body is pressed and it shakes violently and when it is pressed again in the same way, it is known to be a vital point because it is painful.🔽Where there is a gathering of flesh, sinew, bone, large channels,

original: sha rgyus rus pa rtsa chen dang // rtsa dang tshigs ni 'dus pa ru //
analyzed: sha rgyus rus pa rtsa chen dang // rtsa dang tshigs ni 'dus pa ru //
translated: channels, and joints,

original: gnad ces bya ste des na der //
analyzed: gnad ces bya ste des na der //
translated: that is called a vital point.

original: srog ni lhag par gnas pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: srog ni lhag par gnas pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Life is especially located in the vital parts.🔽The vital parts are the joints, etc.🔽The vital parts are the joints, etc.🔽, which are the collection and combination of flesh, etc.

original: sha la sogs pa nas tshigs kyi bar rang rang gi rigs mthun pa la ltos pa 'dus shing phrad par gyur pa de ni gnad ces @54a * //
analyzed: sha la sogs pa nas tshigs kyi bar rang rang gi rigs mthun pa la ltos pa 'dus shing phrad par gyur pa de ni gnad ces @54a * //
translated: , that are similar in type.

original: bya ste / de ni na zhing mi bde bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ste / de ni na zhing mi bde bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They are called vital parts because they are the cause of pain and discomfort.

original: rgyu des na gnad rnams su srog lhag par gnas pa yin pas der gnod pa byas pas srog la lhag par gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu des na gnad rnams su srog lhag par gnas pa yin pas der gnod pa byas pas srog la lhag par gnod pa yin no //
translated: Since life is especially located in the vital parts, it is especially harmed when they are harmed.

original: mang du rnam par bstan mod kyi //
analyzed: mang du rnam par bstan mod kyi //
translated: Although they are taught in many ways,

original: gnad ni rnam pa drug tu bstan //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnad ni rnam pa drug tu bstan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the vital parts are taught as being of six types.

original: gnad grangs mang du bstan mod kyi sha la sogs pa la gnas pa'i rnam pa 'dis gnad kyi grangs ni rnam pa drug kho nar bstan pa yin no //🔽srog gi gnas su thun mong pas //🔽gnad ni gcig tu gnas pa'ang yin //
analyzed: gnad grangs mang du bstan mod kyi sha la sogs pa la gnas pa'i rnam pa 'dis gnad kyi grangs ni rnam pa drug kho nar bstan pa yin no // srog gi gnas su thun mong pas // gnad ni gcig tu gnas pa'ang yin //
translated: Although the vital parts are taught in many ways, they are taught as being of six types by this classification of the vital parts that are located in the flesh, etc.🔽The vital parts are also taught as being one,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: since they are common as the location of life.

original: yang na gnad ni drug tu yang rnam par mi dbye'i /
analyzed: yang na gnad ni drug tu yang rnam par mi dbye'i /
translated: Or the vital parts are not classified as six.

original: gzhan du na srog gi gnas yin pa'i mtshan nyid du gcig pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan du na srog gi gnas yin pa'i mtshan nyid du gcig pa'am /
translated: Otherwise, since the vital parts are the same in being the basis of life,

original: thun mong yin pas gnad ni gcig kho nar bstan gyi /
analyzed: thun mong yin pas gnad ni gcig kho nar bstan gyi /
translated: they are taught as only one vital part,

original: drug tu rnam par mi gzhag go //🔽shar gtogs bcu ste byin lag nyva //
analyzed: drug tu rnam par mi gzhag go // shar gtogs bcu ste byin lag nyva //
translated: not as six.

original: mthil 'phrog nu 'jing nu rtsa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthil 'phrog nu 'jing nu rtsa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ten on the right side are the two shoulders, two upper arms,🔽two palms, two groins, two thighs, and two knees.

original: gnad la sha'i rigs su gtogs pa'i gnad ni bcu ste /🔽de gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnad la sha'i rigs su gtogs pa'i gnad ni bcu ste / de gang zhe na /
translated: The ten vital parts that belong to the flesh are

original: byin snying dang lag ngar gyi sha'i gnad dbang po'i chu so zhes bya ba bzhi dang / mthil 'phrog pa zhes bya ba bzhi dang / nu 'jing dang nu rtse gnyis te bcu yin no //🔽rus pa'i gnad brgyad mur 'gram dang // rked pa can dang gzhon nu dang // ro smad dang ni sog pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byin snying dang lag ngar gyi sha'i gnad dbang po'i chu so zhes bya ba bzhi dang / mthil 'phrog pa zhes bya ba bzhi dang / nu 'jing dang nu rtse gnyis te bcu yin no // rus pa'i gnad brgyad mur 'gram dang // rked pa can dang gzhon nu dang // ro smad dang ni sog pa'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the two shoulders, two upper arms, two palms, two groins, two thighs, and two knees.

original: rus pa la gnad brgyad yod de /
analyzed: rus pa la gnad brgyad yod de /
translated: The eight vital parts that belong to the bones are🔽the two collar bones, two ribs, two pelvic bones, and two thigh bones.

original: mur 'gram gyi gnad gnyis dang / rked pa can dang gzhon nu zhes bya ba gnyis dang / ro smad ces bya ba gnyis dang / sog pa zhes bya ba gnyis te brgyad yod do //
analyzed: mur 'gram gyi gnad gnyis dang / rked pa can dang gzhon nu zhes bya ba gnyis dang / ro smad ces bya ba gnyis dang / sog pa zhes bya ba gnyis te brgyad yod do //
translated: There are two vital points at the temples, two called “waist” and “youth,” two called “lower torso,” and two called “spine,” making eight.

original: rgyus ba'i gnad ni nyi shu gsum //
analyzed: rgyus ba'i gnad ni nyi shu gsum //
translated: There are twenty-three ligament vital points.🔽There are four vital points above the collarbone,

original: gnyan gong zhes bya'i pir dang ni //
analyzed: gnyan gong zhes bya'i pir dang ni //
translated: two “bow” points above the elbows,🔽four “bow tip” points, two “eye corner” points,

original: pir mgo mig zur rgya tshigs dang // phrag pa gzhag dang chu so yi //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽rgyus ba'i gnad ni nyi shu rtsa gsum ste /
analyzed: pir mgo mig zur rgya tshigs dang // phrag pa gzhag dang chu so yi // zhes bya ba la / rgyus ba'i gnad ni nyi shu rtsa gsum ste /
translated: four “finger joint” points, two shoulders,🔽two “settling” points, and two “bladder” points.

original: gnyan gong gi gnad bzhi dang / gru mo'i gong gnyis kyi pir zhes bya ba bzhi dang / pir mgo zhes bya ba bzhi dang / mig zur gyi gnad gnyis dang / rgya tshigs bzhi dang / phrag pa gnyis dang / gzhag ces bya ba gnyis dang /🔽chu so zhes bya ba ste nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: gnyan gong gi gnad bzhi dang / gru mo'i gong gnyis kyi pir zhes bya ba bzhi dang / pir mgo zhes bya ba bzhi dang / mig zur gyi gnad gnyis dang / rgya tshigs bzhi dang / phrag pa gnyis dang / gzhag ces bya ba gnyis dang / chu so zhes bya ba ste nyi shu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: There are twenty-three ligament vital points: four vital points above the collarbone, four called “bow” points above the two elbows, four called “bow tip” points, two “eye corner” points, four “finger joint” points, two shoulders, two called “settling” points, and two called “bladder” points.

original: rtsa chen gnad ni rnam dgu ste //
analyzed: rtsa chen gnad ni rnam dgu ste //
translated: There are nine major channel vital points.

original: gzhang dang rengs bral rna rtsa dang // sum mdo ris zhes bshad pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhang dang rengs bral rna rtsa dang // sum mdo ris zhes bshad pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The anus, the “free from stiffness,” the “ear-root,” and the “triangular” are explained.

original: rtsa chen po'i gnad ni rnam pa dgu yod par bshad de /
analyzed: rtsa chen po'i gnad ni rnam pa dgu yod par bshad de /
translated: It is explained that there are nine major channel-knots.

original: gzhang @54b zhes bya ba gcig dang / rengs bral zhes bya ba'i gnad dang gnyis /
analyzed: gzhang @54b zhes bya ba gcig dang / rengs bral zhes bya ba'i gnad dang gnyis /
translated: There is one called the “anus,” and the “free from stiffness” channel-knot,

original: rna rtsa zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis dang / sum mdo ris zhes bshad pa bzhi ste dgu'o //
analyzed: rna rtsa zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis dang / sum mdo ris zhes bshad pa bzhi ste dgu'o //
translated: two called the “ear-root” channel-knots, and the “triangular” channel-knot, making nine.

original: rtsa lag nas gnad sum cu bdun //
analyzed: rtsa lag nas gnad sum cu bdun //
translated: There are thirty-seven channel-knots in the limbs.

original: rtsa chen gnyis dang ma mo sngo //
analyzed: rtsa chen gnyis dang ma mo sngo //
translated: There are two major channels, the “blue mother,”

original: 'gram pa mchan khung 'dzin sbrul mgo //🔽ljon shing snying dang lte ba dang // rtsib logs mtshams dang nu ma'i 'og / mi gsal gzhag dang brla dbang dang // dmar po zhes bya bzhi bo'o //
analyzed: 'gram pa mchan khung 'dzin sbrul mgo // ljon shing snying dang lte ba dang // rtsib logs mtshams dang nu ma'i 'og / mi gsal gzhag dang brla dbang dang // dmar po zhes bya bzhi bo'o //
translated: the “cheek,” the “armpit,” the “snake-head,”

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: the “tree,” the “heart,” the “navel,” the “side,” the “joint,” the “under the breast,” the “unclear,” the “thigh,” the “lord,” and the four called the “red.”

original: rtsa la gnas pa'i gnad kyi bye brag ni sum cu rtsa bdun yod de /
analyzed: rtsa la gnas pa'i gnad kyi bye brag ni sum cu rtsa bdun yod de /
translated: It is explained that there are thirty-seven different channel-knots in the limbs.

original: rtsa bo che gnyis dang / ma mo brgyad dang / sngon po gnyis dang / 'gram pa'i rtsa gnyis dang / mchan khung 'dzin pa'i gnad gnyis dang / sbrul mgo gnyis dang / ljon shing gnyis dang / snying gi gnyis dang / lte ba'i gcig dang /
analyzed: rtsa bo che gnyis dang / ma mo brgyad dang / sngon po gnyis dang / 'gram pa'i rtsa gnyis dang / mchan khung 'dzin pa'i gnad gnyis dang / sbrul mgo gnyis dang / ljon shing gnyis dang / snying gi gnyis dang / lte ba'i gcig dang /
translated: The two large channels, the eight mothers, the two blue ones, the two cheek channels, the two key points of holding the armpits, the two snake heads, the two trees, the two of the heart, the one of the navel,

original: rtsib logs mtshams kyi gnyis dang / nu ma'i 'og gi gnyis dang / mi gsal ba zhes bya ba gnyis dang / gzhag pa gnyis dang / brla dbang gnyis dang / dmar po zhes bya ba bzhi'o //
analyzed: rtsib logs mtshams kyi gnyis dang / nu ma'i 'og gi gnyis dang / mi gsal ba zhes bya ba gnyis dang / gzhag pa gnyis dang / brla dbang gnyis dang / dmar po zhes bya ba bzhi'o //
translated: the two at the sides, the two under the breasts, the two called unclear, the two placements, the two thighs, and the four called red.

original: tshigs la nyi shu 'khyil ba dang // mkhrig ma gnyis dang khung bu dang // mtshams mtha' gru mo long mo dang // ltag pa pus mo bdag po'o //
analyzed: tshigs la nyi shu 'khyil ba dang // mkhrig ma gnyis dang khung bu dang // mtshams mtha' gru mo long mo dang // ltag pa pus mo bdag po'o //
translated: Twenty coils in the joints, the two wrists, the two elbows, the two shoulders, the two ends of the sides, the two wrists, the two ankles, the back of the neck, and the knees.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This has two parts:

original: tshigs la gnas pa'i gnad ni nyi shu ste 'khyil pa zhes bya pa'i gnad gnyis dang / mkhrig ma gnyis dang / khung bu zhes bya ba gnyis dang / mtshams kyi mtha' zhes bya ba lnga dang / gru mo'i gnad gnyis dang / long mo gnyis dang /
analyzed: tshigs la gnas pa'i gnad ni nyi shu ste 'khyil pa zhes bya pa'i gnad gnyis dang / mkhrig ma gnyis dang / khung bu zhes bya ba gnyis dang / mtshams kyi mtha' zhes bya ba lnga dang / gru mo'i gnad gnyis dang / long mo gnyis dang /
translated: The twenty vital points on the joints are the two vital points called “coiling,” the two wrists, the two called “cavity,” the five called “end of the boundary,” the two elbow vital points, the two ankles, and the two knees.

original: ltag pa'i gnyis dang / pus mo'i gnyis dang / bdag po zhes bya ba gcig ste nyi shu'o //
analyzed: ltag pa'i gnyis dang / pus mo'i gnyis dang / bdag po zhes bya ba gcig ste nyi shu'o //
translated: There are twenty vital points on the joints: two vital points called “coils,” two wrists, two vital points called “holes,” five vital points called “ends of the boundaries,” two vital points of the elbows, two ankles, two vital points of the back of the neck, two knees, and one vital point called “lord.”

original: gzhan dag gzhang sha'i gnad ces zer //
analyzed: gzhan dag gzhang sha'i gnad ces zer //
translated: Others say the vital point of the anus is a vital point of flesh.

original: mchan khung 'dzin dang ljon shing dang // rgyus pa la brten rna rtsa dang // sum mdo ris dang rengs bral dang // mig 'gram rtsa ni gnad yin te //
analyzed: mchan khung 'dzin dang ljon shing dang // rgyus pa la brten rna rtsa dang // sum mdo ris dang rengs bral dang // mig 'gram rtsa ni gnad yin te //
translated: The vital points are the armpits, the tree, the channel-base, the ear-root, the junction, the unfrozen, and the eye-corners.

original: rtsa chen gnas par de ma bshad //
analyzed: rtsa chen gnas par de ma bshad //
translated: They are not said to be the locations of the great channels.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Regarding this,

original: slob dpon gzhan dag ni gzhang gi gnad ni sha'i nang du gtogs pas rtsa bo che'i gnad ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan dag ni gzhang gi gnad ni sha'i nang du gtogs pas rtsa bo che'i gnad ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: other masters say that the vital point of the anus is not a vital point of the great channels because it is included within the flesh.

original: de bzhin du mchan khung 'dzin ba dang / ljon shing zhes bya ba'i gnad bzhi bo ni rgyus pa la brten pa'i gnad yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du mchan khung 'dzin ba dang / ljon shing zhes bya ba'i gnad bzhi bo ni rgyus pa la brten pa'i gnad yin gyi /
translated: Likewise, the four vital points called “holding the armpits” and “tree” are vital points based on tendons,

original: rtsa la gnas pa'i gnad ma yin no //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rtsa la gnas pa'i gnad ma yin no // zhes zer ro //
translated: not vital points located in the channels.

original: de bzhin du rna rtsa yang rtsa la gnas pa yin gyi rtsa bo che la gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna rtsa yang rtsa la gnas pa yin gyi rtsa bo che la gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, the channel of the ear is located in the channels, not in the great channel.

original: @55a * // sum mdo ris kyi gnad bzhi dang / rengs bral zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis dang / mig 'gram gyi gnad gnyis po dag ni rtsa'i gnad yin gyi rtsa bo che dang rgyus pa'i gnad ma yin no //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @55a * // sum mdo ris kyi gnad bzhi dang / rengs bral zhes bya ba'i gnad gnyis dang / mig 'gram gyi gnad gnyis po dag ni rtsa'i gnad yin gyi rtsa bo che dang rgyus pa'i gnad ma yin no // zhes zer ro //
translated: The four vital points of the fork in the three channels, the two vital points called “stiff and free,” and the two vital points of the eye sockets are vital points of the channels, not vital points of the great channel and the tendons.

original: de bas na de dag ni rtsa bo che la gnas par ma bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni rtsa bo che la gnas par ma bshad do //
translated: Therefore, they are not explained as being located in the great channel.

original: sha yi gnad bcad khrag rgyun 'dzag / sha bkrus 'drar 'gyur sla ba dang // skya zhing dbang po nyams pa dang // myur du 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sha yi gnad bcad khrag rgyun 'dzag / sha bkrus 'drar 'gyur sla ba dang // skya zhing dbang po nyams pa dang // myur du 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: When the flesh vital points are cut, blood flows, the flesh becomes like a washed corpse, and it is easy to die, pale, and with impaired senses.

original: shar gtogs shing gnas pa'i khrag gi rgyun 'dzag pa sha bkrus pa lta bur gyur pa dang / sla zhing rkyang rkyang por gyur pa dang / mdog skya ba dang / dbang po'i tshogs nyams pa dang / myur du 'chi ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shar gtogs shing gnas pa'i khrag gi rgyun 'dzag pa sha bkrus pa lta bur gyur pa dang / sla zhing rkyang rkyang por gyur pa dang / mdog skya ba dang / dbang po'i tshogs nyams pa dang / myur du 'chi ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: The blood-stream is cut off, the body becomes pale, the sense-organs are impaired, and death is certain.

original: rus gnas gnad bcad rkang bcas na //
analyzed: rus gnas gnad bcad rkang bcas na //
translated: When the vital parts in the bones are hit,

original: sla dang bar bar chad cing 'dzag / ces bya ba la /🔽rus pa la gnas pa'i gnad bcad na rkang dang bcas pa'i khrag 'dzag pa dang / shin tu na ba dang / sla zhing dangs pa dang / bar bar du rgyun chad cing 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sla dang bar bar chad cing 'dzag / ces bya ba la / rus pa la gnas pa'i gnad bcad na rkang dang bcas pa'i khrag 'dzag pa dang / shin tu na ba dang / sla zhing dangs pa dang / bar bar du rgyun chad cing 'dzag par 'gyur ro //
translated: the blood flows with the marrow,🔽it is very painful, the body becomes soft and flabby, and the blood flows intermittently.🔽When the vital parts in the muscles are hit,

original: rgyus pa'i gnad bcad na zhing 'khrug / brkyang bskum mi shes gnod par 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyus pa'i gnad bcad na zhing 'khrug / brkyang bskum mi shes gnod par 'gyur //
translated: the body is agitated, one cannot stretch or bend the limbs,

original: 'gro dang stan gnas nus pa chung //🔽dbang po nyams pa'am 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'gro dang stan gnas nus pa chung // dbang po nyams pa'am 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: and one is unable to sit or lie down.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The sense-organs are impaired, or one dies.

original: rgyus par gnas pa'i gnad bcad na /
analyzed: rgyus par gnas pa'i gnad bcad na /
translated: When the vital parts in the tendons are hit,

original: na zhing kun tu shas cher 'khrugs pa dang / brkyang ba dang bskum mi shes pa'i rlung nad kyi gnod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na zhing kun tu shas cher 'khrugs pa dang / brkyang ba dang bskum mi shes pa'i rlung nad kyi gnod pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: There will be the harm of a wind disease that causes pain and great agitation all over, and one will not know how to stretch out or bend a limb.

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba la sogs pa la yang nus pa chung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba la sogs pa la yang nus pa chung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Similarly, one will have little ability to move about and so forth.

original: 'gro ba ni 'gro zhing bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'gro zhing bskyod pa'o //
translated: “Moving about” is going and moving around.

original: gnas pa ni sngon pa'am stan la 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni sngon pa'am stan la 'dug pa ste /
translated: “Staying” is sitting on a seat or the ground.

original: de dag mi nus par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de dag mi nus par gyur pa'am /
translated: One will be unable to do those.

original: yang na dbang po nyams shing mi gsal ba'am /
analyzed: yang na dbang po nyams shing mi gsal ba'am /
translated: Or, the faculties will be impaired and unclear,

original: srog dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: or one will lose one’s life.

original: rtsa chen gnad bcad lbu ba dang // sgra bcas 'byung zhing dran nyams 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsa chen gnad bcad lbu ba dang // sgra bcas 'byung zhing dran nyams 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If a vital point of a major channel is cut, there will be blood, foam, and sound, and memory will fail.

original: rtsa bo che la gnas pa'i gnad bcad na khrag lbu ba dang sgra dang bcas pa 'byung zhing dran ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa bo che la gnas pa'i gnad bcad na khrag lbu ba dang sgra dang bcas pa 'byung zhing dran ba nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If a vital point of a major channel is cut, there will be blood, foam, and sound, and memory will fail.

original: rtsa yi gnad bcad khrag ska zhing //
analyzed: rtsa yi gnad bcad khrag ska zhing //
translated: If a vital point of a channel is cut, there will be blood,

original: rgyun mi 'chad par mang du 'byung //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par mang du 'byung //
translated: and it will flow continuously in large quantities.

original: de zad mgo 'khor dbugs mi bde //
analyzed: de zad mgo 'khor dbugs mi bde //
translated: When that is exhausted, there will be dizziness, shortness of breath,🔽and death.

original: skom rmongs skyigs bus 'debs pas 'chi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skom rmongs skyigs bus 'debs pas 'chi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: He dies from thirst, his throat parched.

original: rtsa la gnas pa'i gnad bcad na khrag ska bar 'byung ba dang / rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba dang / @55b mang du 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtsa la gnas pa'i gnad bcad na khrag ska bar 'byung ba dang / rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba dang / @55b mang du 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: When the vital points located in the channels are severed, blood appears pale, appears without interruption, and appears in large quantities.

original: des na khrag de zad pas mgo 'khor ba la sogs pas 'chi bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na khrag de zad pas mgo 'khor ba la sogs pas 'chi bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because of the exhaustion of that blood, he dies from giddiness and so forth.

original: lus ni gra ma lta bus khyab //
analyzed: lus ni gra ma lta bus khyab //
translated: The body is covered with scabs.

original: 'tshob kyang sgur po'am 'thing por 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'tshob kyang sgur po'am 'thing por 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even when healed, it becomes bent or lame.

original: skyes bu de'i lus nas kyi gra ma lta bus khyab par snang ba dang / rma de 'tshob cing 'byor par gyur na yang lus sgur ba dang yan lag 'jas shing 'theng por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu de'i lus nas kyi gra ma lta bus khyab par snang ba dang / rma de 'tshob cing 'byor par gyur na yang lus sgur ba dang yan lag 'jas shing 'theng por 'gyur ro //
translated: When the vital points located in the flesh are severed, the body of that person appears covered with scabs, and even when the wounds are healed and restored, the body becomes bent and the limbs become stiff and lame.

original: tshigs gnad stobs dang spyod pa nyams //
analyzed: tshigs gnad stobs dang spyod pa nyams //
translated: The vital points of the joints are weakened and the movements are impaired.

original: lus skem tshigs ni skrang bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus skem tshigs ni skrang bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: The body becomes emaciated and the joints swell.🔽When the vital points located in the joints are severed, the body becomes emaciated and the joints swell.

original: tshigs la gnas pa'i gnad bcad na stobs zad ba dang / lus kyi g-yo 'gul gyi spyod pa nyams pa dang / lus kun skem zhing sbeg pa dang / tshigs kyi tshogs rnams skrang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshigs la gnas pa'i gnad bcad na stobs zad ba dang / lus kyi g-yo 'gul gyi spyod pa nyams pa dang / lus kun skem zhing sbeg pa dang / tshigs kyi tshogs rnams skrang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the vital points in the joints are hit, one’s strength is exhausted, one’s physical movements are impaired, one’s whole body becomes emaciated and swollen, and the joints become swollen.

original: lte ba mur 'gram bdag po gzhang //
analyzed: lte ba mur 'gram bdag po gzhang //
translated: The navel, the temples, and the master of the self are the cavities.

original: snying dang chu so sum mdo ris //
analyzed: snying dang chu so sum mdo ris //
translated: The heart, the kidneys, and the three channels are the shapes.

original: ma mo brgyad dang bcas dgu po //
analyzed: ma mo brgyad dang bcas dgu po //
translated: The eight mothers and the nine are

original: 'phral du srog ni gcod par byed //
analyzed: 'phral du srog ni gcod par byed //
translated: the immediate killers.

original: de rnams 'phral du mi 'chi yang //
analyzed: de rnams 'phral du mi 'chi yang //
translated: Even if they do not die immediately,

original: zhag bdun gyis ni nges par 'chi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhag bdun gyis ni nges par 'chi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: they will certainly die within seven days.

original: lte ba dang mur 'gram la sogs pa'i gnad bcu dgu phug cing bcad na 'phral du de'i mod la 'chi zhing gsod par byed la /
analyzed: lte ba dang mur 'gram la sogs pa'i gnad bcu dgu phug cing bcad na 'phral du de'i mod la 'chi zhing gsod par byed la /
translated: If the nineteen vital points, such as the navel and the temples, are pierced and hit, one will die and be killed immediately.

original: gal te tshe'i lhag ma yod na yang zhabs bdun gyis nges par 'chi'o //
analyzed: gal te tshe'i lhag ma yod na yang zhabs bdun gyis nges par 'chi'o //
translated: If one has any remaining life, one will certainly die within seven days.

original: de las lhag par ni nges par mi 'tsho'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par ni nges par mi 'tsho'o //
translated: Beyond that, one will certainly not live.

original: rengs bral mthil 'phrog rtsib logs mtshams //
analyzed: rengs bral mthil 'phrog rtsib logs mtshams //
translated: The stiffening, the separation, the palm-stealing, and the side-joint

original: rked pa can gzhon mtshams kyi mtha' //
analyzed: rked pa can gzhon mtshams kyi mtha' //
translated: The waist is the boundary of the young.

analyzed: snad pa ni 'phral du 'chi bar mi byed na yang zla ba phyed dam zla ba gcig gis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ci'i phyir zug rngu phyung bas 'chi zhes bya /

original: de zug rngu phyung yang rlung byung ste /
analyzed: de zug rngu phyung yang rlung byung ste /
translated: Even if the vital parts are not pierced, the wind may arise and

translated: cause a cough and dyspnea that will destroy life.

translated: The vital parts are the head, the eyes, the corners of the eyes, the ears, the throat, the neck, the shoulders, the armpits, the arms, the hands, the chest, the nipples, the sides, the belly, the navel, the groin, the thighs, the knees, the calves, the feet, the anus, the penis, the lips, the gums, the nose, the cheeks, the forehead, the temples, the joints of the skull, the joints of the fingers and toes, the joints of the arms and legs, the joints of the neck, the joints of the back, the joints of the ribs, the joints of the shoulders, the joints of the jaw, the joints of the skull, the joints of the fingers and toes, the joints of the arms and legs, the joints of the neck, the joints of the back, the joints of the ribs, the joints of the shoulders, the joints of the jaw, the joints of the skull, the joints of the fingers and toes, the joints of the arms and legs, the joints of the neck, the joints of the back, the joints of the ribs, the joints of the shoulders, the joints of the jaw, the joints of the skull, the joints of the fingers and toes, the joints of the arms and legs, the joints of the neck, the joints of the back, the joints of the ribs, the joints of the shoulders, the joints of the jaw, the joints of the skull, the joints of the fingers and toes, the joints of the arms and legs, the joints of the neck, the joints of the back, the joints of the ribs, the joints of the shoulders, the joints of the jaw, the joints of the skull, the joints of the fingers and toes, the joints of the arms and legs, the joints of the neck, the joints of the back, the joints of the ribs, the joints of the shoulders, the joints of the jaw, the joints of the skull, the joints of the fingers and toes, the joints of the arms

analyzed: des ni srog kyang 'joms par byed // ces bya ba la /

analyzed: sbrul mgo la sogs pa'i gnad bzhi bcu rtsa bzhi snad pas ni /

analyzed: pir mgo 'dra dang long mo dang // mkhrig ma'i gnad brgyad nad tshabs skyed // ces bya ba la /

analyzed: pir mgo 'dra ba la sogs pa'i gnad brgyad po phug pas ni shin tu nang tshabs chen po skyed par 'gyur ba yin no //

original: de las ljon shing mchan khung 'dzin //
analyzed: de las ljon shing mchan khung 'dzin //

original: brla dang pir mgo lta bu ste //
analyzed: brla dang pir mgo lta bu ste //

original: bcu gnyis sor gcig tshad yin no //
analyzed: bcu gnyis sor gcig tshad yin no //

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

analyzed: gnad de rnams las ljon shing la sogs pa gnad bcu gnyis kyi tshad ni rang gi sor tshad kyi sor gcig gi tshad du gnas pa yin no //

analyzed: mkhrig ma dang ni long mo dang // nu ma'i rtsa ba sor gnyis tshad // ces bya ba la /

analyzed: gnad de rnams la mkhrig ma'i gnad gnyis dang / long mo'i gnad gnyis dang / nu ma'i gnad gnyis te /

analyzed: gnad drug po de dag gi tshad ni sor gnyis su gnad pa yin no //
translated: are the measure of six vital points.

original: pus mo gru mo sor gsum tshad ;🔽/ ces bya ba la /
analyzed: pus mo gru mo sor gsum tshad ; / ces bya ba la /

original: gzhang dang chu so lte ba snying //
analyzed: gzhang dang chu so lte ba snying //
translated: The anus, bladder, navel, and heart🔽are the measure of five finger widths.🔽The blue, the end of the boundary, the female,

analyzed: sngon po mtshams mtha' ma mo dang // pir 'dra sum mdo ris 'gram pa //

analyzed: gnad ni nyi shu rtsa dgu'i tshad //

original: rang gi lag mthil @56b tshad yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang gi lag mthil @56b tshad yin no //🔽zhes bya ba la /

original: gzhang kha la sogs pa'i gnad kyi khyad par nyi shu rtsa dgu rang gi lag mthil tsam gyi tshad du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhang kha la sogs pa'i gnad kyi khyad par nyi shu rtsa dgu rang gi lag mthil tsam gyi tshad du gnas pa yin no //
translated: The twenty-nine special vital points such as the anus are the size of one's palm.🔽The remaining vital points are

analyzed: lhag ma gnad ni lnga bcu drug / sor phyed kyi ni tshad du 'dod // ces bya ba la /

analyzed: de ltar tshad bshad pa'i gnad kyi lhag ma tshad ma bshad pa dag ni lhag ma yin la /

original: de dag ni grangs lnga bcu rtsa drug yod de /
analyzed: de dag ni grangs lnga bcu rtsa drug yod de /

analyzed: de dag gi tshad ni rang gi sor phyed yod par 'dod do // gzhan dag gnad de til 'bru ste //

analyzed: 'bras tsam gyi ni tshad du 'dod // ces bya ba la /
translated: Other doctors assert that the vital points are the size of a sesame seed.🔽Others assert that they are the size of a grain.

analyzed: sman pa gzhan dag ni gnad de dag til 'bru tsam gyi tshad du gnas par 'dod la / gzhan dag ni 'bras tsam gyi tshad du yod do //
translated: Other doctors assert that the vital points are the size of a sesame seed.

original: zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that they are the size of a grain.

original: rtsa bzhir bshad pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: rtsa bzhir bshad pa gang yin pa //
translated: The four channels that have been explained

original: lus kun brtas par byed ba rnams //
analyzed: lus kun brtas par byed ba rnams //
translated: are the ones that nourish the whole body.

original: de ni gnad la gnas pa yin //
analyzed: de ni gnad la gnas pa yin //
translated: They are the vital points.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the statement,

original: sngar gang rtsa bzhi por rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan 'dres pa dang / nad med pa ste rtsa bzhi po grangs bdun brgya yod par sngar bshad la /
analyzed: sngar gang rtsa bzhi por rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan 'dres pa dang / nad med pa ste rtsa bzhi po grangs bdun brgya yod par sngar bshad la /
translated: previously it was explained that there are seven hundred channels, which are the four root channels, the mixed wind, bile, and phlegm, and the one without illness.

original: gang yin pa des ni lus ma lus pa thams cad la brtas shing tshim par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yin pa des ni lus ma lus pa thams cad la brtas shing tshim par byed pa yin te /
translated: By those, the entire body is nourished and satisfied.

original: de dag thams cad kyang gnad la gnas shing brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang gnad la gnas shing brtan pa yin no //
translated: All of those are stable and located at the vital points.

original: des na de phug khrag drag 'byung //
analyzed: des na de phug khrag drag 'byung //
translated: Therefore, if they are pierced, blood will gush forth.

original: lus zungs rnams ni zad pa'i phyir //🔽rlung 'phel nad ni mi bzad 'debs //
analyzed: lus zungs rnams ni zad pa'i phyir // rlung 'phel nad ni mi bzad 'debs //
translated: Because the body constituents are exhausted,🔽the winds increase and unbearable illnesses are inflicted.

original: rlung gis mkhris pa rgyas par byed //
analyzed: rlung gis mkhris pa rgyas par byed //
translated: The winds cause the bile to increase.

original: mkhris pa rgyas par gyur bas na //
analyzed: mkhris pa rgyas par gyur bas na //
translated: Because the bile increases,

original: skom dang mgo 'khor skam dang myos //
analyzed: skom dang mgo 'khor skam dang myos //
translated: there is thirst, dizziness, dryness, and insanity.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the statement,

original: gang gi phyir rtsa thams cad gnad la gnas pa yin pa'i rgyu des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtsa thams cad gnad la gnas pa yin pa'i rgyu des na /
translated: because all the channels are located at the vital points,

original: rtsa de phug cing khrag drag tu phyung zhing shas cher brten na des na lus zungs bdun po rnams zad par byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rtsa de phug cing khrag drag tu phyung zhing shas cher brten na des na lus zungs bdun po rnams zad par byed par 'gyur la /
