original: lus zungs de zad pas rlung nad skye zhing 'phel ba'i gnas skabs su gyur nas mi bzad pa'i nad kyis 'debs shing na ba dang / gzer ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba de skye zhing 'debs la /
analyzed: lus zungs de zad pas rlung nad skye zhing 'phel ba'i gnas skabs su gyur nas mi bzad pa'i nad kyis 'debs shing na ba dang / gzer ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba de skye zhing 'debs la /
translated: When those bodily constituents are exhausted, the condition of the arising and increasing of the wind illness occurs, and the unbearable illness is contracted, and the feeling of pain, piercing, and so forth arises and is contracted.

original: yang rlung de mkhris pa'i tshogs kyi nad rgyas shing 'phel bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang rlung de mkhris pa'i tshogs kyi nad rgyas shing 'phel bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, that wind causes the illness of the collection of bile to increase and grow.

original: mkhris pa des rgyas shing bdo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhris pa des rgyas shing bdo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That bile increases and grows.

original: skom dad dang mgo 'khor ba dang / kha skams pa dang / myos pa'i nad skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skom dad dang mgo 'khor ba dang / kha skams pa dang / myos pa'i nad skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thirst, dizziness, dry mouth, and the illness of intoxication arise.🔽The body sweats, the joints separate, the body relaxes,

original: lus rngul tshigs 'bye lus lhod dang // de ni gshin rje'i dbang du 'gro //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus rngul tshigs 'bye lus lhod dang // de ni gshin rje'i dbang du 'gro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and one goes under the power of the Lord of Death.🔽With respect to that,

original: des na gnad du @57a * //
analyzed: des na gnad du @57a * //
translated: the vital point is that

original: phug cing snad pa'i skyes bu de lus rdul zhing tshigs 'bye ba dang / lus lhod cing shig shig por gyur bas /
analyzed: phug cing snad pa'i skyes bu de lus rdul zhing tshigs 'bye ba dang / lus lhod cing shig shig por gyur bas /
translated: The person who is pierced and wounded has a body that is dusty and dirty, and his body is loose and flabby.

original: de gshin rje'i dbang du 'gro zhing 'chi bar 'gyur ro //🔽gnad gcod na ni myur ba ru //
analyzed: de gshin rje'i dbang du 'gro zhing 'chi bar 'gyur ro // gnad gcod na ni myur ba ru //
translated: He goes under the control of the Lord of Death and dies.🔽When the vital points are cut,

original: lus kyi tshigs ni chod 'gyur te //
analyzed: lus kyi tshigs ni chod 'gyur te //
translated: the joints of the body are quickly cut and wounded.

original: tshigs kyi phyogs su bcad pas na //
analyzed: tshigs kyi phyogs su bcad pas na //
translated: Because they are cut in the direction of the joints,

original: rtsa ni 'khums par byed pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsa ni 'khums par byed pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the channels are constricted.

original: gnad gcod cing snad par gyur ba na myur ba nyid du lus kyi rkang pa dang lag pa la sogs pa'i tshigs chod cing snad bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gnad gcod cing snad par gyur ba na myur ba nyid du lus kyi rkang pa dang lag pa la sogs pa'i tshigs chod cing snad bar 'gyur /
translated: When the vital points are cut and wounded, the joints of the body, such as the legs and arms, are quickly cut and wounded.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽tshigs kyi phyogs su bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / tshigs kyi phyogs su bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because they are cut in the direction of the joints, all the channels are constricted and cut.🔽In that regard, the life of living beings

original: rtsa thams cad kyang 'khums shing gcod par byed pa yin no de la srog chags rnams kyi srog / khrag gnas na ni gnas pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsa thams cad kyang 'khums shing gcod par byed pa yin no de la srog chags rnams kyi srog / khrag gnas na ni gnas pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: is located in the blood.

original: de la srog chags rnams kyi srog ni shas cher khrag la gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la srog chags rnams kyi srog ni shas cher khrag la gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the life of living beings is mostly located in the blood.

original: de'i nang na gnas zhing skyon med na ni /
analyzed: de'i nang na gnas zhing skyon med na ni /
translated: And if it is located there and is not damaged,

original: srog de yang gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: srog de yang gnas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then that life will remain.

original: de bas gnad min legs phog ni //
analyzed: de bas gnad min legs phog ni //
translated: Therefore, if one is struck in a non-vital part,

original: nges par 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: one will not certainly die.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard,

original: gang gi phyir gnad de phug cing chod pas ni srog chags 'chi bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnad de phug cing chod pas ni srog chags 'chi bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: because that vital part is pierced and cut, it causes the death of a living being.

original: gzhan du snad cing rma byung ba tsam gyis ni 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du snad cing rma byung ba tsam gyis ni 'chi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But otherwise, by merely being wounded and injured, one will not die.

original: de bas na gnad ma yin par log par phog cing snad par gyur na /🔽mda' brgya phog kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnad ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gnad ma yin par log par phog cing snad par gyur na / mda' brgya phog kyang 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnad ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, if one is struck and injured in a non-vital part,🔽even if struck by a hundred arrows, one will not die.🔽But if one is struck in a vital part,

original: 'ga' zhig sman pa'i yon tan dang // phyogs gcig tu ni phog pa yis //🔽'tsho bar gyur yang de yi ni //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig sman pa'i yon tan dang // phyogs gcig tu ni phog pa yis // 'tsho bar gyur yang de yi ni //
translated: even if struck by a single arrow, one will die.🔽And if one is struck in a vital part,

original: dbang po ma tshang nyid du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang nyid du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: even if one lives, one will have incomplete faculties.

original: gang gi phyir srog chags 'ga' zhig gnad du phog ba yod na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog chags 'ga' zhig gnad du phog ba yod na /
translated: Because if some living being is hit in a vital part,

original: yang sman pa mkhas pas bcos ba'i yon tan nam /
analyzed: yang sman pa mkhas pas bcos ba'i yon tan nam /
translated: even though the skilled physician has the good quality of being able to treat it,

original: gnad kyi phyogs gcig gi mthar phog pas gnad du phog kyang 'tsho bar 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gnad kyi phyogs gcig gi mthar phog pas gnad du phog kyang 'tsho bar 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: or even though the arrow only hits one part of the vital part, the person will still live.

original: 'on kyang de'i dbang po mtshang zhing zha bo'am 'theng po nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i dbang po mtshang zhing zha bo'am 'theng po nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: However, his sense faculties will be damaged, and he will become crippled or lame.

original: de bas 'bad de gnad du ni //
analyzed: de bas 'bad de gnad du ni //
translated: Therefore, with effort,🔽avoid hitting the vital parts,

original: thal sman me btsa' la sogs spang //🔽zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: thal sman me btsa' la sogs spang // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: and avoid strong medicine, cauterization, and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir gnad la phog cing snad pa ni gnod ba dang bcas shing srog la gnod pa byed ba yin ba de bas na thal sman rnon po dang / me btsa' gdab ba la sogs pa yang gnad du mi bya bar spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnad la phog cing snad pa ni gnod ba dang bcas shing srog la gnod pa byed ba yin ba de bas na thal sman rnon po dang / me btsa' gdab ba la sogs pa yang gnad du mi bya bar spang bar bya'o //
translated: Because if you hit the vital parts and injure them, you will be harmed and your life will be in danger. Therefore, you should avoid hitting the vital parts with strong medicine, cauterization, and so forth.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni bse shing gi 'bras bu dang / ka pid tha'i khu ba la @57b sogs pa dag 'bad de gnad du ma phog par spang zhing dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni bse shing gi 'bras bu dang / ka pid tha'i khu ba la @57b sogs pa dag 'bad de gnad du ma phog par spang zhing dor bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” in the root text refers to the fruit of the sleshmantaka tree and the juice of the kapitana plant, and so on.

original: gnang du phog na chung ngus kyang //
analyzed: gnang du phog na chung ngus kyang //
translated: If you strike a vital point, even a small injury

original: phal cher shin tu gnod pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phal cher shin tu gnod pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: can be very harmful.

original: gang gi phyir gnad du phog na tshabs chung dus kyang phal cher zhes ba mang du shin tu gnod cing sdug bsngal bar byed pa yin no //🔽de bzhin gnad la brten pa'i nad //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnad du phog na tshabs chung dus kyang phal cher zhes ba mang du shin tu gnod cing sdug bsngal bar byed pa yin no // de bzhin gnad la brten pa'i nad //
translated: The phrase “can be very harmful” means that even a small injury can be very harmful.🔽You should treat with great care

original: rab tu 'bad pas gso bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽gnad du phog cing snad pa la 'ba' zhig gis gnod pa skyed par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rab tu 'bad pas gso bar bya // zhes bya ba la / gnad du phog cing snad pa la 'ba' zhig gis gnod pa skyed par ma zad kyi /
translated: an illness that is located in a vital point.🔽The phrase “located in a vital point” means that not only does an injury to a vital point cause harm,

original: gnad rnams kyang gnad rnams la brten cing gnas par gyur na /
analyzed: gnad rnams kyang gnad rnams la brten cing gnas par gyur na /
translated: but also when vital points are injured and damaged,

original: mtshon gyis phog ba dang 'dra bar gnod pa skyed pa yin pas /
analyzed: mtshon gyis phog ba dang 'dra bar gnod pa skyed pa yin pas /
translated: they cause harm as if you had been struck by a weapon.

original: de ni shin tu 'bad cing brtson pas gso dgos pa'am /
analyzed: de ni shin tu 'bad cing brtson pas gso dgos pa'am /
translated: Therefore, you should treat with great care🔽an illness that is located in a vital point.

original: 'bad pas gsos kyang 'tsho ba dka' ba yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'bad pas gsos kyang 'tsho ba dka' ba yin par ston to //
translated: It is taught that even if one tries to nurture it, it is difficult to keep it alive.🔽The Moonbeams of the Meaning of the Words, a commentary that condenses the essence of the eight branches

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po bsdus pa'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po bsdus pa'i rnam par 'grel pa tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
translated: The Moonbeams of the Meaning of the Words: A Commentary on the Condensed Essence of the Eight Branches🔽

original: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las ;
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas rnam par sbyar ba las ;
translated: was composed by the master Candrakīrti.

original: lus kyi gnad kyi le'u bzhi pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
analyzed: lus kyi gnad kyi le'u bzhi pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the fourth chapter, on the vital points of the body.

original: // / de la lus kyi 'gyur ba'i bye brag shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / de la lus kyi 'gyur ba'i bye brag shes par bya ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, the chapter on the knowledge of the specific changes in the body should be explained.

original: gnad kyi bye brag shes par byas pa'i 'og tu 'di brtsams pa'i dgos pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gnad kyi bye brag shes par byas pa'i 'og tu 'di brtsams pa'i dgos pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The purpose of composing this after the knowledge of the specific vital points is as follows.

original: 'chi bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnad ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'chi bar byed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gnad ces bya ba la /
translated: Because it is the cause of death, it is called “vital point.”

original: 'chi ba de yang rang bzhin snga ma las 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid 'chi ltas kyi rnam par 'gro ba rnams sngar gnas pas na /
analyzed: 'chi ba de yang rang bzhin snga ma las 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid 'chi ltas kyi rnam par 'gro ba rnams sngar gnas pas na /
translated: Moreover, death is the movement of the signs of death, which are characterized by a change from the previous natural state.

original: 'dir smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir smos pa yin no //
translated: Since these are the first to occur, they are mentioned here.

original: lus kyi 'gyur ba ni rang bzhin snga ma las gzhan du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyi 'gyur ba ni rang bzhin snga ma las gzhan du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The change of the body is the transformation from the previous nature.

original: de'i bye brag gam khyad par shes shing rtogs par bya na /
analyzed: de'i bye brag gam khyad par shes shing rtogs par bya na /
translated: If one wishes to understand the specific or particular features of that,

original: gang na yod pa de bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gang na yod pa de bshad par bya'o //
translated: then that which exists should be explained.

original: zhes pa'o // 'gyur ba de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'gyur ba de ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is that change like?

original: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽Just as a fruit, a flower,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu me tog dang // me yi du ba char gyi sprin //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu me tog dang // me yi du ba char gyi sprin //
translated: smoke from fire, and rain clouds

original: phyis 'byung mtshan ma yin pa ltar //🔽de bzhin 'chi ltas las nges 'chi //
analyzed: phyis 'byung mtshan ma yin pa ltar // de bzhin 'chi ltas las nges 'chi //
translated: are signs of what will come later,

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽tshul ji ltar 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sngon du me tog 'byung ba dang / me 'byung ba'i sngon du du ba 'byung ba dang / char 'bab pa'i dus su sprin 'dus pa dag ni rgyu sngar byung ba 'bras bu phyis 'byung ba'i mtshan ma yin pa ltar /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / tshul ji ltar 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sngon du me tog 'byung ba dang / me 'byung ba'i sngon du du ba 'byung ba dang / char 'bab pa'i dus su sprin 'dus pa dag ni rgyu sngar byung ba 'bras bu phyis 'byung ba'i mtshan ma yin pa ltar /
translated: so the signs of death are certain from the signs of death.

original: tshul de bzhin du rang bzhin las gzhan du 'gyur ba las 'chi bar shes par @58a * //
analyzed: tshul de bzhin du rang bzhin las gzhan du 'gyur ba las 'chi bar shes par @58a * //
translated: Here, just as a flower is a sign of what will come later, the fruit, smoke is a sign of what will come later, the fire, and the gathering of clouds is a sign of what will come later, rain, in the same way, one should understand death from the transformation of the nature.

original: 'gyur ba'i ltas sam mtshan ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i ltas sam mtshan ma yin pas /
translated: Because they are signs or indications of change.

original: de las phyis nges par 'chi bar 'gyur bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de las phyis nges par 'chi bar 'gyur bar ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that later, one will certainly die.

original: 'chi ltas med na mi 'chi la //
analyzed: 'chi ltas med na mi 'chi la //
translated: If there were no signs of death, one would not die.

original: 'chi ltas snang na 'tsho mi 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽gang la sngar 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma'i ltas med na /
analyzed: 'chi ltas snang na 'tsho mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la / gang la sngar 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma'i ltas med na /
translated: If the signs of death appear, one will not live.🔽If there were no signs of death, one would not die.

original: ltas kyis mtshon pa'i 'chi bar yang med pas mi 'chi la /🔽de bzhin du 'chi ltas snang ba las kyang 'tsho bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //🔽'chi ltas 'chi ltas min zhes pa //
analyzed: ltas kyis mtshon pa'i 'chi bar yang med pas mi 'chi la / de bzhin du 'chi ltas snang ba las kyang 'tsho bar 'gyur ba ma yin no // 'chi ltas 'chi ltas min zhes pa //
translated: If the signs of death appear, one will not live.

original: mi mkhas 'chi ltas med min shes //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽yang dag par na gang 'chi ltas nyid du ston par 'os pas de la yang 'chi ltas ma yin par shes la /
analyzed: mi mkhas 'chi ltas med min shes // zhes bya ba la / yang dag par na gang 'chi ltas nyid du ston par 'os pas de la yang 'chi ltas ma yin par shes la /
translated: The unwise do not know that the absence of signs of death is not the absence of death.🔽If one is not wise, one does not know that the absence of signs of death is not the absence of death.🔽If one is wise, one knows that the absence of signs of death is not the absence of death.

original: 'chi ltas med pa dag la yang 'chi ltas med pa mi shes te /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ltas med pa dag la yang 'chi ltas med pa mi shes te /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If one is wise, one knows that the absence of signs of death is not the absence of death.🔽If one is wise, one knows that the absence of signs of death is not the absence of death.🔽If one is wise, one knows that the absence of signs of death is not the absence of death.

original: mi mkhas shing 'chi ltas dang 'chi ltas ma yin pa shes pa la ma byang bas /
analyzed: mi mkhas shing 'chi ltas dang 'chi ltas ma yin pa shes pa la ma byang bas /
translated: Because they are unskilled and not learned in the signs of death and the non-signs of death,

original: 'chi ltas yod med mi shes pa yin no //🔽la la rten dang brten pa po'i //
analyzed: 'chi ltas yod med mi shes pa yin no // la la rten dang brten pa po'i //
translated: they do not know the signs of death and the non-signs of death.🔽Some assert those two

original: khyad par gyis de gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: khyad par gyis de gnyis su 'dod //
translated: through the difference between the support and the supported.

original: nad kyi tshul ni mang po las //
analyzed: nad kyi tshul ni mang po las //
translated: From the many modes of illness,

original: 'chi ltas tshul du 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'chi ltas tshul du 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: the signs of death arise.

original: nad zhi na ni zhi 'gyur la //
analyzed: nad zhi na ni zhi 'gyur la //
translated: If the illness is pacified, it is pacified;

original: brtan par gnas na 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: brtan par gnas na 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: if it remains stable, it is death.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽yang sman pa gzhan dag ni 'chi ltas de rten gyi lus dang / brten pa'i nad la sogs pa khyad par gyis te ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / yang sman pa gzhan dag ni 'chi ltas de rten gyi lus dang / brten pa'i nad la sogs pa khyad par gyis te ;
translated: Here,

original: rnam pa gnyis su 'dod la /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su 'dod la /
translated: other physicians assert those two signs of death through the difference between the supported body and the support of the illness and so on.

original: de yang rlung la sogs pa'i nad kyi tshul rnam pa mang po las 'chi ltas gyi tshul du snang zhing 'byung bar 'gyur bde dag las rlung la sogs pa'i nad zhi bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de yang rlung la sogs pa'i nad kyi tshul rnam pa mang po las 'chi ltas gyi tshul du snang zhing 'byung bar 'gyur bde dag las rlung la sogs pa'i nad zhi bar 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, from the many modes of illness such as wind and so on, the signs of death appear and arise. If those are pacified,

original: de las byung ba mtshan ma yang zhi bar 'gyur la ma zhi bar brtan par gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de las byung ba mtshan ma yang zhi bar 'gyur la ma zhi bar brtan par gnas pa ni /
translated: The signs that arise from that are also pacified, and it abides stably without being pacified.

original: de nges par 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur bas 'chi ltas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nges par 'chi ba nyid du 'gyur bas 'chi ltas zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is certain that it will die, it is called a sign of death.

original: zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say:🔽Form, faculties, voice, complexion,🔽reflection, action, and so on

original: gzugs dang dbang po skad dang mdog / gzugs brnyan bya ba sogs pa dang // dngos po dag ni gzhan la yang //
analyzed: gzugs dang dbang po skad dang mdog / gzugs brnyan bya ba sogs pa dang // dngos po dag ni gzhan la yang //
translated: are different from ordinary

original: tha mal pa las rgyu med par //
analyzed: tha mal pa las rgyu med par //
translated: without cause.

original: gzhan du gyur gang mdor gang ni //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur gang mdor gang ni //
translated: In brief, whatever is

original: 'chi ltas yin par de shes bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'chi ltas yin par de shes bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: a sign of death should be known.

original: gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyi bas kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni kha dog dang dbyi bas kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Form is the aspect of color and shape.

original: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: Faculties are the eye and so on.

original: skad ni nga ro'o //
analyzed: skad ni nga ro'o //
translated: Voice is sound.

original: mdog ni 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: mdog ni 'byung ba chen po lnga'i rang bzhin rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: Complexion is the five aspects that are the nature of the five great elements.

original: gzugs brnyan ni nyi ma dang chu dang me long la sogs par gang zhig snang ba'i gzugs dang mthun @58b par byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan ni nyi ma dang chu dang me long la sogs par gang zhig snang ba'i gzugs dang mthun @58b par byung ba'o //
translated: Reflection is that which arises in accordance with the form that appears in the sun, water, a mirror, and so on.

original: bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya ba ni /
translated: Action is

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las su bya ba'i rnam pa mang po'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las su bya ba'i rnam pa mang po'o //
translated: The many kinds of actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lus su gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan dag kyang bsku'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba ni lus su gtogs pa'i dngos po gzhan dag kyang bsku'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes other things that are included among the bodily things.

original: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por gtogs pa de dag dang / 'dir smos pa'i rnam pa gzhan dag ste //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos por gtogs pa de dag dang / 'dir smos pa'i rnam pa gzhan dag ste //
translated: Thus, those things that are included among the bodily things, such as form, and the other kinds of things mentioned here,

original: blo dang dran pa dang rang bzhin brtan pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa dag tha ma la pa ste /
analyzed: blo dang dran pa dang rang bzhin brtan pa la sogs pa'i sems kyi spyod pa dag tha ma la pa ste /
translated: and the mental activities such as intelligence, memory, and firmness of nature,

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa las rgyu med pa ste 'gyur pa'i rgyu yang med bzhin du glo bur gzhan du 'gyur zhing snang ba mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa las rgyu med pa ste 'gyur pa'i rgyu yang med bzhin du glo bur gzhan du 'gyur zhing snang ba mdor bsdu na /
translated: are suddenly transformed and appear to be different, without any cause, and without any cause for their transformation.

original: de lta bu gang yin pa de ni 'chi ltas yin pa shes par bya'i //
analyzed: de lta bu gang yin pa de ni 'chi ltas yin pa shes par bya'i //
translated: One should know that such a thing is a sign of death.

original: rgyu gang yang rung ba las gzhan du gyur pa ni 'chi ltas su ni gzung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu gang yang rung ba las gzhan du gyur pa ni 'chi ltas su ni gzung ngo //
translated: Any change from any cause whatsoever is to be taken as a sign of death.

original: skra dang ba spu ma bskus par //
analyzed: skra dang ba spu ma bskus par //
translated: The hair and body hair become unkempt,

original: snum gyis bskus ltar gang snang dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snum gyis bskus ltar gang snang dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the body appears as if unanointed with oil.

original: 'gro ba gang zhig skra dang spu rnams ma bskus par bskus shing byugs pa ltar snang ba de yang /
analyzed: 'gro ba gang zhig skra dang spu rnams ma bskus par bskus shing byugs pa ltar snang ba de yang /
translated: Any being whose hair and body hair appear as if unanointed but anointed and smeared,

original: dus kyis bskus shing 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dus kyis bskus shing 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: will be anointed by time and will die.🔽One whose eyes are unsteady,

original: gang zhig mig ni rab g-yo dang // mi 'gyur phyir byung khung bur zhugs //
analyzed: gang zhig mig ni rab g-yo dang // mi 'gyur phyir byung khung bur zhugs //
translated: unmoving, protruding, or sunken,🔽crooked, staring, or closed,🔽narrowed, with lowered eyebrows,🔽confused, with impaired vision,

original: yo dang bgrad dang 'dzums pa dang // bcum zhing smin ma smad pa dang // 'khrul dang mthong ba nyams pa dang // sre mo'i mig ltar blta ba dang // thi ba 'dra dang mgal me 'dra //
analyzed: yo dang bgrad dang 'dzums pa dang // bcum zhing smin ma smad pa dang // 'khrul dang mthong ba nyams pa dang // sre mo'i mig ltar blta ba dang // thi ba 'dra dang mgal me 'dra //
translated: looking like a cat’s eyes,🔽like a pigeon, or like a firebrand,

original: mchi ma 'dzag cing rdzi ma 'khrugs //
analyzed: mchi ma 'dzag cing rdzi ma 'khrugs //
translated: with tears flowing and eyelashes trembling,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this way,

original: de bzhin du mi gang zhig mig rab tu g-yo zhing 'gul ba dang / yang na mi 'gyur zhing har har por 'dug pa dang / yang na phyir 'byung zhing glo ba dang / yang na mig 'bras khong du zhugs shing gting du song bar snang ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi gang zhig mig rab tu g-yo zhing 'gul ba dang / yang na mi 'gyur zhing har har por 'dug pa dang / yang na phyir 'byung zhing glo ba dang / yang na mig 'bras khong du zhugs shing gting du song bar snang ba dang /
translated: one whose eyes are very unsteady and moving, or unmoving and staring, or protruding and deep-set,

original: yo zhing ma snyoms par snang ba dang / lhag par bgrad cing gdangs pa dang / de bzhin du shas cher 'dzums shing mi 'byed pa dang / smin ma bcum zhing 'dus pa 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: yo zhing ma snyoms par snang ba dang / lhag par bgrad cing gdangs pa dang / de bzhin du shas cher 'dzums shing mi 'byed pa dang / smin ma bcum zhing 'dus pa 'gyur ba'am /
translated: the eyebrows are drawn together and move;🔽they are especially low and sunken;🔽they are seen to be confused and wrong;🔽the sight is impaired and dull;🔽they look like the eyes of a cat;

original: khyad par du smad cing dma' bar gyur pa dang / yang de bzhin du 'khrul par mthong zhing log par mthong ba dang / mthong ba nyams shing rtul ba dang / de bzhin du sre mo'i mig ltar blta ba dang / thi ba'i mdog ltar snang ba dang /
analyzed: khyad par du smad cing dma' bar gyur pa dang / yang de bzhin du 'khrul par mthong zhing log par mthong ba dang / mthong ba nyams shing rtul ba dang / de bzhin du sre mo'i mig ltar blta ba dang / thi ba'i mdog ltar snang ba dang /
translated: they appear like the color of a dove;🔽they appear like a whirling firebrand;🔽tears flow and appear without cause;

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo bskor ba lta bur snang ba dang / rgyu med par mchi ma 'dzag cing 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rdzi ma 'khrugs shing g-yo bar 'gyur ba ste /🔽de dag kyang nad la @59a * //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo bskor ba lta bur snang ba dang / rgyu med par mchi ma 'dzag cing 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du rdzi ma 'khrugs shing g-yo bar 'gyur ba ste / de dag kyang nad la @59a * //
translated: and the eyelids twitch and move.

original: sogs pa'i rgyu med par snang ba ni 'chi ltas yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i rgyu med par snang ba ni 'chi ltas yin no //
translated: These appearances without a cause such as a disease are signs of death.

original: sna ni shin tu gdangs pa dang // zhom dang 'brum phran gyis khyab dang // skrang dang gas dang rnyid pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sna ni shin tu gdangs pa dang // zhom dang 'brum phran gyis khyab dang // skrang dang gas dang rnyid pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: swollen, cracked, and dry.

original: de bzhin du gang zhig gi sna rgyu med par glo bur du gdangs shing yangs par snang ba'am ;
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig gi sna rgyu med par glo bur du gdangs shing yangs par snang ba'am ;
translated: As such, the nose of someone who suddenly, without cause, appears very open and wide,

original: yang na zhom zhing 'dus par 'gyur /
analyzed: yang na zhom zhing 'dus par 'gyur /
translated: or else becomes swollen and constricted,

original: 'brum phran rnams kyis kyang khyab cing gang ba dang / skrang zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / gas shing pags pa zhig pa ltar snang ba dang / rnyid cing skams pa yang 'chi ltas yin no //
analyzed: 'brum phran rnams kyis kyang khyab cing gang ba dang / skrang zhing rgyas par 'gyur ba dang / gas shing pags pa zhig pa ltar snang ba dang / rnyid cing skams pa yang 'chi ltas yin no //
translated: covered and filled with small pox, swollen and expanded, appearing as if the skin is cracked and split, and dry and withered, is a sign of death.🔽The lower lip hangs down,🔽the upper lip is turned up,

original: gang gi ma mchu 'phyang ba dang // ya mchu gyen du brdzes pa dang // gnyi ga 'dzam bu smin 'drar snang //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi ma mchu 'phyang ba dang // ya mchu gyen du brdzes pa dang // gnyi ga 'dzam bu smin 'drar snang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: both appear like a ripe mango.🔽A person's lower lip hangs down,🔽the upper lip is turned up and reversed,

original: dri nga ba yid du 'ong ba'am mi 'ong ba 'byung bar 'gyur pa dang / gang gi gos la rma'am dri ma la mi ma yin pa'i dri byung na de ni lo gcig nas 'chi bar 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: dri nga ba yid du 'ong ba'am mi 'ong ba 'byung bar 'gyur pa dang / gang gi gos la rma'am dri ma la mi ma yin pa'i dri byung na de ni lo gcig nas 'chi bar 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: or if the clothes smell of wounds or dirt from a non-human, then after one year, they will die.

original: gang zhig shig dang sprang ma sogs //
analyzed: gang zhig shig dang sprang ma sogs //
translated: If lice, ants, and so on

original: dri zhim pas ni 'du ba'am /
analyzed: dri zhim pas ni 'du ba'am /
translated: One who is attracted by a sweet smell

original: dri nga ba yis spong gyur na //
analyzed: dri nga ba yis spong gyur na //
translated: or who flees from a bad smell

original: de ni lo gcig las mi 'tsho //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽mi gang zhig la shig dang sprang ma la sogs pa dri zhim po bro bas 'du shing 'phungs par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de ni lo gcig las mi 'tsho // zhes bya ba la / mi gang zhig la shig dang sprang ma la sogs pa dri zhim po bro bas 'du shing 'phungs par gyur pa'am /
translated: will not live even a year.

original: yang na dri nga ba'i dbang gis spang zhing lus 'dor bar 'gyur ba de yang lo gcig las mi 'tsho'o //🔽gang zhig rtag tu lus tsha ba //
analyzed: yang na dri nga ba'i dbang gis spang zhing lus 'dor bar 'gyur ba de yang lo gcig las mi 'tsho'o // gang zhig rtag tu lus tsha ba //
translated: One who is attracted by a sweet smell, such as a bee or a fly, or who flees from a bad smell, will not live even a year.🔽One who always feels heat in the body,

original: grang ba nyid du snang ba dang // bsil ba shin tu tsha bar snang //🔽rgyu med par ni rdul dang rengs //
analyzed: grang ba nyid du snang ba dang // bsil ba shin tu tsha bar snang // rgyu med par ni rdul dang rengs //
translated: who feels cold even when it is warm,

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽yang skyes bu gang zhig rgyu med par rtag tu lus tsha ba 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / yang skyes bu gang zhig rgyu med par rtag tu lus tsha ba 'ur 'ur por 'dug pa'am /
translated: who feels a prickly sensation without a cause,🔽One who always feels heat in the body, a prickly sensation,🔽who feels cold even when it is warm,

original: rtag tu grang zhing bsil bar snang ba dang / lus bsil ba nyid la yang shin tu tsha ba dang / de bzhin du @61a * //
analyzed: rtag tu grang zhing bsil bar snang ba dang / lus bsil ba nyid la yang shin tu tsha ba dang / de bzhin du @61a * //
translated: who feels a prickly sensation without a cause,

original: rgyu med par shas cher rdul ba dang / grang zhing rengs pa de yang lo gcig las mi 'tsho'o //
analyzed: rgyu med par shas cher rdul ba dang / grang zhing rengs pa de yang lo gcig las mi 'tsho'o //
translated: and without cause, he is often cold and stiff. He will not live more than a year.

original: gang zhig grang ba'i chu bur 'byung //
analyzed: gang zhig grang ba'i chu bur 'byung //
translated: He who has cold blisters

original: lus grang ba las tsha ba skye //
analyzed: lus grang ba las tsha ba skye //
translated: and whose body is cold and hot

original: grang gdungs than la mi dga' ba //
analyzed: grang gdungs than la mi dga' ba //
translated: and who does not like the heat of the cold

original: de ni gshin rje'i dbang gyur yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni gshin rje'i dbang gyur yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is under the power of Yama.

original: skyes bu gang lus grang bar gyur kyang /🔽chu bur 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: skyes bu gang lus grang bar gyur kyang / chu bur 'byung ba'am /
translated: He who, although his body is cold,🔽has cold blisters

original: lus grang ba las tsha ba skyes pa dang / grang bas gdungs kyang tsha ba'i than pa la mi dga' na /
analyzed: lus grang ba las tsha ba skyes pa dang / grang bas gdungs kyang tsha ba'i than pa la mi dga' na /
translated: and whose body is cold and hot and who, although tormented by the cold, does not like the heat of the cold,

original: de ni gshin rje'i dbang du gyur cing 'chi ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni gshin rje'i dbang du gyur cing 'chi ba yin no //
translated: is under the power of Yama and will die.

original: gang gi snying ga dro gyur la //🔽lto ba shin tu grang gyur cing //
analyzed: gang gi snying ga dro gyur la // lto ba shin tu grang gyur cing //
translated: He whose chest is warm🔽and whose belly is very cold,

original: bshang ba 'khru zhing skom dad che //
analyzed: bshang ba 'khru zhing skom dad che //
translated: whose excrement is loose and who is very thirsty,

original: de ni ro dang 'dra ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni ro dang 'dra ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is like a corpse.

original: skyes bu gang gi snying ga dro zhing tsha bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: skyes bu gang gi snying ga dro zhing tsha bar gyur kyang /
translated: He who, although his chest is warm and hot,

original: lto ba shin tu grang bar gyur pa dang / bshang ba sla zhing 'khru ba dang / skom dad che zhing skom pas gdungs pa de yang gson bzhin du ro dang 'dra ste 'chi ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lto ba shin tu grang bar gyur pa dang / bshang ba sla zhing 'khru ba dang / skom dad che zhing skom pas gdungs pa de yang gson bzhin du ro dang 'dra ste 'chi ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: If the belly becomes very cold, if there is loose or frequent bowel movements, if there is a great desire to drink and if one is tormented by thirst, then even though one is alive, one should know that one is dead, like a corpse.

original: bshang dang gci ba mchil snabs dang // khu chu chu nang nub gyur pa'am //
analyzed: bshang dang gci ba mchil snabs dang // khu chu chu nang nub gyur pa'am //
translated: If feces, urine, spittle, mucus, semen, or urine sink in water,

original: mchil ma kha dog sna tshogs dang // gang yin pa de zla gcig 'chi //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchil ma kha dog sna tshogs dang // gang yin pa de zla gcig 'chi // zhes bya ba la /
translated: or if one’s spittle has various colors, then one will die in a month.

original: srog chags gang gi bshang ba la sogs pa chu'i nang du nub cing 'og tu 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: srog chags gang gi bshang ba la sogs pa chu'i nang du nub cing 'og tu 'gro ba'am /
translated: If the feces, etc., of any living being sink in water and go down,

original: gang gi mchil ma kha dog mang zhing sna tshogs par snang na /
analyzed: gang gi mchil ma kha dog mang zhing sna tshogs par snang na /
translated: or if one’s spittle appears to have many different colors,

original: de yang zla ba gcig gis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang zla ba gcig gis 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then one will die in a month.

original: sa ni nam mkhar mthong ba dang // nam mkha' sar ni mthong gyur dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa ni nam mkhar mthong ba dang // nam mkha' sar ni mthong gyur dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one sees earth in the sky, or if one sees the sky as earth,

original: skyes bu gang gis sra zhing stug pa'i sa ni nam mkha'i bar snang du gyur par mthong ba dang / nam mkha' yang sa'i rnam pa ltar gzugs can du mthong ba gang yang rung ba de ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gis sra zhing stug pa'i sa ni nam mkha'i bar snang du gyur par mthong ba dang / nam mkha' yang sa'i rnam pa ltar gzugs can du mthong ba gang yang rung ba de ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The person who sees the solid and dense earth as the space of the sky, and the sky as having the form of the earth, will die.

original: zhes thog ma dang thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes thog ma dang thams cad la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to all the beginning and end of the passage.🔽One sees the formless as having form,

original: gzugs med gzugs can lta bu dang // gzugs can gzugs med lta bur mthong //
analyzed: gzugs med gzugs can lta bu dang // gzugs can gzugs med lta bur mthong //
translated: and the form as formless.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: dngos po gang gzugs med cing bltar med pa de gzugs can snang ba ltar mthong ba dang / gzugs can gyi rnam pa la la gzugs med pa ltar gnas par mthong zhing 'khrul pa de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po gang gzugs med cing bltar med pa de gzugs can snang ba ltar mthong ba dang / gzugs can gyi rnam pa la la gzugs med pa ltar gnas par mthong zhing 'khrul pa de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the person who sees the formless and invisible thing as having the appearance of form, and the form as having the appearance of the formless, will die.

original: de bzhin 'od chen 'od med mthong //
analyzed: de bzhin 'od chen 'od med mthong //
translated: One sees the great light as no light,

original: dkar po gnag dang yod pa med //
analyzed: dkar po gnag dang yod pa med //
translated: the white as black, and the existent as nonexistent.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this passage,

original: yang de bzhin du me la sogs pa'i @61b 'od can gang yin pa 'od med par mthong ba dang / dkar po ni nag por mthong la /
analyzed: yang de bzhin du me la sogs pa'i @61b 'od can gang yin pa 'od med par mthong ba dang / dkar po ni nag por mthong la /
translated: Likewise, one who sees as non-luminous that which is luminous, such as fire, and who sees white as black,

original: nag po ni dkar por mthong ba dang / yod pa ni med par mthong la /
analyzed: nag po ni dkar por mthong ba dang / yod pa ni med par mthong la /
translated: and black as white, and who sees as non-existent that which is existent,

original: med pa ni yod par mthong ba de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //🔽mig nad med par zla ba ni //
analyzed: med pa ni yod par mthong ba de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro // mig nad med par zla ba ni //
translated: and as existent that which is non-existent, will also die.🔽One who sees the moon🔽without eye-disease,

original: gzugs mngar ri med mthong dang // zhes bya ba la /🔽mig la nad kyi skyon med bzhin du zla ba gzugs du mar mthong /🔽ra ri med pa ste ri bong gi mtshan ma med pa mthong na de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs mngar ri med mthong dang // zhes bya ba la / mig la nad kyi skyon med bzhin du zla ba gzugs du mar mthong / ra ri med pa ste ri bong gi mtshan ma med pa mthong na de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: without spots,🔽will also die.🔽One who, without falling asleep, sees gandharvas,

original: gnyid ma log pa dri za srin //
analyzed: gnyid ma log pa dri za srin //
translated: rākṣasas,

original: yi dags gzhan yang de 'dra zhing //
analyzed: yi dags gzhan yang de 'dra zhing //
translated: pretas, and other such beings,

original: gzugs mi sdug par mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: gzugs mi sdug par mthong gyur pa //
translated: and who sees ugly forms,

original: gang yin de ni 'chi bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yin de ni 'chi bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: will die.

original: skyes bu gnyid kyis ma log par dri za la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang de 'dra ste mi'am ci dang / sha za la sogs pa dang / gzugs mi sdug pa 'dir ma smos su zin kyang /
analyzed: skyes bu gnyid kyis ma log par dri za la sogs pa dang / gzhan yang de 'dra ste mi'am ci dang / sha za la sogs pa dang / gzugs mi sdug pa 'dir ma smos su zin kyang /
translated: A person who does not fall asleep sees gandharvas and so on, and other such beings, such as kinnaras, flesh eaters and so on.

original: skye gnas tha dad pa phye ba'i mi ma yin pa de mthong bar gyur pa gang yin pa de yang 'chi zhing dus byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye gnas tha dad pa phye ba'i mi ma yin pa de mthong bar gyur pa gang yin pa de yang 'chi zhing dus byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though they are not mentioned here, non-humans who are born in different ways and are seen by that person will also die and pass away.

original: sme bdun dang ni nyer gnas pa'i //
analyzed: sme bdun dang ni nyer gnas pa'i //
translated: The seven moles and the nakṣatras🔽that obstruct the view, the nine

original: skar ma sgrib byed ma mthong dang // dgu tshigs gung tshugs ma mthong ba //
analyzed: skar ma sgrib byed ma mthong dang // dgu tshigs gung tshugs ma mthong ba //
translated: and the straight line,

original: de ni lo gcig mi 'tsho'i //
analyzed: de ni lo gcig mi 'tsho'i //
translated: that person will not live a year.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: skyes bu gang skar ma sme bdun dang nye bar gnas pa'i skar ma sgrib byed ces bya ba chung du zhig ma mthong ba dang / de bzhin du dgu tshigs zhes bya ba nam mkha'i gang g'a zhes grags pa dang / skar ma gung tshugs ma mthong ba de ni lo gcig mi 'tsho ste lo 'khor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gang skar ma sme bdun dang nye bar gnas pa'i skar ma sgrib byed ces bya ba chung du zhig ma mthong ba dang / de bzhin du dgu tshigs zhes bya ba nam mkha'i gang g'a zhes grags pa dang / skar ma gung tshugs ma mthong ba de ni lo gcig mi 'tsho ste lo 'khor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: A person who does not see the star called “obstructer” which is near the seven stars of the asterism mṛgaśira, and who does not see the asterism called “pūrvāṣāḍhā” which is the Ganges of the sky, and who does not see the asterism called “maghā” lives for one year and does not complete a year.

original: 'brug sgra chu bo'i sgra dang ni //
analyzed: 'brug sgra chu bo'i sgra dang ni //
translated: The sound of thunder, the sound of water,

original: gling bu pi wam rnga yi sgra //🔽sgra gzhan med par thos pa'am //
analyzed: gling bu pi wam rnga yi sgra // sgra gzhan med par thos pa'am //
translated: the sound of a flute, the sound of a lute, the sound of a drum,🔽if one hears these sounds without other sounds,

original: yod pa yang thos par ma gyur dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yod pa yang thos par ma gyur dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: or if one does not hear sounds that exist,

original: 'brug sgra nas rnga'i sgra'i bar gyi sgra rnams dang / sgra gzhan gang yin pa dag mi gzhan pa dag yod kyang ma thos pas de thos pa dang / de bzhin du 'brug sgra la sogs pa sgra rnams dang / sgra che ba gzhan dag grag par gyur ba gzhan yod du zin kyang mi thos pa ste /
analyzed: 'brug sgra nas rnga'i sgra'i bar gyi sgra rnams dang / sgra gzhan gang yin pa dag mi gzhan pa dag yod kyang ma thos pas de thos pa dang / de bzhin du 'brug sgra la sogs pa sgra rnams dang / sgra che ba gzhan dag grag par gyur ba gzhan yod du zin kyang mi thos pa ste /
translated: And likewise, the sounds of thunder and so on, and other loud sounds that are heard, are not heard even though they are present.

original: de lta bu de ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu de ni 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That is death.

original: zhes 'og nas smos pa'i tshig dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes 'og nas smos pa'i tshig dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with the words that will be stated below.

original: rna ba'i bu ga bkag pa yis //
analyzed: rna ba'i bu ga bkag pa yis //
translated: By blocking the ear holes,

original: 'ur 'ur po yi sgra mi thos //
analyzed: 'ur 'ur po yi sgra mi thos //
translated: the sound of a roaring fire is not heard.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this regard,

original: gang zhig rna ba'i bu ga sor mos bkag pa na /
analyzed: gang zhig rna ba'i bu ga sor mos bkag pa na /
translated: when someone blocks the ear holes with their fingers,

original: 'ur 'ur po'i sgra me 'bar ba'i sgra dang 'dra ba de mi thos pa yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ur 'ur po'i sgra me 'bar ba'i sgra dang 'dra ba de mi thos pa yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the sound of a roaring fire, which is like the sound of a burning fire, is not heard. That is death.

original: de bzhin dri dang @62a * //
analyzed: de bzhin dri dang @62a * //
translated: Likewise, smell,🔽taste, and touch,

original: ro dang reg / gang zhig log par shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ro dang reg / gang zhig log par shes pa dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: when someone has distorted cognition,

original: yang de bzhin du dri la sogs pa phyin ci log tu shes pa ste /🔽dri zhim pa ni dri nga bar 'dzin la /
analyzed: yang de bzhin du dri la sogs pa phyin ci log tu shes pa ste / dri zhim pa ni dri nga bar 'dzin la /
translated: Also, in the same way, one who has distorted knowledge of smell and so on🔽perceives a good smell as a bad smell,

original: dri nga ba ni dri zhim par 'dzin pa'am /🔽de bzhin du ro mngar ba yin yang /
analyzed: dri nga ba ni dri zhim par 'dzin pa'am / de bzhin du ro mngar ba yin yang /
translated: and a bad smell as a good smell.🔽Or, in the same way, one perceives a sweet taste

original: kha ba la sogs pa gang yang rung bar 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: kha ba la sogs pa gang yang rung bar 'dzin pa'am /
translated: as any other taste such as bitter,

original: kha ba mngar ba la sogs pa gang yang rung bar tshor ba'am /
analyzed: kha ba mngar ba la sogs pa gang yang rung bar tshor ba'am /
translated: and one experiences a bitter taste as sweet and so on.

original: de bzhin du reg bya yang 'jam pa ni rtsub par shes la /
analyzed: de bzhin du reg bya yang 'jam pa ni rtsub par shes la /
translated: Or, in the same way, one perceives a soft touch as rough,🔽and a cold touch as hot, and one has the error of perceiving the opposite of that.

original: grang ba ni tsha bar shes pa dang / de las go bzlog par shes pa'i 'khrul pa dang ldan pa de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grang ba ni tsha bar shes pa dang / de las go bzlog par shes pa'i 'khrul pa dang ldan pa de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, one who has that dies.

original: yang na yong ye mi tshor dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na yong ye mi tshor dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or, one who never experiences🔽anything at all,

original: yang rnam pa thams cad nas thams cad du dri la sogs pa mi tshor zhing yong ye mi shes pa de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang rnam pa thams cad nas thams cad du dri la sogs pa mi tshor zhing yong ye mi shes pa de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: who never experiences smell and so on in any way at all, who never knows anything at all, also dies.

original: me mar shi ba'i dri mi tshor //
analyzed: me mar shi ba'i dri mi tshor //
translated: One who does not experience the smell of a blown-out lamp

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: dies.

original: skyes bu gang zhig me mar shi bar gyur ba'i dri sna'i dbang pos mi tshor ba de yang 'chi ba'i ltas so //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zhig me mar shi bar gyur ba'i dri sna'i dbang pos mi tshor ba de yang 'chi ba'i ltas so //
translated: The person who does not smell the odor of a dying lamp is also a sign of death.

original: cho ga bzhin byas nad skyes la //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin byas nad skyes la //
translated: The person who is cured by the application of medical treatment according to the rules

original: cho ga log pas bder gnas dang // zhes bya ba la /🔽mi gang la sman dpyad kyi gzhung las byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du gso bar byas kyang /
analyzed: cho ga log pas bder gnas dang // zhes bya ba la / mi gang la sman dpyad kyi gzhung las byung ba'i cho ga bzhin du gso bar byas kyang /
translated: and the person who is well without being treated according to the rules🔽The person who is cured by the application of medical treatment according to the rules of the medical treatises,

original: nad skyed cing thu bar 'gyur ba dang yang gang zhig sman dpyad kyi cho ga ltar ma byas bar sbyor ba log par bsten du zin kyang bde bar gnas pa ltar byed ba de 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nad skyed cing thu bar 'gyur ba dang yang gang zhig sman dpyad kyi cho ga ltar ma byas bar sbyor ba log par bsten du zin kyang bde bar gnas pa ltar byed ba de 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but who is not cured by the application of medical treatment not according to the rules, will die.

original: gang gi lus ni rdul g-yogs 'dra //
analyzed: gang gi lus ni rdul g-yogs 'dra //
translated: The person whose body is covered with dust

original: lus la snad par mi tshor dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus la snad par mi tshor dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and who does not feel pain in his body

original: skyes bu gang zhig lus rdul gyis g-yogs shing phyag dar gyis khebs pa ltar rdul can gnas ba de yang mi 'tsho'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zhig lus rdul gyis g-yogs shing phyag dar gyis khebs pa ltar rdul can gnas ba de yang mi 'tsho'o //
translated: The person whose body is covered with dust and who is dirty, will die.

original: yang gang gi lus la mtshon gyis snad cing bcad kyang tshor ba med pa de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin no //🔽dka' thub drag dang cho ga ni //
analyzed: yang gang gi lus la mtshon gyis snad cing bcad kyang tshor ba med pa de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin no // dka' thub drag dang cho ga ni //
translated: Also, one whose body is cut and wounded by weapons but feels no sensation will die.

original: sngon 'gro'i rnal 'byor med pa ru //
analyzed: sngon 'gro'i rnal 'byor med pa ru //
translated: Those who have no prior yoga

original: dbang po las 'das shes pa skyes //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das shes pa skyes //
translated: and whose consciousness arises from beyond the senses

original: de rnams 'chi bar shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rnams 'chi bar shes par bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: should know that they will die.🔽Those who have no prior yoga of intense austerities and whose consciousness arises from beyond the senses, not an object of knowledge, such as the god realms, and so on, should know that they will die.

original: dka' thub drag po'i sbyor ba med par dbang po las 'das shing mi shes pa'i yul ma yin pa lha yul la sogs pa na yod cing shes pa'i shes pa skye ba dang / yang de bzhin du bstan bcos ji lta ba'i yang dag pa'i man ngag cho ga sngon du 'gro ba'i sems nang du bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor sems rtse gcig pa med par dbang po las 'das ba'i shes ba skye ba de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i ltas yin no
analyzed: dka' thub drag po'i sbyor ba med par dbang po las 'das shing mi shes pa'i yul ma yin pa lha yul la sogs pa na yod cing shes pa'i shes pa skye ba dang / yang de bzhin du bstan bcos ji lta ba'i yang dag pa'i man ngag cho ga sngon du 'gro ba'i sems nang du bsdus pa'i rnal 'byor sems rtse gcig pa med par dbang po las 'das ba'i shes ba skye ba de yang 'chi bar 'gyur ba'i ltas yin no
translated: Also, those who have no prior yoga of the mind, one-pointed concentration, of gathering the mind inward, and whose consciousness arises from beyond the senses, in accordance with the treatises, with the correct oral instructions and rites, should know that they will die.

original: // skad 'gags @62b dman zhing mi gsal dang // gang zhig skad ni 'dzer gyur dang // smra 'dod pa ni 'phral du ni //
analyzed: // skad 'gags @62b dman zhing mi gsal dang // gang zhig skad ni 'dzer gyur dang // smra 'dod pa ni 'phral du ni //
translated: 10. If a man’s voice is suddenly choked, weak, unclear, or if he stammers, or if he suddenly forgets what he wanted to say,

original: brjed 'gyur de ni mi 'tsho'o //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brjed 'gyur de ni mi 'tsho'o // zhes bya ba la /
translated: he will not live.

original: skyes bu gang glo bur du rang bzhin gyis skad 'gags nas dman zhing zhum pa dang ldan pa dang / mi gsal zhing brda sprod ma nus par gyur na de mi 'tsho 'o //🔽yang de bzhin du skad 'gyur zhing 'dzer ba dang / gang smra bar 'dod pa ni rgyu med par 'phral du brjed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skyes bu gang glo bur du rang bzhin gyis skad 'gags nas dman zhing zhum pa dang ldan pa dang / mi gsal zhing brda sprod ma nus par gyur na de mi 'tsho 'o // yang de bzhin du skad 'gyur zhing 'dzer ba dang / gang smra bar 'dod pa ni rgyu med par 'phral du brjed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If a man’s voice is suddenly choked, weak, and unclear, and if he is unable to communicate, he will not live.

original: ci yang smra bar mi nus pa de yang mi 'tsho'o //
analyzed: ci yang smra bar mi nus pa de yang mi 'tsho'o //
translated: Similarly, if his voice changes and he stammers, and if he suddenly forgets what he wanted to say for no reason, and if he is unable to say anything at all, he will not live.

original: skad gsang shin tu nyam chung 'gyur //
analyzed: skad gsang shin tu nyam chung 'gyur //
translated: 11. If a man’s voice becomes very weak,

original: mdog dang stobs ni nyams pa dang // rgyu med par ni nad 'phel bar //🔽snang ba dag kyang 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mdog dang stobs ni nyams pa dang // rgyu med par ni nad 'phel bar // snang ba dag kyang 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: if his complexion and strength diminish, if he becomes sick for no reason,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and if his perceptions change, he will die.

original: yang gang zhig smra ba'i skad gsang dma' bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin mdog dang stobs nyams shing bri ba dang / zas dang spyod lam la sogs pa'i nad skye ba'i rgyu med par nad 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur bar snang ba dag kyang mi 'tsho ste 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gang zhig smra ba'i skad gsang dma' bar 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin mdog dang stobs nyams shing bri ba dang / zas dang spyod lam la sogs pa'i nad skye ba'i rgyu med par nad 'phel zhing rgyas par 'gyur bar snang ba dag kyang mi 'tsho ste 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, one who speaks in a low voice, and likewise whose complexion and strength diminish and fade, and whose illness increases and spreads without a cause of illness such as diet and conduct, will not live but will die.🔽One whose voice is impaired,

original: skad gsang nyams par gyur ba dang // bdag nyid 'chi bar smra ba ste //
analyzed: skad gsang nyams par gyur ba dang // bdag nyid 'chi bar smra ba ste //
translated: and who speaks of his own death,🔽should completely avoid

original: de 'dra'i sgra ni thos pa dag / ring du yongs su spang bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de 'dra'i sgra ni thos pa dag / ring du yongs su spang bar bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: hearing such sounds.

original: rang bzhin gyis skad gsang nyams te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis skad gsang nyams te /
translated: One whose voice is impaired by nature,

original: skad kyi gsang gzhan du gyur pa dang / bdag nyid 'chi bar smra ba ste /
analyzed: skad kyi gsang gzhan du gyur pa dang / bdag nyid 'chi bar smra ba ste /
translated: whose voice is changed, and who speaks of his own death,🔽saying, “I am dying, I am dying,” and who hears such sounds,

original: kho bo ni 'chi'o 'chi'o zhes rtag tu smra ba dang / yang de lta bu'i sgra thos pa dang / khyed 'chi'o khyed ni 'chi'o ;
analyzed: kho bo ni 'chi'o 'chi'o zhes rtag tu smra ba dang / yang de lta bu'i sgra thos pa dang / khyed 'chi'o khyed ni 'chi'o ;
translated: “You are dying, you are dying,”

original: / zhes gzhan smra ba dag thos pa'i skyes bu de 'chi bar 'gyur bas ring du spang bar bya'i gso bar mi bya'o //🔽lus kyi dbyibs dang tshad dang ni //
analyzed: / zhes gzhan smra ba dag thos pa'i skyes bu de 'chi bar 'gyur bas ring du spang bar bya'i gso bar mi bya'o // lus kyi dbyibs dang tshad dang ni //
translated: Thus, having heard the words of others, one should avoid the person who is dying, and not treat him.🔽The shape, size,

original: mdog gam gzi mdangs gang dag gi //🔽gzugs brnyan 'gyur ba'i rmi lam du //
analyzed: mdog gam gzi mdangs gang dag gi // gzugs brnyan 'gyur ba'i rmi lam du //
translated: color, or luster of the body,🔽if one sees a change in the dream image,

original: mthong na der ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong na der ni 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: one will die there.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: lus kyi dbyibs ni ring thung la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dbyibs ni ring thung la sogs pa ste /
translated: the shape of the body is long, short, and so on.

original: de dag rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan par mthong ba dang / tshad ni chu zheng la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag rang gi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan par mthong ba dang / tshad ni chu zheng la sogs pa'o //
translated: If one sees those lacking their own characteristics, size is width, length, and so on.

original: mdog ni sngo bsangs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdog ni sngo bsangs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Color is pale, and so on.

original: gzi mdangs ni kha dog de nyid 'byes par byed cing ring nas gsal bar snang pa'o //
analyzed: gzi mdangs ni kha dog de nyid 'byes par byed cing ring nas gsal bar snang pa'o //
translated: Luster is the very color that illuminates and appears clearly from afar.

original: de ltar skyes bu'i dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa de dag gi gzugs gzhan du 'gyur zhing mi mthun par snang ba rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su mthong na yang skyes bu de 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar skyes bu'i dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa de dag gi gzugs gzhan du 'gyur zhing mi mthun par snang ba rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su mthong na yang skyes bu de 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Thus, when the form of a person’s shape and so on is seen to change and appear differently in a dream, that person will die.

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mthong ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i gnas skabs su mthong ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention when it is seen in the waking state?

original: nyi ma me long chu sogs la //
analyzed: nyi ma me long chu sogs la //
translated: In the sun, a mirror, water, and so on,

original: gang zhig dbyibs dang tshad dang ni //🔽lus kyi rnam pa snang gyur pa //
analyzed: gang zhig dbyibs dang tshad dang ni // lus kyi rnam pa snang gyur pa //
translated: whatever shape and size

original: gzugs @63a * //🔽brnyan zhes ni de la bshad //
analyzed: gzugs @63a * // brnyan zhes ni de la bshad //
translated: appear as the form of a body,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: that is called a reflection.

original: gang gi lus la nyi ma dang / me long dang chu la sogs pa lus kyi dbyibs dang tshad kyi rnam pa gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs can du 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi lus la nyi ma dang / me long dang chu la sogs pa lus kyi dbyibs dang tshad kyi rnam pa gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs can du 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ni gzugs brnyan zhes bya'o //
translated: In the body of someone in whom the shape and size of the body appear as the form of a reflection in the sun, a mirror, water, and so on, that is called a reflection.

original: mdog dang gzi mdangs la brten gang //🔽lus gtogs gzugs brnyan lta bu yin //
analyzed: mdog dang gzi mdangs la brten gang // lus gtogs gzugs brnyan lta bu yin //
translated: Whatever is based on complexion and radiance

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is like a reflection belonging to the body.
